Reviews.Title: “A bit better the second time around”
Reviews.Author: Samwise001
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel about 7 years ago on my last visit, then again this April 2012. I chose it primarily for the price and location to the Rome Termini. Hotel has definitely been updated. Our room (including bathroom) was updated. The breakfast area is nicer too - nice selection breakfast buffet served juices, eggs, pastries, bacon, prosciutto, coffee. Be aware which package you get, some include breakfast some don't, if not it's only about 8 euros per person - still well worth it. The people seemed pleasant, answering any questions necessary. Don't expect a big size room but I wasn't expecting to spend a lot of time in my room anyway. Wifi for a fee, but a lot of nearby cafes have Wifi for you. Though, not a lot of restaurants open late nearby. We tried to get something to eat around 10pm and things were closing up. McDonalds is just a few minutes away but does attract "all" sorts of folks due to location to Termini. But there's a lot of police around too - so never felt in danger or anything. Again, the best benefit was the location to the Rome Termini, less than a 5 minute walk. You can get to the Express to/fro the airport, Metro, which will take you to all major sites in Rome, plus the regional trains to Firenze, Venice, etc. Though other areas in Rome have more places open late, traveling with my young daughter, I didn't want to cab or pull luggage all over the place which made this place ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel.......”
Reviews.Author: Jay S
Reviews.Content: Traveling with 2 young kids, I must say, room was spacious, for the 4 of us. While it is very close to Roma's Termini station, which would take you to anywhere of the tourist sites in Rome, you see lots of characters passing by, which to some maybe uncomfortable but to a frequent traveler like us, it's ok. Good service all around, staff were helpful. Wifi didn't work in the rooms while we were there but we managed to sit in the lobby whenever we need to get connected.

Reviews.Title: “just returned from Rome”
Reviews.Author: broebi
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel after reading trip advisor. It is only 150 meters from the main station - very convenient. We got upgraded to a "deluxe room". The rooms are indeed very small but well maintained. The lighting, decoration, bathrooms - everything ok. Breakfast for 8.50 euro was good too. Friendly front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for short term stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall nice service and pleasant stay. Location not superb because of strange people in the streets around station Termini. I'd still recommend it for business trips or short vacation though.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: thebeeches1
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay in the Hotel Morgana over the Easter holidays. It was a family room for 4 and although a little cramped it was fresh and clean. The beds were a little hard but nothing that would warrant a complaint, we were only there for 3 nights. The hotel is well situated for the Termini train/metro station and the hop-on hop-off bus, which we used frequently. The staff were friendly and helpful, especially the gentleman in the bar! Breakfast was very busy but offers a good variety of choice. A good base to explore the eternal city!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: OrchardLodgeYork
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautifully decorated through out, we had 2 rooms adjoining as a Family room, the rooms were clean as were the en suite bath/shower rooms and checked/made up every day. Each room had safes too. Unfortunately the beds are very hard, so I found myself feeling very stiff in the mornings. There was no tea/coffee making facilities, but you could get room service. The Buffet Breakfast is a definite must, ranging from cereals, through cooked breakfast, to continental style breakfast - with no limitations. We had the windows open for airflow at night and had no disturbance from outside despite being only a street away from the very busy train station. The Train station also housed connections to both Metro's making it very easy to access the whole of Rome, which was much appreciated after spending the first 2 days on foot, exploring the many ancient and beautiful sites. There are lots of places to eat around the hotel, plus shops to buy necessities.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for exploring”
Reviews.Author: penguin67
Reviews.Content: Having travelled to Europe many times in the past, I was a bit nervous of what we would get. No need - our hotel room, although on the front of the hotel (a bit noisy at night, but fine if you shut the windows!) it was large (queen size bed), beautifully decorated and the bathroom was massive and all worked fine. We were on the 5th floor in 542. My son had a single room on the same floor and that was lovely too. Comfortable beds and pillows. The hotel staff were very helpful. The breakfast consisted of lots of choice and not just your normal continental breakfast. Pastrys, salad, cheeses, meats, fruit, cereals, bacon, egg, quiches, bread, fruit juice, coffee and tea. The hotel is situated close to the station which makes it ideal for the metro. Walking is the best way to see Rome, we found that in 1/2 you could get to the centre but we got the metro to the Vatican City. The area is no more unsafe than walking around London. Just be aware as you usually would. I went for a walk on my own in the evening and was fine and didn't feel unsafe (I am a 45 year old woman!!). We found a lovely restaurant about 15 minutes walk away called La Vecchia Conca in via Carlo Alberto which was absolutely superb and sooo friendly. I would certainly stay here again in the future. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: pinkspruce
Reviews.Content: Having travelled to Italy many times in the past, we are familiar with the small, dark rooms characteristic of many hotels in the country and so were unsurprised to find this was also the case in Hotel Morgana. However we were unhappy with the leaky shower, incredibly hard bed and pillows and especially disappointing after previous reviews- the poor breakfast! A few old danishes, undercooked bacon and terrible, artificial fruit juice do not equate a good breakfast for me. The area around Termini, where the hotel is situated, appeared to us to be very unsafe and we did not feel comfortable walking around the area in the evening. The restaurants in this area are also very poor and are not frequented by locals. I would not recommend the area or hotel to potential visitors.

Reviews.Title: “a quality experience at great price”
Reviews.Author: Dimitris N
Reviews.Content: (+) helpful, friendly, kind stuff great breakfast excellent value for money very close to central station (termini) (-) not in walking distance from many of Rome's hot spots

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & clean”
Reviews.Author: Mjsalute
Reviews.Content: We stay here often when traveling in Rome. It's very close to Termini which makes it a great location if your days involve jumping on & off trains & subways. The staff is very nice & knowledgable. The rooms are typical size for Roman hotels-but they are vey clean which is nice. Great breakfast but don't wait too long to get there as it gets very between 9-10. I didn't notice the area being noisy like some of the other reviewers but I'm from a big city so maybe I'm just immune . Not alot of options for good eats nearby- you'll definitely want to avoid the restaurants near the hotel- the proprietors are friendly but the food is not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy But Nice”
Reviews.Author: RealisticOxford
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights. The room was very warm and the air con didn't seem to work. It was noisy, especially with the window open! However it was clean, well situated, plentiful breakfast and courteous staff. Leaving luggage on our first and last days was no problem. Mini bar stocked on request. Prices ok. Nothing in Rome is cheap! We had a lovely time.

Reviews.Title: “Well Placed, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Frealan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very well positioned - just 5 minutes walk from Termini Station. Unfortunately, this did mean that the area was noisy. A benefit, though, was the multitude of cheapish eating places. The hotel staff were very helpful and courteous at all times. The room was clean, and big enough - what could be expected for an inexpensive city hotel. It could, however, have benefited from more drawer space. Our main criticism was the heat - our room was very warm, but the air conditioning was not working, so overnight, it was hot. Opening the window helped, but not only did this let in cooler air, it also let in the noise. Breakfast was excellent, with plenty of choice, and helpful waiters. Lovely bread, and proper cappuccino available on request! WiFi Internet access was available, but expensive at €10 for 1 day and €5 for subsequent days. We were able, at no extra charge, to check in for our flight and print boarding passes without any extra charge. This was helpful. Our home flight was cancelled on the day of travel, and the hotel staff were again helpful, and very willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “Staff who care”
Reviews.Author: djsharpe
Reviews.Content: Purchased 3 nights through British Airways at Hotel Morgana. Currently undergoing some renovation, the hotel provides good service. Convenient to Termini Station it is an easy walk to most parts of central Rome. The area is busy day and night. Although our room was a bit noisy for us, we were offered another room in the Annex, an apartment building a few minutes away where the hotel has the first floor. This was wonderful. From the marble staircase to the rickety old and small lift, it was a real Italian experience. The willingness to serve sets this hotel apart. Be aware that like many older buildings converted to hotels, there are lots of stairs and the lifts are small. The room vary in size and decoration. But this is all part of the charm. Breakfast was very good. Great Coffee. The staff should be congratulated for their excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: BQSS
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay in Rome and I would definitely recommend this hotel The staff could not have been more helpful,especially when it came to organising taxis and trying to contact British Airways when our flight had been cancelled. The public areas were very comfortable and an excellent buffet breakfast was available in the busy breakfast room.[nice touch that you could ask for capuccinos at breakfast without extra charge].The only complaint would be that the bedrooms although clean were small ,plumbing noisy and a very small shower cubicle with no storage space in the bathroom.The proximity to the Termini was a plus although this hotel is not in a quiet location.The Da Giuseppe Pizzeria ,100 metres down the road ,was a great find for an inexpensive meal in a lively friendly atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and customer service”
Reviews.Author: maryols
Reviews.Content: Reception staff were very courteous and friendly at all times and the room were spacious , clean and confortable. As they knew We had just got married , they upgraded us in a fantastic room! It was such a Lovely surprice and it was the icing on the (wedding) cake ! I can't recommend this hotel enough. If you catch one of their deals on their website , it can work to be really Good value !

Reviews.Title: “A lovely, clean, relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: jlee88x
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel , our room was modern and clean and breakfast was first class! Service was efficient and friendly and everything was reasonably priced. Incredibly handy for main train and underground station and only 15 minutes walking to Colosseum! I Have no hesitation at all recomending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Close to Termini train station for airport express & subway. Staff extremely friendly & professional. Rooms nicely finished. Excellent base for touring Rome. No problem storing bags for late departure.

Reviews.Title: “"NOT a 4-star hotel"”
Reviews.Author: SelUB
Reviews.Content: It is not a 4-star hotel as it is advertised. It has 3 stars at most. Therefore I thought I did not get value for money I paid. In fact I felt a bit cheated... However the location is convinient; breakfast service is efficient; it is also clean. I would not stay there again also because of the location, if travelling to Rome for pleasure - too many crazy people and too many cheap shops around Termini. I would prefer to have nicer surroundings next time. Staff is coldly nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jamescraven303
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in February 2012- it was a business trip but I took my wife with me for a romantic break whilst I was in Rome. I travel a lot for business, generally 4 star hotels, and I found the Morgana to be a perfect choice...great central location next to the train station and within 15 minutes walk of Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Colosseum, etc. Our room, an executive room, was admittedly on the small side, but all hotel rooms in European cities are. Very stylishly, and individually decorated, almost felt like a boutique hotel. Nice bathroom, very comfortable bed, beautiful public areas with marble everywhere. To me this hotel is worthy of its 4* rating, and the staff were excellent, from the doorman to the reception staff- could not have been more helpful. Reasonable price for Rome, our deal included free wifi (great connection and very fast for a hotel) and breakfast (as others on here have said, a very decent spread). I certainly would stay there again, the people who complain are snobs or american i reckon :-)

Reviews.Title: “Not a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kate0614
Reviews.Content: I have no idea why this hotel is listed as a 4-star. I would rate this as a 3-star hotel at most, and not a super value for the price (and I got a very good deal since February is not busy in Rome). The room I had was decorated in a faux "luxurious" style, but had cheap furniture and generally looked very run down and sad to me. You can see the state of the carpet in my photos. The wifi doesn't reach the rooms -- I had to go down to the lobby to check my email in the evening, which was very inconvenient since I was a trying to make plans to meet up with my boyfriend the next day and we were trading emails back and forth. The next morning it worked in my room for a little while and then the signal pooped out again. A business traveler could never stay here, but I wouldn't recommend it for a holiday either.

Reviews.Title: “Modern room, nice breakfast, good travel links”
Reviews.Author: oOmaundOo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in February 2012. The room (116) was modern and clean with a great shower. Hotel itself looks a bit grubby in the hallways, etc. Breakfast was great. Really good selection e.g. pastries, fresh fruit, yoghurt and juices. The area around the hotel was not the prettiest but great travel links as you are only a 2 minute walk from the Metro, so it is easy to get to Vatican, Colloseum, Forum, etc. The cost is only 1 Euro per trip on Metro so it works out a lot cheaper than taxis. The Colloseum is only a 15/20 minute walk down the hill however, so lots of options for exploring. Overall, we were very pleased with the hotel and well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Mac C
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in early Feb 2012 based on good reviews. The room was redish but clean and you can hear some noise on the streets and the next door neighbour. WIFI is not free and if you're unlucky like myself, the one and only small lift was broken and you'll have to climb the stairs. Warning for those on the 5th floor. Breakfast was quite good and the staff were helpful and polite. Termini is close by and there are a few nice restaurants like Cecio as suggested by reception. Overall, good for location and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: blackkk
Reviews.Content: We had an enjoyable stay at hotel Morgana. The room was nice, updated and very clean. The location is great , you can easily walk out the door and find many things to do. The front desk had some really good suggestions for local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,quiet,comfortable,great location!”
Reviews.Author: Robert v
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Morgana in January for four days and we were pleasantly surprised. This Hotel was in the perfect location. A block away from the main Train Station and walking distance from almost all the famous sights. The reception staff was very friendly and helpful and always willing to assist us. Great breakfast. I will recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “A first class visit”
Reviews.Author: jcruck
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight just after the New Year and found a hotel of excellent quality and service. My room was modern, very clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and the breakfast outstanding with good coffee and good selection of cereals, fresh fruits and pastries.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: cascboss
Reviews.Content: First the plus points; breakfast was very good, fresh and plentiful. Location was good, convenient for the metro to VC and all the tourist buses, many attractions within walking distance, good reasonable restaurants close by. Very quiet, no problem sleeping here. Staff, very friendly and helpful. Not sure where the 4 stars come from though. The room was quite small, could just about walk past the bed, room safe did not work so had to carry all our money etc all the time. The bar seems to be an afterthought, had to call reception to get served. There didn't appear to be a restaurant although daily happy hour buffets were advertised in reception area, didn't matter as lots of local restaurants. Thats all nit-picking though, overall we really enjoyed Rome and the Morgana was fine for what we wanted. Good luck to the 'just engaged' couple we met!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Choice”
Reviews.Author: MereteN0rway
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Clean. Friendly staff. Enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel to others - and will for sure be back ourselves :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel & Very Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Mason K
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Morgana for 1 night while on a 2 week tour of Italy. We got directions from the Roma Card (highly recommend) kiosk in the train station, and it was a short 4-5 minute walk to the front door of the hotel. The hotel is on a rather unbecoming street with lots of restaurants & shops, but nothing that is really nice to look at through the windows. Check-in and the front desk service were fantastic! My luggage had been lost on our flight, and the lady at the front desk took the time to call the airline and get an update for me while we were checking in, which was really very helpful. After we got checked in, we rode the elevator up to the 4th floor. There is a very small elevator in the place, but it was a tight squeeze with my wife and I and our 2 carry-on luggages. The room was nothing too special to speak of, but was a very comfortable bed, hot shower and nice towels. We found our room to be very clean. The in-room safe was easy to work and free, which was a big plus in our perspective. The room had a tv, but we never turned it on. The absolute best part of the hotel is the location. We were a 5 minute walk from the subway & train stations, and it was so central that you could get anywhere in the main parts of the city with a walk to the station and 5 or so subway stops. Additionally, for the fun of it, we walked back to the hotel from the Trevi Fountain and it was a beautiful 30 minutes walk through many of the best parts of the city. All in all, we would recommend the Hotel Morgana for value conscious travelers. It is not luxurious, but it is nice, safe and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: jessyh81
Reviews.Content: A really excellent hotel in the heart of Rome. Quiet, with good facilities and nice rooms, very well decorated. Charming, attentive and helpful reception and breakfast staff. We are looking forward to our next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: virgovim
Reviews.Content: You can't really beat the location of this hotel, at less than 5 minutes from Termini station. While the area itself could be cleaner and less shady, that's not the fault of the hotel which obviously tries hard to differentiate itself from the mess outside. The reception staff are super-helpful - I had to print some docs, sign, scan and then courier them - and they let me do this for free! Of course the courier was around the corner and paid for but the rest of it was done from their printer and computer in the office - great service! Very welcome! The room we booked on a package was great - we got an upgrade and they honoured it without any questions asked. Decor is modern and the room is spacious.Flat screen Samsung TVs, even a divan which our daughter slept on (yay! no need to share the bed with her!). The lobby area is cosy and beckons you to spend some time sitting and chatting - lots of sitting areas. The breakfast spread is good; cappucino and service excellent. Last but not least - free wi-fi! Would recommend this place anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Let's say it's a 3.5”
Reviews.Author: Czesc
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Priceline so we didnt know much about it. Pros: 1. VERY close to Termini station: one block away! 2. Free WiFi: it's pretty fast for hotel WiFi 3. Recently remodeled rooms: the room was spacious and very well appointed and even had Sky satellite TV. 4. The staff are generally very nice. 5. Our room was in the "Annex" which is a block and half down the street from the main hotel/reception. We thought this was a little weird since it seems that the other floors are actually apartments but our room was really nice so our fears were allayed. Con: And it's a big one. 1. The room smelled of the sewer. Not right when we first got in but after a couple hours. Rome was the last city on our trip and we got in late so we didnt feel like asking to change. We notified the staff and they sent a cleaning lady in the morning. She tried her best but honestly there wasnt a lot she could do. The smell was coming from the drains and toilet so we just made sure to close everything and keep the door closed. I'm sure they would have accommodated us if we wanted to switch but we were too tired to ask. Though, they did not offer it right away when we told them of the smell. 2. This isnt the most quiet part of town. There are a lot of hotels nearby and of course the train station is busy. There was a HUGE party going on at a cafe in the train station and the music was crazy loud.

Reviews.Title: “A Memorable Stay...”
Reviews.Author: rug-girl
Reviews.Content: Ok, Ok, we stayed at the Morgana, years ago - in the 90's...but I must say, that it was very memorable. My two children and I came into Rome, and went to this Hotel because someone had mentioned it. And what a wonderful surprise it was...the front desk personnel were terrific, the breakfast - I still dream about - and of course, the location is good (in the five times past that I've been in Rome, I have always stayed near the train station). Gosh, if I ever get to Rome again, I would stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Good location & excellent hotel !”
Reviews.Author: jotayl
Reviews.Content: Located near the city center . Close to shops, restaurants and everything. Staff is friendly. I had a deluxe room on the 4th floor , room and bathrom were large and the bed was comfortable. Breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and easy acess to sites”
Reviews.Author: Trafficman11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 7 - 11th December 2011. Hotel staff were helpful and attentive. Buffet Breakfast service was very well managed and the content was varied. Room was small but well maintained and kept clean. Nicely quiet in centre of city and not far from Terminii station. Ensuite shower room was modern. Front desk gave us a good recommendation for a restaurant and were obliging with other requests. Expensive transport to airport so use the rail link.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service !”
Reviews.Author: jennybur
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while on business . The location was good and the room was clean and quite. When I checked in the clerk was extremely welcoming both in his interaction with me and his helpfullness in getting me checked in. Another star for the customer service was when I ran out of toothpaste , they were very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay !”
Reviews.Author: dianeabb
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends stayed at Morgana for the new year's eve and really enjoyed our stay ! Rooms were quite, clean and spacious and breakfast was delicious. Front desk staff was friendly and helpfull . Great stay !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ronnybu
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at hotel Morgana while we were in town visiting our friends. What was supposed to be a quick stay for us ended up being a stay to remember ! The service we received from the hotel was second to none . From the moment we were greated at the door to the moment we left . Our executive room was big and clean with a spacious bathroom . We hope to come back in Rome soon and definitely will be back at Morgana !

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surpriced”
Reviews.Author: jacg70
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with easy access to the centre and underground. Staff were friendly and courteous. Room was clean and spacious. Overall we were pleasantly surpriced and enjoyed our stay. Going back next spring!!!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Gumsen
Reviews.Content: At check in we waited 30 min, for our key for our room. Our room was in a other building about 200 meters from the main entrance. The room was tiny ( London hotel rooms are big compared). Our suitcase had to be placed under or on the bed otherwise you couldn't stand on the floor. The bed was hard and the extra blankets, for when you are cold was smelling and whorn down- a bit disgusting. The bathroom was big, same size as the room. But the shower was awfull. There was no waterpressure and the few drops of water that did come was cold or boiling. I had to wash my hair in the sink. We complained about the water twice but notthing happen. But a positive thing was the room was clean. The walls where very thin so you could hear everything from the others rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to train station”
Reviews.Author: jjkin
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at hotel Morgana for 3 nights. I chose this hotel based on the convenience to the train station. We had a lot of luggage and didn't want to have an issue with getting to our hotel. We were very happy with the convenience and also the friendly, helpful staff. Our room was clean and comfortable . Breakfast was not included in our room price, it was a very nice breakfast but quite expensive if you are not a big breakfast eater. Overall this is a nice hotel with friendly helpful staff . Definitely a hotel I would recommend to anyone wanting a reasonably hotel in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, well appointed and safe .... but overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: wanderingirl23
Reviews.Content: I booked a secret hotel deal over the internet....the hotel turned out to be Hotel Morgana. The hotel is centrally located 5 minutes walk from Termini. As other contributors have mentioned it is not the most scenic part of Rome but it is convenient for getting around via the metro. I have stayed in this area several times and have never had any issues at any time of the day although the area does attract the usual suspects that hang around large train stations anywhere in the world. The hotel itself is comfortable and has good security, the front door is always locked the reception staff let you in. Staff were friendly and efficent and able to provide assistance or advice when requested. I had a single room, with a double bed, and while well funshied and appointed and very clean it was tiny...even by Italian standards! There was not enough space to walk around the bed on both sides and virtually no space to put your suitcase on the floor. Definately a one person room and even then rather claustrophobic! Given that I paid about 90 euros per night (on special!!) I didnt think it was value for money. As I said I have stayed in several other hotels and private apartments in the area that certainly represent much better value. All in all if you get a good deal over the internet, the hotel is clean, safe and well appointed and worth the stay if you want to be close to the train station for an overnight stay, for longer than that I would suggest you shop around as there are certainly better options in the area for the same or less money.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location”
Reviews.Author: josh70t
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week end break . Our room was large and comfortable with a very comfy bed with smooth sheets. There was a little noise in the corridors , probably due to it being Christmas party season with lots of traveller ! Staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was not included but at 8,50 euro for all you could eat , it was very good value. There is a luggage room which was useful as our flight was not until the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MarkAndAmanda
Reviews.Content: Stayed here having never been to Rome so weren't aware of the geography. Being next to the train station, we knew it wasn't going to be the greatest area but the room price reflected that. We found the area around the termini to be not quite as nice as some areas but perfectly safe and also fairly quiet after 10ish. If you plan to travel on Rome's (pitiful!) metro, it's actually very well placed. The staff were very friendly and helpful (the opposite of some reviews we've read). We also thought, unlike some who have stayed, that the breakfast was fabulous (although quite limited if you like eggs/bacon etc but that's the continental way). If you're in Rome for a couple of days and don't want to pay the premium for a place closer to the sites, we'd recommend the Morgana which is about 20mins walk from the colosseum

Reviews.Title: “Good location, pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: Lizcampb
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant room with large flat screen tv, comfy and big bed . Reception was very helpful and pleasant -left some items behind- returned quickly by post. Breakfast was great with a lot of choice .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: kathygrf
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed here in December for Xmas shopping which were great! The hotel is close to the station , rooms are clean , beds comfortable and the shower was great. When extra pillows were requested , they were supplied by the evening. Breakfast was amazing and the staff was fantastic too! We would recommend this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location - fantastic comfortable room. Amazing value!”
Reviews.Author: thomd51
Reviews.Content: Perfect locations for bars, restaurants, main shopping streets and underground ( just 2 minutes ) . The room was spacious, the bed one of the most comfortable I have slept in ever and the service was excellent. Will definitely be returning !

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: juliew55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel morgana in Rome and it is fabulous, check in was quick and easy , rooms are spacious and clean . There are many good restaurants nearby and main attractions are walking distance !

Reviews.Title: “A delightful boutique hotel, Morgana gives great service and location”
Reviews.Author: Grace683
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Morgana is a comfortable hotel with excellent staff. The breakfast buffet is well done and the staff well trained. The hotel is undergoing refurbishment to increase the useability of the private courtyard, as well as room upgrades. I was very pleased with the easy walking distance to the Termini rail, subway and bus station. The whole of Rome is within reach by using one or the other transportation mode just 5 minutes from the front door. The evening happy hour and snack table are well attended. Tanya, the bar captain, is very helpful and ready to support guests with special drink orders or private party accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: thomas01hahhah
Reviews.Content: slightly disappointing, probably more 3 star than 4. Convenient location, 2 minutes from railway station, although late at night appeared quite seedy. Reception area small, staff efficient. Room was certainly not spacious, hotel quite cramped all way through. Plus point was the early breakfast request, we had to leave at 5 am and breakfast was sent to room at 4.30. Not a place to sit and relax in, although why sit in hotel bar in Rome with all the other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevegreene
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely amazingly beautiful and is very conveniently located . The staff is also reasonably helpful. Breakfast is served in a very nice room on the groundfloor and it is really good with a great choice of food and fruits!

Reviews.Title: “A really great experience”
Reviews.Author: kalbhorn
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend with our 3 young children we didn't know what to expect with a city break and the children , we wanted them to see the lights and the Xmas athmosphere in Rome and for us to enjoy time away with them . Our hotel experience was excellent from when I was booking the room to our arrival and overall stay. The rooms were really lovely and because we had ajoining rooms they were spacious and spotless. The breakfast was lovely. We will definitely be back to Morgana!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: jstraub
Reviews.Content: I reserved 2 executive rooms at the hotel Morgana on 9th December, I was travelling with my husband and my parents. We were very happy with all aspects of our experience. Our rooms were spacious and very comfortable, immaculately clean and beautifully decorated. The breakfast buffet offered a varied selection of high quality , fresh , delicious dishes. The service was impeccable throughout our stay. We thank the hotel staff for making our stay so pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “Great location,great room”
Reviews.Author: Baronsir
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to hop on / hop off buses.taxis are available also anytime.the room was spaccio is and nice decored.the bath room was 5 stars with jacuzzi bath.the staff was very professional and friendly and makes you feel good from the moment you walk into the property.breakfast was delicious and plenty of chooice.we'll come back for sure in the future!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good!!!”
Reviews.Author: Robroy78
Reviews.Content: Good city center hotel ,just seconds from the major attractions,lovely Rooms..the staff was very helpful with thoughful raccomandations for restaurant (especially cecio )and sights.perfect location for tourist.lovely breakfast in the morning.we also had a delicious buffet in the evenin.excellent chooice!!!!we'll stay here again!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not like a North American hotel”
Reviews.Author: AtwoZ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked the hotel Morgana using a voucher we received from Priceline (for a past cruise). We were planning to spend 1 night in Rome prior to taking a train to Civitavecchia for our Eastern Mediterranean cruise. We ended up paying $1 plus about $24 USD in taxes; so, we got a pretty good deal (although when you consider the fact that the voucher was for $140 USD), it was pretty pricey. We had read enough about Rome to know that things would not be cheap. We also read that a 4 star in North America is probably a 3 star in Rome, which seemed about right (we had a very nice room but a few steps form the bed area to the bathroom and entry area). Also, you should know that the check in process is very different. You will have to provide your passports and you will be charged a small fee that appears to be charged by the city of Rome (sorry I cannot remember exactly how much). The other thing os that you should try to use the transit system which is amazing. It cost us 1 Euro to get from the Vatican to the hotel; and, about $20 Euro by taxi. Just be warned that the hotel has a set of 3-5 stairs before you will get from the lobby to the lift (elevator). You will have to carry all of you luggage up these steps and back down at the end of your stay; and, the lifts are very small; so, 2 adults and luggage max. Termini station is down the street. There are many restaurants around as well. Just give yourself enough time to get around. We had a 2:30 PM vatican tour on the day we landed, thinking that our 10:30 AM arrival time and pre-arranged car service would leave us enough time for a nap. We barely made it to our tour; so, allow enough time. Take "the avoid the lines" tour offered by Viator. It is a very good tour; and, the best value.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: Lezz069
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome at 7AM, used a van ( 40 Euros) to get to th hotel. Driver unloaded the 4 large suitcases to the sidewalk. I went into the hotel to find someone to help - no one available, The two prople behind the counter were trying to handle the people checking out, many of them complaining. I ould not find a hotel baggage rack so I hauled the bags into the lobby, We did know chck in was later in the day, so we had breakfast at the hotel while waiting for someone so we could make sure our bags were safe. We went back after the crowd left. The desk clerk told us we would not have to wait, our room was ready. The room was very small, had one window looking out into a trash dump of a back yard of the adjoining hotel and across an apt. bldg. with laundry hanging out of most windows. I had to go back twice to finally get the luggage delivered. The room had an A/C but it did not work, also a TV that did not work. The narrow hallway had a step down and I didn't see it as it was carpeted all the same color, I fell flat. This was supposed to be a 4-5 star hotel, Iwould rate it 2 star at best.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel !”
Reviews.Author: kriy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a friend 40th and had 5 rooms booked on a deal which was excellent value for money. The hotel is very clean, rooms are very nice and breakfast is excellent! Will definitely stay again !

Reviews.Title: “Okay rooms terrible service.”
Reviews.Author: ajmartino
Reviews.Content: We were appalled with the service at this hotel! There was no hot water in the morning for 3 days of our stay there, the TV worked sporadically and the service at the front desk, in particular a man named "marco" who worked in the mornings was perhaps the rudest i have ever come across in the service industry. When i informed him of my unhappiness with the room and the service provided by him, and even threatened with a bad review on trip advisor, he simply said "do whatever you want, your bad review means nothing" However; the breakfast staff and cleaning staff were polite and helpful. They put us in another building away from the main hotel, it was a residential building and they had seemingly just used one floor as a hotel. They gave us only one key for the main door, even although we had booked two rooms, and refused to give as another key, which meant we had to coordinate our days so we all arrived back at the hotel at a similar time. this is not what i expect of a 4 star hotel. As this was a residential block there were people smoking indoors, parties many nights of the week and generally just noise and smell which is acceptable day to day, but when you are paying 150+ euro a night per room... you expect more. DISGUSTED!

Reviews.Title: “not sure if”
Reviews.Author: blinkyeyed
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in early December 2011. We had upgraded to an executive double, not sure if we got it as room seemed very small. It was clean, had a nice bathroom, wall safe and it was well made up promptly the next day. Buffet breakfast was good, buffet style which was well stocked, fried breakfast would not be to everyone's choice. I stuck with pastries and yoghurt, but as it seems with all hotels at the lower end of the market the orange\pineapple juice tasted like diluted toilet water, so don't expect freshly squeezed orange juice for breakfast. As others have said they will store your bags after checkout without any fuss, so big plus there.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dorene L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Morgana for five nights after returning from a cruise. We booked their "Winter Special" which included several upgrades and free wifi. Even if we didn't get the "specials" I would still go back there in an instant. Lynda at the front desk was extremely helpful. We arrived earlier than check-in time. When I made the reservation I advised them that we would like to check in early or at least store our bags. We were pleasantly surprised to find that our room was ready when we arrived early. We felt like the early check-in gave us an extra full day in Rome. The breakfast buffet was wonderful. Location was perfect. We couldn't have asked for more. If we get a chance to go back to Rome, this is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprice”
Reviews.Author: nels76
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night when in Rome in business trip. It feels clean and is good value for Rome. Staff could not have been better , helpfull, efficent and extremely friendly. I found that early arrival was no problem and was able to leave luggage for the day which was convenient!

Reviews.Title: “1st room scary, 2nd room disgusting, 3rd room 'ok'”
Reviews.Author: KKalitowski
Reviews.Content: Room 1 was NOT in the main hotel. They made us drag our bags two blocks down to a different building. They had some fancy name for the building that I don't remember. Don't let them fool you, its NOT fancy. This building was unmarked on the outside OR inside and could easily have been any random apartment building (maybe it is and they only had 1 floor of it). It had no front desk at all, no staff. The elevator was the scariest and oldest thing I'd even seen with a gate for a door and all. It was open air and could only fit one person and one bag. The room itself was nice, but I'm not staying in a non-staffed building in that area of Rome for any price. Room 2 was back at the main hotel. There was mold coming from the air vent. The attic entry was half open with light shining through, with more mold all around the attic entry. The tub had caulk chunks sitting in it. The shower tile grout and the corners of the shower had lots of mildew. The kicker is that the tub leaked big time when a shower was taken. Something internal to the tub was broken and it was leaking water profusely out the bottom onto the bathroom floor. Room 3 was acceptible. But after all that I don't care what room you put me in. You aren't getting a good review from me.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Nice Staff, Clean - Just want we wanted.”
Reviews.Author: Tweekie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 3 night romantic city break and we were not disappointed. The hotel is 5 minutes from Termini Station. We were greeted with a warm welcome and checked in very efficiently. We had a master double room that looked out onto a court yard and it made the room very quiet. It was not the largest of rooms but it was clean and fresh. The bathroom was modern and light. You received the normal amenities - shampoo, shower gel, shoe shine, shower cap etc. Breakfast was relaxed and plentiful. Lots of choice to set you up for the day. Scrambled egg, bacon, toasts, cereals, cold meats etc, cheeses, yoghurts, danish pastries. Tea, coffees, juices etc. It couldn't be faulted. You are very near to the Metro, train station and bus depot. But lots of attractions are within walking distance. Go to some of the less well known attractions also they will surprise you. When stopping for lunch in Rome check out the drink prices - the lunch menus are always reasonable but we got stung for 18 euros for a Latte and black coffee at Bar Accademia near the Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: duck_farmer
Reviews.Content: I got a package that included airport pickup, breakfast, and Internet so it had all the essentials. I couldn't get wifi reception in the first room, so I moved to another one. In the first room, there was almost no space in the room, and you had to sit on the bed to work at the desk. In the second room, there was a bit more room but the shower was so small that I couldn't bend down to get the soap and shampoo (that's right, there was no rack or shelf in the shower for those things). All this would have been okay until I found 2 bedbugs in my bed. I killed one of them, and it was full of what looked like blood. They hotel staff moved me right away, but it's still disconcerting. The one thing the place has going for it is that the staff is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a useful location”
Reviews.Author: greed71
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel Morgana on business trip for two nights in October. It is an elegant, well refurbished establishment in a side street near Termini Station. The economy room are pleasant enough to live in, service is very helpfull. Good food and service in the restaurant room for breakfast .

Reviews.Title: “2nd perfect stay at the Hotel Morgana”
Reviews.Author: icun60
Reviews.Content: Second time I am staying at the hotel Morgana and I am not disappointed! Nice rooms, great staff and perfect location. Shopping, great restaurants and main attractions are walking distance.I just love it and would recommend to anyone looking for a great hotel in Rome !

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great breakfast, great staff”
Reviews.Author: bethca
Reviews.Content: Great location, within walking distance to pretty much everything. Clean and good size room, staff very helpful . Breakfast in the morning was great . All in all I would highly recommend and we will be using it in the future when we return to Rome !

Reviews.Title: “excellent service and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: jennmelzer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near the train station, which doesn't make the local area the best, but the hotel is great. Clean, elegant and the service is excellent. Within walking distance or the convenience of metro/train makes this a great place to stay. Also, I left my passport in the room and checked out, and someone else had checked in. The hotel really worked hard to get my passport out of the safe which was critical. They are so helpful and friendly. It was actually my 2nd time and I'd stay again on any future trips to rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Near major transportation!!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisZettle
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean, friendly, and good value this is the hotel for you! This hotel is near major transportation, so attractions are just minutes away. If you are comfortable with public transportation (subway) then stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: rebeccasharp
Reviews.Content: My friend and myself went to Rome for the week end and stayed in this hotel, staff very friendly , rooms nice, beds very comfortable. Breakfast was very good with a good choice of food. Thank you to all the staff at this hotel . Would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay here again next trip to Rome .

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 Star Quality”
Reviews.Author: Kitikat33
Reviews.Content: Staff at desk, while quick at what they did, were very rude. We often thought they were talking badly about us in Italian. We had normal questions for people traveling to a new place, and they acted like we were wasting their time with our questions. Our room was in "the annex" a part of the hotel a block away from the main hotel. No one to help us with our bags at any time. It wasn't even offered. Rooms were clean and breakfast was good. Our tour guides told us this was not a good part of town and to be careful. Not a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay after a room change!”
Reviews.Author: lauren k
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel early in the morning and had a couple of hours wait for the room to be ready during which we took ourselves off to the Colosseum. After returning to the hotel we were given a poky, ill decorated room which was almost wedged between the two walls, not an idyllic room for a young couple! However the staff were very helpful and offered an upgrade to their executive rooms a short walk down the road, which were really very nice to be in. If you stay here i would advise you pay a little extra for the more modern rooms, if you prefer a cleaner feel and a little retreat to return to after a long day exploring. Breakfast was perfectly fine and they bell boys were more than accommodating. The rest of the staff were always helpful and did not make you feel uncomfortable when asking for something. Despite being in a less glamorous area, it felt safe and the central location allowed us to experience everything on foot and discover many hidden gems in the city. If i was to return I would probably use them again, mainly due to the location and the exec room we finally ended up staying in. Thanks for making our trip a good one!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lindalizr76
Reviews.Content: I had a good time at this hotel. Rooms were clean and bedding comfortable. Staff was okand breakfast was very good. The location was perfect and easy to find , near Termini station and underground. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “I expected better from a 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChloeGraham
Reviews.Content: Great location only a 5 minute walk from Termini station which is a good base for sightseeing. First impressions of the area were not good - it felt a bit rough and seedy - I travelled with my 2 daughters aged 16 and 9 and my youngest was a bit anxious. We arrived in the dark and there seemed to be a lot of drunks sitting around but our fears were unnecessary as we felt very safe walking around even at night. Staff were pleasant and helpful but not overly welcoming (restaurant staff were the exception and were lovely and attentive). The room did not live up to my expectation - I have stayed at much better 3* hotels - although it was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice for a week end in Rome !”
Reviews.Author: kirkrea
Reviews.Content: The hotel Morgana is situated just 5 minutes walking from the underground and about 20 minutes walking to Spanish steps a perfect location for sightseeing and shopping ! Our room was quite big and very clean. Breakfast was good you can choose whatever you want from eggs to croissants or fresh fruits !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeniseSCampbell
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for four nights. We booked the accommodation before reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, so were a little scared about staying here as some of the comments describe the hotel as being rough. I have no idea why people are writing bad reviews. We stayed in the economy room, and yes the room is small, but no smaller than a normal Travel Inn or Premier Inn (I know it's a four star hotel, but it is four star old fashioned not modern). The room was clean and towels changed daily. The staff were really helpful and nice, especially the staff at breakfast (say hi to the bald bloke). The only thing I would say is, unless you are booking your accommodation directly through the hotel, you are not entitled to the free airport transfers promised on the site. Also, breakfast is not the best, but does the job. They are also obviously trying to cater for American visitors by providing a Happy Hour American style buffet each evening. My advise to the hotel is, forget the American's they have no taste. They are in Rome and should stay at home if they want to stuff their faces with mounds of American food. Make it an Italian buffet and keep it sophisticated and simple. As everyone else is saying, we were really close to the Metro, which is really handy and really cheap. Don't be afraid to get lost, it is sooooo easy to find your way back to the Termini, and as big as Rome is, it is walkable. Best tip I can give is, going at this time of year (November) and visiting the Vatican, DO NOT LISTEN TO STREET VENDORS TRYING TO SELL YOU FAST TRACK TICKETS!!!! They were telling us that the queues to the Vatican and the Museums were two-hours long. We queued for St Peter's for ten-minutes and walked straight into the Museums!! We didn't even have to queue for the Sistine Chapel. PLUS, it only cost us 20 Euro's each for entrance to St Peter's and the Museums not the 32 as stated in travel guides or 45 as given by the robbing vendors. Also, everything is expensive, but you can find cheap booze and cheap food, but the places selling cheap booze don't sell the best food. For places with nice food, alcohol is REALLY expensive, Don't let this put you off, the place is so laid back, you can mix and match. And finally, make sure you go see the Trevi Fountain. Beautiful. x

Reviews.Title: “Website is deceiving”
Reviews.Author: AlisonJones235
Reviews.Content: On the positive the hotel is in a good central location and very convenient to station and sights of rome. Our room was clean with fresh towels every day and we'd like the management to pass on our thanks to the cleaning staff for their diligence. However, on the down side the room we were given was nothing like the pictures on the website. We booked a double room and upon arrival were allocated a room with two single beds beds which was in need of refurbishment We queried this twice with reception staff who advised they would push the beds together and sort it out which was not right considering the booking was for a double. However, after the second day nothing was done and we gave up asking. The website states rooms have jetted bathtubs, however, our room only had a shower so don't go by what expedia promises on their website. If you want a very basic hotel room which is central then this hotel is ideal but don't expect the rooms to be anything like what is described on the website (inc pictures) as for us the room we were given was a real let down.

Reviews.Title: “Great City Centre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lorayned
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our recent stay at the Hotel Morgana in Rome where my mother, sister and I had 3 single rooms. Reception was friendly and efficient and readily booked tours, taxis etc for us. Rooms, whilst on the compact side, were very comfortable with good en-suites. A very generous buffet breakfast was available, and Carmello was particularly friendly to us in the mornings. The location is great, 5 minute walk from Termini which makes it very easy to get back to from a day out as there is always a bus to Termini from wherever you are. All in all, would definitely recommend it for a weekend in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: karry74
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a week end in Rome with my family , our quad room was big enough for 4 of us with spacious and clean bathroom. Front desk staff was really helpfull. I will recommend this hotel to my friends coming to Rome !

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, really enjoyed our stay, very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: PennyRon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Morgana Hotel for 3 nights - 10th to 13th November. The hotel is in an excellent central location just 1 street away from the Termini Station, cross the road and the Morgana is the next road down running parallel to the station. Really good transport links to airports via train and bus, we caught the bus from Fumincino airport return, pre-booked in the UK, with Terravision which run directly to and from the airport/station for 4 euros pp each way, normally 6 but on offer. Terravison also run a shuttle bus service from the Termini to Campino Airport direct. Leonardo Express service by train which is quicker but more expensive approx 17 euros. Taxi transfer approx 40 euros 1 way. The sightseeing hop on hop off bus is 2 minuites away. We were surprised how good the location of the hotel is. We had a lovely room to the front of the hotel, the walls of the hotel are beautifully decorated with fabric, cleaned to a high standard every day with clean towels and sheets. The rooms have flat screen tv's and a fridge. The breakfast is a must, lots of choices and an excellent start to the day. They also offer an 'all you can eat' evening buffet for 8 euros with a drink, we were tempted but was a cold buffet served in the lounge/bar area. We would certainly have eaten at the hotel if the buffet were warm and a little more extensive. We thought that many of the guests would have eaten in the hotel if they had opened the restaurant as the food was very good, and sightseeing is exhausing. We were disappointed at the food offered by the local restaurants which were serving mainly pasta with sauce, meat sauce which did not seem to contain any meat and pizza bases with little or no toppings, not cheap even if you go for one of the deals as the drinks are very expensive. There are a few Indian Restaurants/kebab restaurants near the station which are cafeteria style, also self service cafe's and McDonalds. We would not recommend the area round the station late at night though. The fridge was excellent, we bought our own wine from the supermarket nearby, there are quite a few close to the hotel where you can buy your own drinks, beer from around 70c per 660cl bottle and wines very reasonably priced. No tea or coffee making facilties in the room, but having been to Rome before we brought our own. Worth bringing your kettle as a day out in Rome is very tiring! Wireless internet is available at the hotel but is 10 euros per day this we found expensive as often find this to be complimentary in 4 star hotels, if not in your room generally available in communal areas. When you leave you will also have to pay without exception a city tax of 3 euros per person per night in cash. We thought that our stay at the Morgana hotel was great, we walked from the hotel to the Colisseum, the Vatican, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Piazza Navona, all the major sights, recommend at least a 3/4 night stay to see the city properly. We dont usually post pictures of hotels we have visited on tripadvisor but as we had such a nice time here have decided to this time. Hotel and restaurant staff were great, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Would deffinately recommend this hotel, if we come back to Rome would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Choose somewhere else to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Clare B
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is it's cleanliness. We were on the first floor, overlooking the courtyard, which was by no means pretty. It was used by hotel staff as a cut through and noise started before 6am every morning and went on well into the night. The noises were those of the kitchen, the laundry and deliveries being made. There was also a sound from inside the building that I can only describe as some sort of electrical pump, it went off every few seconds! Its SO close to the main station too and the door shook whenever a train arrived. So despite the beauty of Rome itself, I couldn't wait to get home to have a decent nights sleep. The location is great if you intend to get the metro everywhere, but if you are hoping to walk, then choose somewhere a little closer to the 'wedding cake' and save yourself miles of extra walking.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms, poor service”
Reviews.Author: g s
Reviews.Content: I now know why Hotel Morgana has no refunds once you register on-line... We were there 3 nights before our cruise and one night after and it was our low point. The rooms (both the deluxe and garden) were postage stamp size at best. The single chair located at the desk was broken and I almost fell over. The elevators were also of postage stamp size... two people and one suitcase were the maximum. The rooms were warm and after trying to adjust the thermostat, we asked at the desk and they said the air conditioning had been turned off since it was not the heating season!! We ended up having the window open, having to hear the talk and laughter from the apartments near by.

Reviews.Title: “What a delightful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Marianne H
Reviews.Content: We throughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Morgana. The staff were friendly and accomodating even the maintenance / houskeeping staff. The master room was spacious and clean and beds were very comfortable! Close to anything you could need, delicious breakfast was provided every morning ! Wouldn't hesitate to stay again or recommend to family and friends !

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sam H
Reviews.Content: The staff are rude, the hotel is dirty and in a seedy part of town. I do NOT recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel , well positioned for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: BedfordshireJanet
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights 23rd October, my husband myself and 16 year old daughter. Booked with BA holidays and was pleased with the price. This is a nice hotel. I didn't think the reception staff when we arrived were overly welcoming, but others were during our stay. Its positioned 5 minutes from the train station and bus station which is ever so handy. The street is busy but you can't hear much at all with the windows shut, unfortunatley the air-con was off for the time of year and our room did get extremely warm and stuffy. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the room very modern and extremely clean. The barman was lovely and the manager of the breakfast room was charming and couldn't do enough for you. We had breakfast included and really enjoyed it. There were cereals, yoghurt, cold meats and cheeses and cake. The scrambled eggs and bacon were delicious as were the breads. The coffee was horrible, but you could ask for a cappucino etc and hot chocolate. It takes about 15 minutes to do a leisurley walk down towards the forum and colosseum. Its a nice walk and you can check out the resteraunts on the way. We would definately stay in this hotel again if retuning to Rome, it has all you need for sightseeing. Did the walking tour of the Colosseum and forum, good but manic. It was great to have your own ear pieces to hear the guide. One thing we didn't really see advertised was the 'newest building' around the forum, the Ministry of culture which was built in the 1800's. Its a beautiful building (and free admission). You get great views of Rome from it, and if you pay around 7 euros can go in the elevator the the top, we think it was worth it! There are lovely sculptures etc in the building and a bit about Italys famous revolutionaries and Poloticians which was interesting although it does lack information in English or any other language other than Italian actually which was a shame - but then again, coming from Britain I dont think anyone can do museums like we do! Got a 24hr bus hop on n off bus ticket which was handy for getting from place to place especially the Vatican. The Vatican was amazing but we didn't go in as I live with two Atheists! A trip up the nearby Castle was interesting but overpriced for whats there - which is really the shell of a fortress and good views of Rome. A day at Pompeill is a must - but it is a long day so prepare yourself, but you do get to see some of the rest of italy and mt Vesuvius is amazing in the background of the ruins, it really brings it to life! I must say, yes Rome is expensive, although there are plenty of cheap souvenirs to be found. I'm not at all impressed with the food though. We even went to eateries where the Italiens ate. 9 euros for an 'incredibly' thin pizza with not a lot on it and not a lot of taste is a bit of a rip off. I think I make better pasta than some of the meals I saw and tried, we even heard Italiens complain. Beer from a trolley car averages 3.50euros and a bottle of coke 2 euros. Your lucky to get a bottle of beer in a resteraunt for 5 euros, usually 6! Rome is a lovely city break but you won't see and enjoy it unless you stay for a minimum of 4 nights I'd say. Very nice hotel though

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a 4* hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Amber692
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice, but disappointing for a 4* hotel. The room was nice, but did not have a clock. The location was great - right next to the train station. The hotel breakfast was very overpriced. It was 8.50 euros and the selection was not the best. The hotel did NOT offer free internet either. They charged 10 euros/day for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel as center for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Donald T
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just around the corner from train station where subway is located. Can get from airport to train station cheap on train. Subway takes you many of Rome's major attratctions and in walking distance of most. Small rooms but fine. Mattress a little hard but not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Convienient - but ...”
Reviews.Author: Farr45
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my 2 daughters last week for a half-term treat. The hotel is one block away from the main railway terminal in Rome centre. This is very convienient to get to most of the attractions, but like the Kings Cross area in London or Gare Du Nord in Paris, the streets around the Morgana are seedy, and full of cheapish hotels, tourist oriented restaurants and street traders selling counterfiet handbags and other trashy stuff. It didn't particularly feel unsafe, just ... seedy. The hotel reception is small and crowded most of the time, the bar comfortable (although drinks are expensive) and breakfast room adequate. The staff were polite but not interested, for example they couldn't seem to programme my keycard for more than 24 hours at a time, so having gone to the 5th floor only to have to come back down again each day to have the card reprogrammed was treated with polite and slightly amused indifference. The hotel has 100 rooms across 5 floors and is a labyrinth. There are 2 lifts, both minute and very slow. If you dont like lifts, steer clear of any room above the first floor. I had booked 2 rooms, one double occupancy for my daughters and a single occupancy for me. The single room I was in (524) is really tiny, just enough room for a single bed. The en suite is similarly tiny, you have to navigate around the sink to get to the WC and around the WC with your back to the wall to get to the shower. The room was clean and reasonably well decorated and had flat screen TV but the signal quality was awful. The soundproofing was not great so light sleepers will have a problem with neighbours. We visited in mid-October, when the weather in Rome is still very warm (t-shirt's were fine) but the Morgana has already switched off their air conditioning and the rooms were like ovens. My daughters had to move after the first night because of the heat. I had to have the window wide open all night, which overlooked the a small central courtyard. 6.30 seemed to be the time to start bottling up downstairs so sleep was impossible from then on. The manager said that they switch off the cooling because of the "changing season", it felt more like a money saving measure to me. I think Morgana is typical of hotels in this price bracket and this district of Rome. As a base to tour the city, it is convienient, and of course, if you arrive by train, ideal. However, space is definitely at a premium throughout the hotel, and the heat and noise (because of the heat) are unpleasant features of what was a largely enjoyable and informative trip.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised that this is what passes for a 4-star in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Paxlulu
Reviews.Content: This hotel would definitely not be considered a 4-star by North American standards. It felt more like a 3-star at most. The economy room I stayed in looked nothing like the photos on their website. It was small, the carpet was worn out, there were pee stains in the grout around the toilet, and a layer of dust on the desk. The lights also flickered continuously and even one evening there was a power failure. Naturally, the staff said it wasn't there fault but a problem with the electricity supply in the neighbourhood. That's interesting, because the other buildings on the block still had their electricity working. The host in the breakfast room provided excellent service but unfortunately I cannot say the same for the rest of the staff. One night, I called the front desk for ice to be sent to my room. After 45 minutes, two phone calls later and a visit to the front desk I eventually got my ice. Also, don't bother to ask to use their iron/ironing board. It's a piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Louisefitzs
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in the hotel morgana and we found everything about the hotel very good. Location was excellent, staff were very pleasant and helpful, the room was small but spotlessly clean and comfortable. Breakfast was delicious and plentiful. Overall we had a very pleasant stay and would reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simple,nice four star not too expensive .”
Reviews.Author: dertkk
Reviews.Content: After searching on the web for a nice not too expensive well located four star we finally booked the Hotel Morgana and we were very pleased with it. Nice room ,attentive and friendly staff ,very good location.

Reviews.Title: “very good stay !”
Reviews.Author: jannette33
Reviews.Content: the location was perfect , the staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was superb and the room very comfortable. I would recommend this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: bolla79
Reviews.Content: The room was great and the staff was professional and friendly. The rooms were well appointed, spacious and clean. Breakfast was good. Location is excellent. We had a great time, would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff kind of dated and small...”
Reviews.Author: jwelches
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, however it is small and all the rooms are different style. Mine looked like a French Old Lady Room and my friends was modern... But it was very clean. You won't hate it but you won't be in love with it either. I would go again given a cheaper price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful venue at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: monicpipp
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Morgana 2 nights during a convention in Rome.The room was great looking, very clean, well appointed. The location is very convenient, very close to the subway and the main station. The breakfast was excellent and Carmel was the best of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: monicproskwo
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Morgana and were delighted. Bedroom was excellent and quiet. Breakfast was terrific. The hotel has a very good location near the subway and many restaurants. The staff was lovely and very helpful. We would definately return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value ,close to everything very clean and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: laudt45
Reviews.Content: We just had a stay of 3 nights at this hotel ,our second time there and not the last! Very good location walking distance from central station close to Roman national Museum and a lot of good Restaurants . We totally disagree with the previous comment we had a extremely clean and comfortable deluxe room and we booked it with the pick up offer included .A great value for money ,we will be back again and we sure can recommend it to everyone .

Reviews.Title: “Old & run-down hotel”
Reviews.Author: StephenChi
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Rome. Stayed 1 night at Morgana on Sept 13. The room is awful - small, old carpet, matress so worn out that will give you back pain. Other than proximity to the train station, there is nothing much else that this hotel offers. The room felt so dirty that I was uncomfortable to sleep in. I went to sit on the couch at the front lobby all night. Thank God the WIFI worked well; otherwise I couldn't have survived all the hours staying awake. I booked another hotel on internet and moved on immediately the next day. The photos on the hotel website look good, but you'll be shocked when you see the real thing. False advertisement?

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Morgana, Central Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jomedia
Reviews.Content: Situated just behind Termini central Rome, it was ideal for getting anyway in Rome, either walking or justing on train/metro which was great. The reception area was just right, spacious and well designed. My room was just lovely, boutique style, very clean, and despite being so central the road is very quiet. There were a lot of local very good and more reasonable restuarants to eat at too and a couple of cocktail bars! I would ignore the other room reviews as our rooms were just right and nicely decorated.

Reviews.Title: “I would not give this a 4 star rating but it was convenient and quiet”
Reviews.Author: igotmojo
Reviews.Content: The hotel was convenient to the train/metro station but it's rather sketchy around the train station. It never felt unsafe or anything but the lobby door was locked, even during the day and you had to buzz to get in. In room safes do not accommodate laptops. From the outside it looks pretty divey, but the staff was friendly and helpful and the room was quiet and the bed was relatively comfortable. However, the shower had inconsistent temperature, fluctuating between hot and cold and you couldn't even it out. The room had a window but it was semi covered and you could only see up, not out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice visit”
Reviews.Author: omahacitytown
Reviews.Content: 8igger room than expected, good location and you can easily walk to Colosseo from the hotel. We found the breakfast room very nice way to start the day and the buffet is rich of all kinds of food, really good for 4 star hotel. We really enjoyed our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Met our needs nicely”
Reviews.Author: trchaseKY
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel close to the train station and the Morgana is only a block away. Very nice friendly staff who met every request. The included breakfast was very good. The only negative was the shower. The screen only covered half the shower and it was impossible not to get the floor soaking wet. I am 6'5" and the room with a large bed that we requested was fine for me.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: lessnpet
Reviews.Content: Nice experience, the room was quiet and comfortable in all ways. The shower was very poweful and we even had a bath tub! The staff was nice to us and gave us maps and other info. We would for sure love to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: losrigas9
Reviews.Content: Beatiful, clean, nice room, good restaurants nearby and ideal location in Rome with all buses at termini station only minute away. Staff was nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Morgana - GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: Janet S
Reviews.Content: I am writing this in room 209 at the Morgana, having booked in on Sunday evening. We are staying here until Friday. The room is not as small as some people claim, but we did get a free upgrade to a deluxe room (thank you, British Airways). The imternet is a pain - but it is free as part of our package. I would have been most unhappy to have to pay the usual 10 euros. Breakfast in the hotel is superb, with great coffee. Nearby restaurants (just along the street) are very good and, for a capital city, very reasonable (set menus vary between 10 and 13 euros for three courses. cheap wine/beer shop around the block, everywhere walkable. Rome traffic has to be seen to be believed - much quicker to walk. Yesterday we walked to tne Colosseum, today we walked to the Trevi fountain and the Spanish Steps. Brilliant hotel in brilliant location. Beds comfortable, great bathroom with jacuzzi bath and good shower. Off to the Vatican on Thursday by Metro A Line (1 euro each way per person). Bought Vatican tickets on line about three weeks ago.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay,good location,clean,special offer.”
Reviews.Author: rogtess44
Reviews.Content: The location is great just 3 minutes from central bus,train and tube .Our room was a master in the annex good size with a little balcony facing a little garden ,the bathroom was cozy as well as the room .We booked it on the web official site and we got a special offer with a special 15 off and pick up free. When in Rome we will book it again.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL BEDS!!”
Reviews.Author: AvrilDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from the 30 Sept - 2nd Oct. The location was convenient being close to the main train/bus station. Our room was €200 per night, including breakfast. It was ment to be an executive room, so I can't imagine what the normal rooms are like. Breakfast was also very very poor. The hot food consisted of burnt bits of bacon and horrible eggs..You would be better off taking the room only rate and get the breakfast in one of the restaurants out on the street. We did a lot of walking and sight seeing and really just wanted a comfortable bed after a long day.. Well the beds were awful, they were so hard and were just two single beds pushed together so we woke up with aches and pains everywhere (my husband was already on medication for his back and he actually came home from this hotel worse than when we got there). I wouldnt recommend this hotel at all as for us all that we found good about the place was the location (but their are better locations in Rome).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at Morgana”
Reviews.Author: bjornbraga
Reviews.Content: we booked two double rooms for our 3 nights in Rome and we really liked it. The location was great and you could easily walk to the main tourist attraction. We foun plenty of good restaurants with good prices near the hotel. Our rooms were both very good size and had a poweful shower. Breakfast was plenty and the staff was both helpful and and nice. We would come back here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Poor - avoid staying here”
Reviews.Author: ChristianaH
Reviews.Content: Location is convenient, close to the train station. However: 1) TV has only two english-speaking channels. 2) No internet option available for the whole weekend. When it was finally restored it was a nice patience test. 3) Ordered breakfast in room - it never arrived! 4) Very small room. I am 1.68cm and 60 kg and would hardly fit in the shower. 5) Reception and room service would answer the phone after 2-3 minutes of continuous ringing - if they answered at all! We used priceline's name your price and could not cancel; otherwise I would have not stayed there for the money we paid!

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: hjartmannsteel
