Reviews.Content: I came to Rome for a business and booked Morgana as the rate were good. I found the room of a good size and the internet worked very well as this was an important factor for me. The hotel is clean and the staff was helpful and printed out documents for me as needed. As I will return back to Rome I will stay nowhere else. Termini in a minute walk for all trains and buses.

Reviews.Title: “Vintage Decor , Not great neighborhood, close to Termini”
Reviews.Author: bapmiami
Reviews.Content: We stayed at several hotels in different parts of Italy that were fantastic as a four star goes in Europe and when I came in and saw our lobby. corridor and elevator, then the room I was sadly disappointed. The staff was fabulous and the breakfast{we got this hotel on a bidding website and it was marked 4 star} was not included.. It was an extra 10 euros per person , but well worth it. Warm breakfast items and anything you want. This hotel is clean, but very old decor and it only has an elevator for 1 or two and maybe one bag. The WIFI has trouble all the time and the carpet is pulling away from the seams and wallpaper in hallway as well.and the room we stayed in had red velvet brocade wallpaper and the shower and sink area had a step down that could be dangerous for elderly people or a sleepwalker and bathroom had cracked corners with mildew. It was a no smoking hotel but people including bellman smoked in hallway which caused stench of cigarettes in lobby and common area. It was clean for the most part and offers a nice happy hour buffet for guests if you spend more than 5 euro. Its location is great for train.I would bring it down to a 2 1/2 star for decor and a 3 for service employees and breakfast was a 4

Reviews.Title: “Close to Termini Train Station”
Reviews.Author: TravelLovrs
Reviews.Content: After disembarking from a cruise, we stayed at this modest hotel for 5 nights. The rooms were Italian modern, comfortable, but not big. We had a full bathroom, a room safe, and a small refrigerator. The hotel is located about a block from Termini train station. This is convenient for traveling, but watch the pickpockets! We didn't have any trouble, but it is not the best area in town. Nothing to be too worried about, just be "big city cautious" and like all of Rome, don't wear your flashy jewelry or watches! There are many touristy restaurants in the area with a few better restaurants available, if you can wait until 8pm to eat dinner. The major tourist areas are a walk, but generally a pleasant one. Be sure to have a good map to take with you. An alternative to venturing forth in the evening to eat might be the appetizer buffet the hotel offers for free when one orders a drink. There is a common area to sit and chat with other guests. We found that the buffet was not always well stocked. Even mentioning something to the bartender or front desk didn't seem to help. Still, the food was pretty good. The front desk staff seemed very busy most of the time. It was difficult to get help with things like finding out where to buy Metro tickets (the tobacco shops!!!), directions, etc. Still, they were helpful and pleasant, but very busy. They can arrange tours from the hotel and airport transportation. Of note: there are stairs up TO the elevator and additional steps up to some of the rooms. If you have a mobility issue, this might pose a difficulty. In addition, the elevators are TINY! One medium sized person and one medium suitcase is about all they will hold. This is a nice hotel. Prices were high by US standards, but not for a comfortable room in a major city. Restaurants, an ATM, transportation, and a small grocery store are nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Average...not a four star”
Reviews.Author: MagicalRhyme
Reviews.Content: The hotel was average. The positives were that it was close to the train station (where the airport bus drops you off) and internet was free and worked perfectly for us. The downsides were that the hotel was not really a four star and the bathroom flooded every time I had a shower. I am really confused about the star rating system in Rome - a lot of very average 2 and 3 star hotels are given four star ratings. Upon check-in, we were told that we were upgraded. We were not particularly impressed by our upgraded room (apart from the flooding, there wasn't anything glaringly wrong with it, it just didn't seem like an upgrade in a 4 star hotel), which makes us shudder to think what our orginal room would have been like. It is important to note that it is a bit of a walk to Rome's most popular tourist sites but the metro is very close by and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Confirmed reservation not honored”
Reviews.Author: Topazlynn
Reviews.Content: I made a confirmed reservation at Hotel Morgana for two nights this month through Hotels.com. When I called Hotels.com to add an extra night they called the hotel and was told my reservation was cancelled. They said they sent me an email (which I did not receive) cancelling the reservation because of the expiration date on my credit card. Hotels.com also said that they also did not receive notice of the cancellation. Hotels.com found us another hotel immediately. Hotel Morgana would not honor the confirmed reservation. If my credit card info did not match why did they send me a confirmation number!

Reviews.Title: “A decent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: backpaker22
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was fine. It is right near the train station which is a convenience, but for the other attractions it is still quite a hike. I only gave it three stars because in my opinion the hotel was just average. Upon entering the hotel I was not sure what my experience would be like. The front desk took a while to help us check in. Granted - they were busy, but after waiting our turn it took the receptionist a while to notice we were standing at the desk. Once we were escorted to our room I was pleasantly surprised. The room was very modern looking with a decent sized bathroom. For the price this was a fine place to stay. In the end I was fine because there is so much to do and see in Rome that we were almost never at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wifi didn't work, staff not helpful.”
Reviews.Author: Unadave
Reviews.Content: The wifi was for a charge of 10 euro per day, but it never worked. Spend $600 and put a few more repeaters around the building!!! Wifi is a must in this global economy. Also don't advertise King size beds for your expensive upgraded rooms (executive and master suites) and deliver 2 twin beds pushed next to eachother. Not the same thing. Elevator is small and worthless and slow which became a pain when we were on the top floor. Front door was always locked, you had to buzz to be let in. Scared someone is going to run in and rob the place?? Best part was the pizzeria next door, owner was VERY friendly, food was amazing, and very inexpensive! Great service, especially for a European restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, superb location!”
Reviews.Author: Dlphin3
Reviews.Content: Hotel review Rome: Hotel Morgana Review -Location & Arrival:  In my opinion the location of Hotel Morgana is a huge plus for choosing this place to stay! With such a short walk to the metro it's SUPER easy to get around Rome without breaking your wallet on taxi fare. I was thrilled at how easy it was to catch the metro to 95% of the sites we wanted to see.  - My husband & I arrived from Fiumicino Airport.  We had arranged with the hotel for transfer service.  (Refer to their webpage for further information.) Because of the room we booked & the # of nights we were staying the transfer was free. Bonus for us! However, after learning how to use the metro it would have been equally as easy to arrive via metro & for a very reasonable fare (1 euro per person!)  My recommendation for anyone arriving via airport, bus or train: Use the metro & get off at the 'Termini' station.  The hotel is a short 2 blocks away & very easy to navigate...even with luggage. You will exit the station on the 2nd floor. Look for the McDonalds outside. Exit the station going left to the 1st street.  Take that up one block & turn left. This street will be labeled ___________.  The hotel is located on the left hand side of the street just past 2 or 3 cafe/ restaurants.  Staff:  The staff at Hotel Morgana was very pleasant and helpful. There was always a smiling face available to answer questions, help with info regarding metro & bus connections & recommendations for restaurants in the area,  what to do & how to make the most of your day in the event of a transportation strike, etc.  Breakfast:  When we booked, we chose not to add the breakfast option to our reservation. In our past travels we often found that breakfast at hotels in Europe (in our opinion) can be hit or miss & we didn't want to commit ourselves. However, we ended up eating the breakfast every morning at the hotel!!  We were very happy with the selection! Hot scrambled eggs & bacon, tons of bread options, meats, cheeses, cereals, juices, yogurts & fruit! Great way to start a morning before heading out to see the sites of Rome!  Room: For the price, the location, the cleanliness & overall size & setup: I highly recommend this hotel! It holds up to its 4 star rating! The room had a  cozy, classic decor. Compared to American sized hotel rooms, this room would be considered small.  Compared to many other European hotels I've frequented however, I found this to be a good size, easy to move around & with a large bathroom!  Hotel Morgana was fantastic overall & I will be sure to stay here again in the future should I return to Rome. Amenities: -Great TV in room. There is one station that shows American movies which we enjoyed relaxing to after a long day of site seeing. -Quality hair dryer in the bathroom!  Really appreciated that!  -WiFi: great option available but had major difficulty with connecting. It was our only complaint & frustration to speak of.  (There is an Internet spot on the corner near the metro if you need to get online.) -safe: nice feature! -laundry service: nice feature but VERY expensive. DO NOT use unless absolutely necessary!!  Extra notes/thoughts: -just because you put the 'do not disturb' sign on the door, doesn't mean that they still won't come in and clean.  -many others have commented that the street the hotel is located on is 'seedy'....I have to disagree. Regardless of where you go in Rome you should be careful of pickpockets etc. The street was very safe & we encountered NO problems at all!!! Don't let the comments scare you away!  Overall: 4 star. Great hotel. Very happy with our stay.  Good for families, business, traveling alone or couples! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay again”
Reviews.Author: AJM814
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night before a cruise,although there was initial confusion by the receptionist about the location of our room,( it was in the annexe further down the road to the main hotel),we could not fault the overall service,accomodation and breakfast, plus nice and handy for the Termini railway station.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: ocstarwood
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights after staying 2 nights in Vatican area (far outside). This hotel will be our choice for our next trip to Rome. All of the employees were accomodating and very helpful on any question we had. They made restaurant reservations, tours and gave other helpful advice. Good location, plenty of restaurants with very good prices and easy walk to the main places. We will be back at Morgana

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ZayM
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night prior to going on a cruise. Great location right near the train station. Comfortable room, clean and quiet. The only thing to note is that checking in takes time. Not sure why but we had to wait in a separate room while they completed the check in process. After a really long flight we weren't too impressed to have to wait but in the end it was okay. I'd stay here again for the location and value. The girl working the breakfast the morning I left was really rude. Left a bad impression but I didn't let it ruin my day or trip. I figure if she has a bad attitude then whatever that's her problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: NeeNee_Cho
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Rome and on my very first day arrived in Italy. I checked in to Hotel Morgana. From internet, I viewed some pictures of this hotel and expect a well-deco room. Nothing much different from the internet photos, the room is deco with red wallpaper and nice furnitures. However, what surprised me is the size of the room. It is so tiny (I am not sure if most 4-stars hotel in Rome has very tiny room). We struggled to figure out where to place our luggae properly. Aside on tiny room, everything else is fantastic. The location is less than 5 minutes walk from Roma Termini (perfect for those like me who first time travel to Rome) and also within walking distances to Piazza Santa Maria Maggiore. Next to hotel are few "not bad" Italian restaurant with reasonable prices and lastly, the breakfast served is the best compared to the rest of hotels I stayed throughout my Italy trip. But, not sure if it is my unfortunate, we experience electricity trips out for few times at night on our first night as well as in the afternoon on the second day. It is hot summer in end of Aug, it is really annoying us when there is no air-condition. Other than this, it is a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: mikegiovanni
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in august with our 3 years old som. The staff was very warm and welcoming, the room was spacious clean ans comfortable. Couldn't have been more pleases.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: klosett
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently took a trip to Rome and stayed at Hotel Morgana. Location was great, the staff was friendly and very attentive. We will definatley be back.

Reviews.Title: “Ok location, Ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: girlie80
Reviews.Content: Check in with the hotel was quick. They have a happy hour 5-9 where they have some cold meats out which we could help ourselves to while waiting to check in. I had read some reviews online so was a little cautious about the hotel room. The room itself was OK. It was clean. However, due to the location it was noisy in the night due to the many bars and restaurants outside the hotel. There was mini bar facilities available. No tea and coffee facilities. The bathroom was small, and the shower blocked. The breakfast I did not enjoy. What we class as a continental breakfast in the UK is not the same in the continent it seems. You could have ham, quiche, bacon, eggs and doughnuts for breakfast. Orange juice isn't orange. But you can have a glass of water, an apple, a nectarine and some warm yoghurt! However, there are restaurants immediately outside the hotel offering breakfast. I did not try them, but they may be an option. The hotel is a 5 minute walk to the Termini Train Station where all the tour buses go from, so it is a good location in that respect. But the major sites are a good ten-fifteen minute walk minimum.

Reviews.Title: “we found this a very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: deirdrerice
Reviews.Content: this hotel was ideally located within walking distance of most of the main tourist attractions and the Rome central bus and train station.the breakfast was brilliant,the room was spotless and the staff were friendly and very helpful.We will definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back..”
Reviews.Author: Chloe4travel
Reviews.Content: I was a bit concerned about reading all the negative reviews but it was highly exaggerated. Yes, there are a few downsides but it is Rome and your standards need to be adjusted accordingly. I'll breakdown my review in section: Hotel - decent staff, decor a bit dated and lobby not well designed. Access to elevator is a bit of a pain as you have to haul your luggage up a few stairs and the elevator is super tight. Imagine a third of our regular North American Elevator. We had two people and two luggages and there was hardly any space left! Once you do get off th elevator, there are few stairs along the way to your room so be ready to do some weight lifting Room - Nice. no complains Location - very close to Roma termini so it was great for us. About 20min walk to the Colloseum/Trevi/Spanish Steps. Not a big deal at all considering you get to explore the rest of the city on your way. Breakfast - very nice. great selection and plenty!

Reviews.Title: “Better than advertised”
Reviews.Author: aonang54
Reviews.Content: Hotel Morgana was in our opinion better than advertised, the hotel was well maintained and the staff was helpful with number one priority to make your stay there as pleasant and memorable as possible. The accommodation were very neat and extremely clean and comfortable. We were within walking distance from everything we wanted to do in Rome. We would definitely return for a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: ortoskratz
Reviews.Content: We have been here for 2 nights in august. We found our room nice and clean, we didn't spend much time in the hotel as Rome is more intrested! Breakfast was good and kept us stuffed for the most of the day. We went to the happy hour once and it was a good little buffet for only 5 euro (drink incl). i would really stay here again as they have good prices for clean and safe place in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “5 great night stay”
Reviews.Author: helsinkfamily4
Reviews.Content: We had booked 2 rooms as we had our two children with us. They gave us two rooms door to door without any problem. Both of them were of a large size and we had space for our luggage. During our 5 nights the temperature in Rome was very hight but the AC in the room worked perfectly the whole stay. We could walk or take the metro everywhere as the both lines stop at Termini. The staff was helpful and provide maps and tour informations. We would not hesitate to recommend Morgana.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel good rates”
Reviews.Author: zanettitrav
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered great rates compared to other similar hotels in the area. We had 2 good nights here and really for city like Rome the room were so clean that is the most important of all. The room size was normal and the breakfast was very good. Location was good with only 10 min to Colosseum and Forum. Would come back if we visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Only average...”
Reviews.Author: Caroline W
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms and lifts were faulty so we would have to walk up and down the stairs - they advertise that they have airport transfer service...HOWEVER, only if you stay min 3 nights, but they don't put that on their web. Bit dissappointing overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, next to termini station”
Reviews.Author: ohammad82
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night before a cruise. The location is prefect. It's one block from the termini train station and metro station. Easy access to all the great sites.

Reviews.Title: “Warm hospitality in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: elenarom
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nightss here. Have been in other areas of the towm before but Termini is fine with train station and the metro right there. Marco and all the staff are very helpful and friendly and make you feel good. The morning buffet breakfast was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: lussacrendonfr21
Reviews.Content: We booked the Morgana for our stay in Rome as the rate was truly convenient. The hotel was nice and location was perfect as it is close to the main train station were you can easily catch either a bus or the metro to reach any site. Colosseum and roman forum are walking distance, it took just 15 minutes to us. The room was probably the nicest one we had during our trip throughout Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Small, scrappy and nothin' special”
Reviews.Author: Kakk
Reviews.Content: Old, small rooms, bad breakfast and not a good neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: luctetti55
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at this hotel. Not in the most attractive street in Town, but neverthless, the were always plenty of people around and if you want to use public transportation like bus or metro they are just over the corner. We stayed in a standard room on the first floor which was absolutely fine with comfortable bed and a large walk.in shower. There's a nice small bar with a very good afternoon buffet . The hotel is very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: mtravel55
Reviews.Content: Recently tried to book a stay at our usual spot in Rome but it was booked out. Turned to Tripadvisor for some help and found Morgana hotel. The price was very good so we booked. I must say I am happy we did as this hotel came as a surprise. We read some problems people had written about such as small elevator and tiny rooms, well the elevator was small but considering the age of this city and the buildings some things just can't be changed. The room size was just very normal for all european hotel we have been to, don't expect american size of a room anywhere exept you book a suite! We found the breakfast very rich and the location was good as we could walk everywhere and in fact we never even used a cap during the whole stay. Train station in 1min distance for the direct airport line. I have found a new hotel in Rome for my future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: euronics6
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights in august. It lived up to the reviews. This was our first time to Rome and we thought the location was perfect. The service was great and the rooms were nice. Would recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, very good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: leslydimi
Reviews.Content: My 8 years old daughter and I spent 4 days in Rome. The hotel is located near the main station which is normally not the best area but is really very close to the down town and we could walk to the subway in less than 3 minutes and there are many good restaurants and litlle 'trattoias' next to the Hotel. I was slightly nervous about its location having read some of the previous reviews but it was absolutely fine. We had to wait before we could actually check in in to our room, but that's because we took a very early flight in and the hotel was fully booked the night before, so it wasn't too bad. Had many good night sleeps in the comfortable bed and did not hear my neighbours at all. The breakfast was very good and the hotel is clean....this is very important.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy”
Reviews.Author: Gordon C
Reviews.Content: We arrived by train from Paris, via Milan, got to the hotel about 8pm. The hotel is one block from the sttion, walking distance 2 minutes. Does'nt look like much from outside, but pleasantly surprised when we got to our room. Reception very welcoming. Room clean and pleasant, private bathroom. Good breakfast spread. Booked out at 10am, but were only flyinng at 11.30pm. Hotel stored our bags till the evening, no charge. Reception very helpfull throughout our 6 night stay. Would stay again, no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to train station and small but comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: SoCalNative7
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Morgana for 4 nights. I had major doubts, given some of the TripAdvisor reviews, but it was the best deal on Priceline. I agree that the desk attendants weren't very friendly, but that doesn't make-or-break my stay. The room was, indeed, EXTREMELY small. Barely had room for our 2 suitcases. That being said, it was clean, modern, and had AC that worked great (a rarity in Europe, it seems). We didn't have any trouble with noise, but that may vary by room. The bed was very comfortable, which is great since it is the only place to sit in the room! It is very convenient to the train station, which was great for getting to, from and around the city. However, this also means that it isn't in the prettiest neighborhood. I never felt unsafe, but it's worth noting if you are very skiddish. A plus: there are convenience stores nearby for stocking up on water, wine, and such, and a full-service laundromat around the corner if you're traveling for an extended time and need to do laundry. Most frustrating thing was paying for wireless internet that barely worked. I should have pressed for a refund but was too lazy. Overall, a good value for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay of peace and calm”
Reviews.Author: platzymach
Reviews.Content: Rome was an intresting to visit and in some ways stimulating. Our stay at Morgana was very nice. The city is busy so it was good to come back to the peaceful hotel. The desk was always manned by peaceful friendly staff and the refreshments in the bar in the night were just delightful. The room we had was good size overlooking the court yard so we had no problem with noise so we slept very well. We got exactly what we booked. We would book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good service.”
Reviews.Author: zug23
Reviews.Content: Stayed for first time at the Morgana, our office is is relocating neatby. Very good check in and check out experience, professional service, room was large and comfortable with excellent shower. The hotel is located next to the station which is busy day and night but there are many restaurants and shops in the area and the metro station is right there. I travel a lot every month and I will book this hotel again for my next stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: NSJeff
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here the 10, 11 & 12 of August 2011. We found the Hotel to be one big disappointment after another! First off the location, is surrronded by the Chinese part of Italy. I have nothing against the Chinese, but when I'm in Italy, I want to be around Italians, not Chinese! Next the parking - the Hotel has none! They recommend you either try and find parking on the streets around the Hotel (good luck find one), using the parking meters or you can use the privately owned parkade which is FIVE blocks away and costs at least €17 per day (about $25 day CAD)! The check in for our room took exceptionally long...the Hotel itself is very warm and muggy and seems not to believe in using air conditioning for the public areas or the rooms. The Hotel has an exceptional amount of stairs! There are even 4 stairs that lead to the 2 tiny very muggy elevators they have. The hallways have stairs and the rooms have stairs! I would NOT recommend this Hotel for someone with a physical disability! As for the room we stayed in, the room's fridge never did work and the room constantly smelled of bad water or the plumbing! Lastly, one of the mornings we decided to go for breakfast breakfast within the Hotel, we made 100% sure to place the Do Not Disturb sign on our door. Both myself, my wife and one of our teenaged sons all made note that it was placed there properly as our all of our luggage were opened and things were on the beds and we had plans of coming back to the room to put things away before leaving for the day. When we got back to the room after breasfast, we found the Maid "finishing up cleaning our room!" Needless to say, we weren't too impressed by the intrusion and complained to no avail! While the location does have a number of nice cafés and souvenir shops, the area is littered with prostitutes at night! I could not in anyway recommend this Hotel to anyone!! The Hotel price and Hotel star rating are BOTH too high!!

Reviews.Title: “not perfect but fine”
Reviews.Author: adrian t
Reviews.Content: this hotel is close to the metro which is ok as you can get around easy and the bus station is next to the station ,this area is not regarded as the best it seems acording to a taxi driver who we used due to the diversity of imegrants that frequent the area but we never felt that it was any less safe than any where else in the city ,the hotel is ok and be sure there will be a lot worse its just a little tatty in a few respects but nothing to be bothered by too much the best points are the staff who are all really posative and helpfull especialy the top guy who is always pleased to see every one and has no hint of that miserable roman about him at all ,another very good point is that they do what they call a 5 euro happy hour which basicaly means that you get any drink for the 5 euro plus as much as you can eat from a small buffet which basicaly turns this hotel in to a half board as the breakfasts are good to stuff your self for the day and you can then last out until the buffet between 5 and 8 in the evening so you can save money on eating out which we found realy expensive

Reviews.Title: “A very good stay in rome.”
Reviews.Author: aaagg
Reviews.Content: Traveling with a large family of six we need an hotel with family rooms so we booked at the morgana were we'd found a executive family room consisting of two triple rooms connecting ,with was giving us a little bit of extra privacy our room rate included breakfast wich was good . So far one of the best hotel we have been in italy ,we will sure be back.

Reviews.Title: “Bad services!”
Reviews.Author: Fqy
Reviews.Content: The room is extremely small which is understandable because it it in Rome! But it is not really a 4 star hotel, maximum 3 star! After 2 days stayed in the hotel, I left my glassed in the room after I checked out. I called back so many times and no one really helped me! The reception stuff just gave excuses saying that nothing was found when we checked out. That was only few hours after I checked out when I call back! I was so disappointed at this hotel! Be careful everyone!

Reviews.Title: “I will try to write a fair review for this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: foreverglobetrotter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights at the beginning of August and we got a room through the priceline bidding process. Included in the room rate was full breakfast, continental/american style with hot and cold selections such as bacon and eggs, croissant, sweat pastries, cereals, yogurt, etc., not bad at all. We were very worried about the hotel after reading the mixed reviews here since a lot of reviewers complained about the safety of the surrounding area as well as the condition of the hotel. However, the hotel turned out to be quite okay and not nearly as bad as some reviewers had said. We stayed in the main bldg in a room that was not big, but nice and tastefully decorated. I think the hotel would have deserved a 4-star rating as claimed IF ONLY it had kept everything in good repair. The lack of proper maintenance has given the hotel room an "unfresh" appeal - the curtains, the bed cover, the tiles of the bathroom, etc. just looked like they had seen better days. So the nice pictures on the hotel website were probably taken when the hotel was first open, and unfortunately the hotel no longer looks that way. That having said, the linen, towels and daily cleaning were immaculate so we felt pretty comfortable staying there. About safety, as you are aware, the hotel is located very close to the main train station, and one can find a wide variety of people around such area in any big city. However, we did not in any way feel unsafe during our stay there since everyone was just minding their own business and was harmless. There was also a guard at the door, and the main door was always locked in his absence. All in all, we had a pretty decent stay there despite of my initial apprehension.

Reviews.Title: “Big comfy room with free airport driver”
Reviews.Author: kringlan63
Reviews.Content: We booked a Master room for 3 nights. Our room was big and had recently been updated as the bathroom was brand new. They offered to send their private driver to pick us up at fiumicino airport that was nice as the taxi line was long. Breakfast was good and offered everything! Location was also good for explore Rome and no problem walking to see the main attractions. Overall we had the most nicest stay.

Reviews.Title: “You can do much better!”
Reviews.Author: natter1327
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived, our room smelled like sewage and the TV didn't work. After I complained, they moved our room to an "executive suite"...it was still the same size just decorated differently. The shower was so small it was tough to maneuver...while trying to maneuver the soap, I noticed mold COVERING the shower...it was so disgusting!!!! I couldn't wait to get out of there!!! The Wifi is 10 Euros a day. It's so ridiculous that hotels charge for Wifi when it's of no charge for them to provide it for free. The breakfast was not included in the room either. This place was a total rip off. In the evening, we asked the bartender for 2 glasses of ice. He gave us one with a scowl. When we asked for another (there were 2 people, so wouldn't it make sense to give 2 glasses?) you would have thought we were asking for his firstborn child with the attitude he gave us. At the beginning of our trip, we stayed in Merulana Inn and it was FAR superior. It was very close to Morgana but cheaper, MUCH cleaner, good free breakfast, and free Wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel rooms are Very small”
Reviews.Author: Nell77Australia
Reviews.Content: Before booking Hotel Morgana Deluxe Quad room I contacted the hotel to be assured it was a spacious room. Upon arrival we found 2 single beds had been pushed next to the double bed. Considering 3 headboards were in the room we feel it was a triple room and not for 4 people. As we were flying internationally we had 3 suitcases which had to be stacked upon each other as there was no space. Due to this we placed the Do not Disturb sign on our door as you could not move round the room, after a day out we found the staff had entered our room. The receptionist could not understand why we were upset with the room or entry to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Great price!”
Reviews.Author: singletravel99
Reviews.Content: I was here just for a 1 night stop on my way down to the Amalfi coast. I had booked a single room but they gave me a double room with double bed! The room was nice and the price was very good. I had the breakfast in the morning that was rich and they made the best cappucino i had in italy. Next time I come through Rome I have found my new place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: thorsdottir4
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed at Morgana for 5 days. We really liked all about our stay. First of all they sent a driver to meet us at the airport as we had booked directly through the hotel website. When we arrived we got two rooms door to door just as booked. The rooms were both good size, had been updated and were super clean. The following day we had the breakfast that was a huge buffet with about everything. Front desk staff was helpful and offered maps and other information. Location was good and no problem to walk everywhere we wanted to go. The area around the hotel is not as bad as many review state. In the same street there are at least 4 other hotels, 5 restaurants and the termini station can be reached in less than 2min. Overall a very nice stay for a family trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel great value”
Reviews.Author: jackobsenfamily9
Reviews.Content: We found great deal on the hotel website few days befor our arrival. They came and pick us up for free from the airport with private driver that was nice as the FCO airport is one mess and alot of dishonest people that offers rides into the city. When we arrived at Morgana Marco agreed us in very professional way and checked us in even it was still early in the morning. Our room was very nice, bigger than we expected and super clean in fact the entire hotel was. We booked some tours with the hotel that were nice and in the end we were very happy with our stay at Morgana.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, great location, extremely clean”
Reviews.Author: gae67la
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing vacation in Rome and Morgana hotel made it even better. From the moment we walked in, we were greeted by a very professional receptionist (Marco). When we got to our floor some of the standard rooms were being cleaned and they all look confortable and the design is nice. The Morgana iss a great hotel with extremely kind and helpful staff, great location, and clean. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: mulhousekell96
Reviews.Content: We've enjoyed our short stay at the morgana! Our room was clean and spacious with nice modern decor. Internet was not for free, as in many other hotels we've stayed before, but they charge you only 10 euro per day, which is a fair price. We liked the breakfast and the afternoon buffet that they use to organize in the lounge, it's really a good found! In short, it's been truly a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: gunnragg
Reviews.Content: We had great stay at morgana hotel. The staff took good care of us the whole time and our room looked updated and was very clean. Hotels in Europe intend to have small rooms while ours was just fine. The location is very good to see Rome with the buses, metro and all trains stopping just few min walk outside of the hotel. We walked everywhere as the city itself is not that big at all. We would use Morgana hotel again for future visit in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with trade offs”
Reviews.Author: PacNWGuy
Reviews.Content: Close to the train station meant a lot of traffic and the rooms, especially on the lower floors, didn't have the best noise treatment. The breakfast which was included in our price, was a real gem with plenty of fresh, healthy food choice. A real plus. There were problems with our air condition on the first day which also happened to be one of the year's hottest. The first staff they sent up was pretty clueless and when things didn't get better 4 hours later (did I mention my wife was sick) I took the problem to the front desk staff. No solution that night, so we toughed it out and only got a couple of hours sleep. Next day I spoke with one of the assistant managers who was a much better trouble shooter. We got moved to an upgraded upper level room that had an air conditioner that worked and it was quieter to boot. No extra charge and they gave us a 20% break on our first night's staff. Also absorbed lounge charges and paid for our trip to the airport as we were heading out. All in all, we felt well treated.

Reviews.Title: “A little dated”
Reviews.Author: Scalarnet
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the hotel Morgana on several trips to Roma. However, I will not stay there again. The location can't be beat (near Termini), but the rooms are getting very dated. The breakfast is not that great and the heavy chairs in the breakfast room are hard to manage. Good wireless in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: PLDTravel
Reviews.Content: The rooms and bathrooms look modern, and are clean. They are small. The staff appeared to always be a in lousy mood. They charge for internet. They wanted 9Euros per person for breakfast. The location is good in terms of getting to the train/ taxi/ bus station quickly. But in general, being around the train station isn't the nicest.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly stay in a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: snyderr
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful experience during our four day visit to Rome. Breakfast every morning had a great selection including many American friendly choices. The hotel's location made for easy access to the Metro and other forms of transportaion. It was very hot during our visit and the hotel air conditioning was adequate to keep us comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “NOT A 4 STAR BY A LONG SHOT”
Reviews.Author: bellaluna16
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night it this "hotel". I was given a twin sized bed, that was obviously slept it and had paid for a KING room. Breakfast was not included in my "economy" reservation, which I tried to tell them I paid for a KING room. I had to pay for internet, that barely worked. There were prostitutes at night and the Hotel keeps the door locked at night. There was a lot of drug activity right outside the door and so walking anywhere is not an option,especially if you are alone, as I was. The room was tiny, and dirty, however the bathroom was newer. Worst of all, repeated attempts to call and email, from myself and my travel agent have gone unreturned. I would not suggest this hotel to anyone, and I believe that a 4 star rating is not even close. I had friends who stayed in a 4 star that same night, paid less, it was beautiful, had two large beds in the rooms, nice lobby, air conditioned etc.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE THIS HOTEL. Highly recommended, best staff ever, warm and professional. Best stay in EUROPE !”
Reviews.Author: Wbbwifey
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, I truly want to thank every one at The Morgana Hotel. I should mention that I took a month long vacation in Europe with my two children. As a woman traveling alone, a good hotel was important to me. I booked this hotel through priceline, since I have used them in the past. I contacted the Hotel a couple of days in advance via email to make sure the room would be a fit for all three during our stay. The Hotel staff was promptly responding to all my emails and my concerns. We finally arrived to Rome, and checked in at the Morgana. What a great surprise and wonderful experience to say the least. Miss Mariza at the reception desk was very professional, corteous, knowledgable and was pleased to address my needs. She mentioned that she would likely place me in a better room with a small extra charge for the extra bed. She was truly kind to us and gave us a very comfotable and nice totally remodeled Master room at the annex. We have stayed in several nice hotels, but this one for European standards was comfotable, spacious and very comfortable. We were very please that Miss Mariza was helpful and gave us that room for (7) days. Another highlight to our visit was the Bar. When we first arrive, we were informed of a few of the ammenities of the hotel. One of the is the Happy Hour (for the cost of a min 5 euro drink) we decided to give the bar a try that evening. We were pleasantly greeted by the bartender (Elmer). I would like to make a special comment to the supervisors and management (owners) of this hotel. Elmer takes a lot of pride of his work. He made us feel very welcomed every single day. My kids were lookling forward every evening to the happy hour to spend some time with Elmer. He was always trying to accomodate all our needs, special drink requests, and even recommending new things. We see how staff like him can draw more guest into a hotel. I am a firm believer that the comfort, location and ammenities of a hotel are important. But my strongest belief is that a staff member that goes above and beyond can change the view of your stay. I also want to mention that this hotel is place is a very good area. Super close to the metro and offers great safety. I was pleased to see their ring the door method. That way, you do not have people just walking in to the hotel. The security guard, Guiseppe was very nice to us as well. He was friendly, welcoming, professional and so courteous. He was a true joy that made us feel very safe. My kids were looking forward to see him every evening during our happy hour visit to the bar. The room expectations were great, clean, comfortable rooms, great decoration, hotel close to everything, you will feel just at home here. The Breakfast in the morning was really good. We didn't get to eat there every morning. We had it a couple of times only, but the staff was also corteous. If you are looking for a very comfortable stay at a great price, stay at the Morgana. I am looking forward to return to Rome and stay here in the future. I will not hesitate to recommend this great place to friends and family. To the Owners: Please make sure to make a special recognition to the high level of service provided by : Elmer, Mariza and Guisseppe. We were honored to be served by staff that makes travel and hospitality more enjoyable. High level of service like the one provided by the staff mentioned above, does not happen in every hotel. I am more than happy to forward a direct letter to you to validate the recommendation of this review. I stayed at your hotel for 7 days, and were the most wonderful during my one month vacation in Europe. Thank you Hotel Morgana, Y. Hirsh.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay in rome.”
Reviews.Author: helro5g
Reviews.Content: Been our first visit to rome we did search for an hotel with a convenient location in town so we booked a room at the hotel morgana. It has a very good location very close to the main train,bus and tube station so we had no problem to move around without spending a fortune for taxis. Good service ,clean room ,excellent breakfast . Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very good organization.”
Reviews.Author: giacpicco
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel 3 nights directly. They offer a complimentary pick up from the airport with private driver who was waiting for us upon arrival, very nice service. The staff was very friendly and they assigned us the room which was perfect. We have spent a lot of time at the bar because the buffet is very good and the bartender was very kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: crimasi
Reviews.Content: We stayed our last night in Italy at the Morgana and it was perfect. The staff at the reception was very friendly and they upgraded us to a Master room which was very nice. The location is very good next to the main station where leaves the train to the airport and there are many restaurants in the area. Very good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: Juricell1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline (1st mistake). They booked it for 2, when we input 3 people. Upon arriving the staff was extremely irritated by this issue. After several long minutes of discussion, and a talk with her manager, she offered us an additional room for 100 Eros to put my 12 year old in??? Really? After seeing the room, we determined the bed was big enough for the 3 of us. And they gave of free Wi-Fi as a concession. The room actually was nice (it was in the 'tower', down the road a block?? but it was nicely decorated and clean. After using the bathroom once, the toilet broke and we found the phone didn't work. We stopped by the office as we went to dinner and they said they would look at. Upon returning - nothing was fixed (and no notes of any kind). They quickly moved us to a new room, just as clean and nice. However the safe numbers 1, 2 and 3 didn't work, we found this out the next morning AFTER we had put our "important" documents in it! We then had to wait around for the manger to come in to get the issue resolved - so our morning got delayed. And then the morning of check out - the air quit. Overall, it wasn't a bad hotel; we just must have been jinxed. The staff was begrudgingly helpful and the rooms were nice, quiet and clean, but we wouldn't stay here again. It was conveniently close to the train but as far as walking distance, it was quite far from all the main sites you typically visit

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel.”
Reviews.Author: papiril
Reviews.Content: It was the first stop on our honeymoon and we were treated to a wonderful executive room upgrade. The room was large and cozy and we received a bottle of spumante complimentary. Great service and perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and service.”
Reviews.Author: satips56
Reviews.Content: On a family trip in italy traveling by train we needed a hotel close to the main train station with family accomodations . Googling aroud we have found the hotel morgana the location was perfect as well as the rate offered on the official site so we booked and we were very pleased with it.we have got an executive family room consiusting in two double rooms interconnecting that were just renovated . Big flat tv ,very clean, confortable beds . Staff was helpfull . We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a nice experience”
Reviews.Author: nickjostinn22
Reviews.Content: Our experience there has been overall positive. We arrived early in the morning and the guy at the front desk checked us in and was so kind to give us a room ready, as he understood we were so tired after a long flight. The room was reasonably spacious and very comfortable, with modern colourful decor. Being our first time in Rome, we booked a tour of the city suggested by the front desk staff, and it was a good idea! Main attractions are either within walking distance or easily reachable by metro (nearest stop is just around the corner). Breakfast was delicious and Ì appreciated their tasty cappucinos!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and price.”
Reviews.Author: letfaby33
Reviews.Content: Good place to base yourself for seeing Rome. Easy access to public transport, close to tiurist attractions. Hotel was clean, well presented and appeared to have been recently refurbished. Very nice breakfast room and very good service.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay !”
Reviews.Author: aatrurd
Reviews.Content: The hotel morgana came out to be the best place we have been in italy so far . The location is very convenient close to the major attractions . We have booked a family deluxe and we have got 2 nice rooms connecting that was very convenient for our kids. The buffet breakfast was a nice way to start the day with.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: sandra8728
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online and we were able to get a very good last second deal. We were not expecting too much from it but it came out to be a good choice. It's location is just perfect 3 minutes walking from main railway station were our shuttle train from the airport arrived, easy to walk to place like Roman national museum, colosseum, roman forum etc. Our room have been renovated just few weeks before and was very clean, nice and cozy with a very big shower. Breakfast was just fantastic and Carmelo, the food and beverage supervisor was very friendly and charming. We booked our room without breakfast but then after seeing what was offered, we decided to pay 9 euro for an all you can eat breakfast, with an incredible high-quality food and variety, at an incredible price.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: ecg1103
Reviews.Content: First off, the room is tiny even by Europe Standards, like only big enough to hold a bed and a desk, with barely any walking room. The bathrooms was nice with a decent size shower. The issues started when we checked in. We got there at about 6pm on a Saturday and was told that we would have to wait to check in because they were busy doing other things (not sure what they meant by that). So the girl at the front desk told us to wait in the lounge and to help ourselves to their happy hour buffet. Mind you the happy hour buffet was just frozen food, reheated, and thrown on a tray, nothing special. So as we sit in the lounge waiting to be called up to check in, a waiter comes over and asks us for our drink order, we politefully declined, but he said we would need to run a $10 Euro bar tab in order to indulge in their happy hour buffet. We had no idea, since the front desk had told us to sit in the lounge and help ourselves to the food. We immediately stopped eating and said we weren't paying for drinks. The waiter than went and got the girl at the front desk who backed him up saying we would need to buy drinks in order to enjoy the buffet. We then reminded her that she invited us to the buffet and she mumbled something in Italian to the waiter and left us alone. 10 minutes later we finally checked in. I found the staff to be rude and seemed to get annoyed with any request made by guest. For the money, I really don't think this place is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, wished we had been closer to the action”
Reviews.Author: DetroitareaKate
Reviews.Content: We stayed here through a bid on Priceline. The 1st room we were in was small, absolutely no view, horrible bed, stained carpet, TINY shower... the staff was so understanding and moved us with no problem. The next room we were in was very nice- more of the 4 star quality Priceline promised. This is a nice hotel if you reserve the correct room, but it is not near most of the attractions in Rome. You will need to take the subway (which is easy) or take a taxi. The only semi close attraction was the Colosseum. There are cafes within walking distance. Parking through the hotel was at least 9 blocks away and expensive. Since we were there Saturday night through Tuesday morning, we were able to park on the street for free and had no trouble finding parking. We were happy to have AC, but it was merely adequate. Could have been more refreshing after a hot day walking around Rome. We enjoyed our stay here. The staff was nice, helpful, and accommodating. We just would have preferred to be closer to central Rome.

Reviews.Title: “If your thinking of booking the Quad room, don't!”
Reviews.Author: Louis918
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel was clean and the staff were friendly the room itself left much to be desired. We booked the quad because it was cheaper than 2 doubles but regretted the decision. The air conditioning unit in the room would switch itself off periodically through the night, which was ridiculous considering we stayed in Rome during the hottest week of the year. On top of this, when coming back to the room after a day in the city it would clearly smell of sewage. There was no blind on the poorly frosted bathroom window and i'm certain the people in the kitchen of the apartment opposite could see in. Overall, i would definitely avoid this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to train station”
Reviews.Author: RobertH68
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Italy and I stayed in this hotel on a recommendation of a friend, its nice hotel, but the rooms are very small and If I was returning to Rome I think I would choose somewhere a bit more central. Located close to the train station which is handy if you needing to use the rail network but there is is not that much else nearby. The hotel was very clean and the complimentary airport pickup (as we stayed 3 nights) made it good value. I chose to have breakfast included, which consisted of an average selection of hot and cold breakfast food for a 4star hotel, the staff generally pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “True family hotel”
Reviews.Author: cellrice
Reviews.Content: We had booked 3 rooms for our family trip to Rome and we all agree that it was a great stay. The rooms were big and comfortable and had a clean touch. Helpfull staff at the front desk and good breakfast in the morning. We found it easy to go around Rome from Morgana as the loaction was great. This hotel is family friendly with travelers from all over the world. We met some nice people at the afternoon buffet they offer for free (with every drink you buy) very nice!

Reviews.Title: “It's good, comfortable and convenient. The 4-star is a stretch though”
Reviews.Author: Lucre20
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Morgana in Rome. It was quite comfortable, clean and convenient, which were the things we cared about the most. I would not necessarily call this a 4 star establishment. We got a room that was in a separate building about half a block from the main hotel. It was in an old building with character, though the interior of the room was modern and clean. It's located very close to Termini, which was super handy when there was a taxi strike the day we were leaving Rome; we were able to walk to the train station to get to the airport. Having stayed in plenty of 5 star hotels, I would not give Morgana a 4 star,rather I think it is more like a 3 star. The staff were friendly and helpful, their buffet breakfast was pretty decent and had a wide range, so no complaints there. All in all, great location, good staff, no complaints. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Big family room and free shuttle”
Reviews.Author: silvianott
Reviews.Content: We booked one family room for all 4 of us and as we had small children we requested an interconnecting room. The room they gave us was better than expected, very big with enough space for all of us. The hotel is well located and is vey clean everywhere you go. Breakfast had a complete buffet and nothing was missing! We found it easy to depart from the hotel visiting other parts of Rome and most easy to come back as all buses arrive at Termini. Staff was helpfull and the front door of the hotel is locked so you feel safe in the hotel. Best part was their free airport car that they gave us upon departure for that only thing we had booked through their website (that anayway offer the best rates as well) so even better. We had great stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and convenient”
Reviews.Author: jennicat5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nightd while attending a conference in Rome. Everything about our stay was wonderful. The staff was kind and responded quickly to all of our questions. The breakfast was delicious and well tended to. Everything was clean and well decorated. I can't wait to come back on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm. ok but not worth 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: BiancaogThomas
Reviews.Content: When coming to Hotel Morgana, we was met by a very helpful receptionist, and check-in was quickly done. Bringing a big suitcase, the elevator was an unplesant surprise, beacuse of the fact that it´s not big enough to fit 2 people and luggage. The room was ok, nicely decorated, but also extremely small. Aircon is not that functional, and i would be sorry to stay here when its really hot. Cleaning was very good, towels were changed every day and we were given free toiletarticles as well every day. The shower was the smallest i have ever seen, and there would not be room for an overweight or pregnant person in there. A lot of noise at night.So this was a mix of positive and negative experiences. I dont think that we would like to return.

Reviews.Title: “Good position”
Reviews.Author: BlondesKiller
Reviews.Content: Close to the Termini Station - suitable if you have to catch train early morning. Fantastic breakfast! Elevator is quite small and difficult to find your room - but overall impression is positive!

Reviews.Title: “One perfect night stay.”
Reviews.Author: dagur
Reviews.Content: We came early in the morning at Morgana, and as they had some rooms ready they checked us in right away. Great we could take shower before going out. We decide to go for their breakfast right away and only paid 8 euro for each for full buffet with great fresh coffee. The location is the best as we wanted to see as much during our short visit. Our room faced out to the back yard and we found it quiet and nice. The room had touch of clean and so did the bed linen. Bathroom was small but had a good shower. On departure day the kept our luggage for free so we could visit Rome. Great to be able to walk to Termini in 1min for the train to the airport. Wonderful place!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with good offers”
Reviews.Author: kristinedanish
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on review from this website. I don't agree with all of them as we found this hotel on of our best in Italy. The Termini area is very central located and with both metro lines all the buses or just 15min walk you can reach the old part of Rome. We didn't find any strange people around the hotel or we ever felt unsafe. (we had child with us) Our room was big size and the bathroom was recently been updated. We had book a deluxe room and paid on their webite so we had very good rate and a free private driver to take us back to the airport. The staff was polite and helpful and gave us map and other handy info. This is a good family hotel and I don't think you find better place for this price. We will book this place if we return to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: mythreebuoys
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one block from the Termini-an easy walk even pulling luggage. Our room faced the courtyard and did not have a view but was a lovely respite after a long flight. We stayed here again at the end of the trip with an early morning flight--easy walk to train station for 30 minute train to FCO. Breakfast was not included in our room--we paid 8 euros--great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: ipapi
Reviews.Content: We had booked two economy rooms for our stay in Rome. The room was much better than we had ever thought. We had plenty of space in the room and the bathroom was very clean and well maintained. Location was great and so easy to visit all parts of Rome. You find good restaurants around the hotel with very good prices. This hotel had all we expected for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel but i'm sure there are better around!”
Reviews.Author: LindsayPReviews
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Rome and i decided to book this hotel as it had such great reviews on Trip Advsior, however this is certainly not a 4 star hotel it is most definitely a three star with a few bonuses. The appearance of the hotel was nice and clean i had no problems with this, staff seemed nice but kept to themselves as did we. The location of the hotel was my biggest concern, one side seemed ok and the other side was really ghetto (and i grew up in Croydon so I know what i'm talking about!!) On one side there was plenty on dodgy looking people hanging about in groups, probably harmless but nevertheless still intimidating. There was lots of grafitti everywhere and run down shops, very unpleasant to be honest. The other side of the hotel was ok, very close to Termini station. The facilities were average and the breakfast, everything looks nice on the surface but in reality there are better places out there so i would say to look for hotels elsewhere. Also there are no good food places round the hotel. Our room was nice we paid extra for the deluxe double, but still average.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a handy location. Ask for the renovated rooms in the annex.”
Reviews.Author: JasonManikel
Reviews.Content: We spent our last night of a fourteen-day (seven-hotel) trip to Italy here. It's a convenient location, and we were very pleased with the free upgrade to a renovated room in their "annex" building. The location - just a couple of blocks from the main train station - is very handy. Though the area doesn't have many sites, per se, and all the local restaurants are tourist traps. The hotel's lobby is on the ground floor (which was nice for a change). We had booked a basic room, but were offered a free upgrade to a "master" room in the annex, which is in a separate building down the block. The room was very nicely renovated - very modern and tasteful. It was small though (even by Italian standards) - especially the bathroom. But the AC worked and there was free wifi. We didn't see the economy room we would have gotten without the upgrade, so it's tough to compare the value of this place directly to other hotels we stayed at. But for what we paid, it was a very good deal. We preferred it to the other hotel we'd stayed at in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A good rate for a fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: novellamcallister65
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room at the morgana cause I found a great deal on their official site - discount on the rate and free internet all my stay long. When I checked in I was positively impressed by the friendlyness of the staff who welcomed me; they also provided lots of information about tours of the city - I booked one through them and it was nice as they pick up and return you to the hotel. The room was beautiful, with nice modern decor. In the afternoon they serve appetizers at the bar area; drinks are at a charge but it really worth it! A great stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely newly renovated rooms close to Roma termini”
Reviews.Author: kelenmelisa
Reviews.Content: Location is just a few minutes walk away from the main train station. It's a lively area, lots of shops and restaurants/cafe near the hotel. It's not close to the city centre though trevi fountain etc. Walking would take you approx 45min. We were very happy with our room. The hotel is small but charming and clean. Breakfast was sufficient nothing fancy but good enough. We travelled with our 3 years old son, an the only trouble I found was there's no direct lift from the ground floor. We had to carry luggages and stroller up steps before going up the smallest lift we've ever seen!! Overall a good hotel would stay again based on the room quality but would probably prefer something closer to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with huge discount rate”
Reviews.Author: dandg45
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel after reading blended review on this site. We found this hotel exactly what we were looking for, this is a 4 star hotel and thats what you get. Breakfast was the biggest i have ever got in similar hotels style and the room was clean that is not common in big cities like Rome. Upon all that we even got a big discount by prepaying the stay in advance. Overall a great located hotel with good service.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel deal in Rome”
Reviews.Author: italiatrip2011
Reviews.Content: I can honestly say that before booking my hotel stay in Rome I did a good research and my final pick was Morgana. Their webpage has plenty of offers that beat all other prices online. We came in to Rome by train from florence and as our room included a airport service we were able to use that on the end of our stay. (A driver to the airport cost normally 50-60 euro for 2pax). We were happy with the hotel as well having booked one of their executive rooms. We got all the help needed from the staff including maps and tour information. The bar offer a great buffet in the afternoon FREE with every drink (that are not even expenisve). Overall a great stay, very happy with my pick of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spring promo - free airport pick up !!”
Reviews.Author: tiburmanj
Reviews.Content: Me and my family just got back home after 4 wonderful nights at Morgana. We booked directly through their website and please before you book elsewhere read what they offer it made a huge difference for a family of four like us. We paid the stay in advance and received huge discount and a private driver that met us at the airport. No other 4 star hotel in Rome offer such discount. Our room was very big for Roman standard and all the staff took good care of us. Location is good with easy walk to all you want to see really. We have no complain at all about our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: hagridsvinir
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel twice and really like it. The staff was so friendly and helpful on our first visit that we had to return. Room size is good and location the best to see Rome. I would recommend to stay whether on business or pleasure

Reviews.Title: “Great 4 stars hotel!”
Reviews.Author: theodoreodonnelly23
Reviews.Content: We had such a nice experience at the morgana! Our room was spacious and the recent update was evident, I liked the style! Breakfast was not included in our rate but we paid an extra to have as we found it much convenient that having just a coffee outside. With just 8 euro you got a rich buffet and tasting cappuccinos! Location was great, with metro and buses around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “We will come back!”
Reviews.Author: matiz81
Reviews.Content: We had very nice time at this hotel. We were travelling with our 4 month old son and the staff gave us a baby cot in the room for free. Location of Morgana is really good and we had no problem at all with the termini area. Size of the room was good and everything was very clean. We did not buy the breakfast with the room rate so can't comment on that. We will be back here.

Reviews.Title: “Be warned about te room sizes and room utilities!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgieTay
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the 4 star proviso and expected 4 star quality. The website photos of the rooms are not true to form - our "twin" room (bed was made up as a double and not changed when offered) was cramped and uncomfortable with 2 suitcases. If you don't mind the "characteristic" taste of the fancy dress shop (and it's clientel) over the road, the hotel is positioned within walking distance of most major attractions. The buffect reakfast was acceptable but avoid the busiest times as the room is very cramped and it was difficult to get in and out of your seats. It seems to me that more attention was paid to the common areas of the hotel rather than the rooms. Apart from the size, the decor was bland. The mini bar was empty, no in-room tea or coffee services were offered, and when we were provided with bottles of water there was no bottle opener available. We paid for Wifi yhat didnt work in the room either. Thank god we were only there for 2 nights. I would not stay at this hotel again. The only redeeming factor was a pleasant night duty manager.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel which provided a good base for our visit to Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Ang0157
Reviews.Content: We had a really good sized room and a a big bathroom which we were really pleased with. The hotel was very clean and our room was cleaned thoroughly everyday and the towels were also changed everyday. The breakfast was very good, there was a huge choice of food - something to suit everybody's tastes! All the staff were very helpful and the termini area is not as rough as the travel books state.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: bostonfan65
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend in Rome at Morgana and could not have had a better stay. Our room was beautiful and clean and the staff were very gracious and friendly. The hotel provides a good breakfast in the morning and a buffet bar in the evening with good assortment of fruit, cheese,pizza and we even ended eating there one night. The location is good with easy access to all parts of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Super location - good staff”
Reviews.Author: losquifos
Reviews.Content: We must say that this hotel offer very good service and clean and comfy beds. Our room had a bathtub that was nice after a long day in the city. Breakfast was rich but the service for coffee was very slow. The front desk staff were all fluent in english that is not common in italy. Overall a nice stay, we would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrDanTheMan
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, we were unsure of the neighborhood. It was an ethnic area around the corner from the train station. It turns out that this is the main area for most of the hotels in the city and very convenient to all the attractions and train terminal with great restaurants. The parking lot was just up the street and very cheap (17 euros a day). Hotel lobby was new and very stylish. When we checked in they upgraded us to a brand new suite ( they converted a floor of an apartment building a few doors down to these very modern and stylish suites and superior rooms). We were very impressed with the room. It was 3 times larger than any room we had ever stayed in while visiting Europe. The bathroom was very breathtaking. The only complaints we had was when we showered, the water would collect on the edge of the tub and then run down to the floor causing a big puddle. Nothing we did stopped it from happening and the internet was painfully slow in the annex building (but we were able to log onto a neighbor's modem which was fast). The breakfast buffet was also impressive and large. Staff was very friendly. We couldn't recommend this hotel more!!!

Reviews.Title: “A cozy hotel very well located”
Reviews.Author: ulrikenutte54
Reviews.Content: We loved the Morgana! The room was really nice with a traditional decor. The hotel is ultra centrally located and we could walk everywhere. Breakfast was rich and delicious. The staff is friendly and welcoming. Overall, a very good experience!

Reviews.Title: “simple and nice 4 star hotel with free airport service!”
Reviews.Author: jesperkasper25
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for simple and good 4 star hotel this is a good pick. We had good size of room and the bathroom was all new. The room was clean and you felt safe as the security was good and the staff welcomed you each time entered. Eveybody at the front desk were helpfull giving handy info about the city. Breakfast was good and the location as well. For what we paid we liked very much our stay here and what other hotel give free car to the airport after staying 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: fabiadri
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Morgana and it was perfect. The location is very good, only 2 minutes from the station. The room was very clean, spacious and with wifi access. The staff is friendly and helpful and the breakfast was very good. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in very good location”
Reviews.Author: tanatigre5
Reviews.Content: We just got back home after 4 nights at Morgana and we really liked this hotel. I don't understand previous comments as this hotel is very clean and we both found the staff very helpfull with everything we asked for. The hotel was busy during our trip but the staff gave you there time anyway to help out with everything requested. As well we don't understand if anyone complain about the breakfast as they had everything you could ask for, egg, bacon, sweets, cake, fruit, bread, cheese and hams and salami. They serve american coffe but just ask them for cappucino and they will serve it without any extra fee. Overall a great stay, we would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: Dscho314
Reviews.Content: Hotel Morgana was a decent hotel as long as you don’t have high expectations. We stayed 3 nights in the Deluxe Double. The rooms were small, but decent and quiet. It is nicely located next to Termini if you are having to catch a train, you can walk with your luggage there. Front desk was fairly helpful, although they did turn us on to the best restaurant we found in all of our travels. The nice thing was if they didn’t have the answer, they would look it up online for you. As far as we could tell, they truly were there at the desk 24 hours, so that was nice to know. The breakfast buffet was OK, but nothing to write home about. Overall if you are traveling on a budget, this is a good hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Bad bad bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: visitorofworld
Reviews.Content: This is not a 4 star hotel.... 2 star, perhaps pushing 3 at the most. Postives: fantastic location near the train station. Easy to get to the airport express and the metro. Negatives: Bad service, disorganised staff, wi-fi not working, given an old unrefurbished room that was dirty, moved to a new room after wi-fi not working on 3rd floor for 24hrs. New room was nice but had a bad smell from the restaurant extraction below. Whilst the location is good near the train station, it also means that as an area the prostitutes come out at night and hang about on the local streets. Never felt any danger though. Breakfast was good as it was reduced to 8 euros per person. If it was charged at 15 euros (as nornal), it would be very overpriced. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Very European”
Reviews.Author: JRP07
Reviews.Content: Based on the other reviews it sounds like there are some wide ranges in room types here but it was basically what I had expected. TEENY room but with very 'old world' decoration which at least gave it some character. Speaking of teeny, the elevator barely fits 2 with no luggage. Internet connection didn't work (but they didn't charge us). Mattress was below par. Water pressure/temp in bathroom was surprisingly good. Breakfast was ok, but since we got this hotel on Priceline, it was nice that it was even included at all. The location made me nervous at first - being so close to the huge/busy train station, but we slept with the window open and I didn't hear a peep! And I liked being able to walk to the metro. So easy! So for an older hotel in a European Metropolis - it was perfectly acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and very clean, surprisingly so for the rates”
Reviews.Author: avramd
Reviews.Content: Hotel Morgana was the least expensive hotel that I considered in Rome, and I was shocked at how freshly decorated and clean it was. It was legitimately a luxury hotel apart from room size, which was still more than adequate for the price. Their location is perfect for someone coming to Rome via train and not planning on renting a car. It is only about 2-3 block walk from the station, perfectly walkable with a roller bag, 2nd bag, and a backpack. Also, the staff is quite helpful, knowledgeable and friendly by Roman standards. The following really is a compliment, but until you've been to Rome it won't sound like it: The staff are only slightly snarky, and actually bother to make their comments about your lack of knowledge of their city or culture sound like friendly ribbing. The don't even insult you to your face or act like they are doing you a favor by taking your money!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: VivaKeenTraveller
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel. We were very impressed with their service, did not have to complain about anything at all. The room was spacious, had a safe, flatscreen TV, huge comfy bed, nice and clean bathroom with lots of little extras, fresh towels and cleaning service every day. The buffet breakfast had many options on offer. Excellent location to get to all the sights as it is 2 mins walk from Roma Termini, however as with the immediate area around any major station in any country, you should avoid being out late at night around the station for your own safety, as it can feel quite abandoned. Overall a very good choice of hotel, could not fault them in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: hellcat_101
Reviews.Content: The room was small but well furnished. The hotel is close to Termini station so easy to get back to the hotel after a long day discovering the city. The buffet breakfast was great and the hotel was quiet despite being in a busy area.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Gail154995
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very convenient for sight seeing. Our room was quiet and clean and very modern looking. The breakfast was amazing. The staff were very attentive and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Old world service and good rooms in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: ninakent
Reviews.Content: Conveniently situated between the Santa Maria Maggiore and Termini, the main railway station, which meant we could always find our way back by public transport, the Hotel Morgana is quiet and quite stately. The staff are quiet and polite. We had a small problem with the booking and it was dealt with very efficiently by the reception staff, who put up with my small tantrum.
