The rooms are immaculate and spacious and cleaned within an inch of its life. Good shower and comfortable bed. I thought the breakfast was expensive and not terribly good. The coffee was dire, which I can't forgive in Italy! Bu there are lots of cafes around the station which serve great coffee, orange juice and sweet brioche for about a third of the price as their 'colazione express'.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good as reviewed here”
Reviews.Author: Lethhaly25
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 2 adults and one child for one night after a train ride from Milan and flight out the next day. Pros - The location for us was perfect becasue it is so close to the train station. It is also close enough to most attractions in Rome apart from the Vatican, but the metro/buses are right there at central station. Shopping is okay, especially if you head down Via Cavour or Via Nazionale. The staff were great and the rooms large and clean with own shower/toilet. We did not eat here but there a whole bunch of italian restaurants on the street and even more around the around the area. The beds were comfortable and staff friendly and helped with a transfer to the airport. Cons - Not the hotels fault, but the location on the map with google is wrong. It is not far from the corner of Via Gioberti on Via Filippo Turati. We ended up down the far end of Via FT because of google maps. The area is a little borderline with some shady characters but it is close to main streets and we had no problems or even felt uncomfortable once we were at the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: CalifFmly
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Hotel Morgana in late March 2011. Would definately stay again. Friendly staff, decent size room with a surprise Jacuzzi tub (great after a long day walking around Rome), good breakfast, convenient location, and reasonable rate. Breakfast included cooked eggs and prosciutto, fresh fruit, cheeses, meats, fresh breads and pastries, yogurt, coffee, juices. Hotel felt secure with security lock on the front door and safes in the room. 2 blocks from the Central Train station makes it so easy to take the Metro, and train to/from the airport. We also rented our car from the train station. Also ended up taking a bus from the Borgese Museum to the train station -- saving a lot of walking. Beds are pretty comfortable. Overall very happy with this choice of hotel and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice spring visit”
Reviews.Author: johannasigurds1
Reviews.Content: This trip was a surprise gift to my girlfriend and we both agreed that hotel morgana was a great option and central located. Clean and comfortable room with big bed. Breakfast was very nice served to 11am. We found it easy to visit the city from the hotel location and all buses depart from the station that is just in 1min walking distance. Overall a great stay and amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Good rates!”
Reviews.Author: martaholloway56
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel so convenient for its location as well as for its rates. I booked a room on their website and got a huge discount on the room rate. Rooms are nice and staff is friendly. A good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: welovetravel123
Reviews.Content: The friendliest and most attentive hotel staff we have come across. We were made to feel very welcome from arrival to departure. Breakfast was excellent with a large choice from a continental menu. The location of the hotel was ideal as we could reach everything on foot. The room was of good size and very clean. We stayed for a City Break and would definitely book again.

Reviews.Title: “Super weekend at Morgana”
Reviews.Author: hundafet
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home after spending my last days of my italian trip in Rome. I had single room that during my trip have been so far very small. That was not the case at morgana were i got double room with desk and big tv. Loved the breakfast in the morning and helpful and kind staff that organized tours and restaurant upon request.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel deal in Rome”
Reviews.Author: gaaudi5
Reviews.Content: Found this great hotel deal from their website as we had 6 nights in Rome. Long stay discount on the room rate and free transfer on our way back home. Good location, many restaurants in the area and Rome it self is easy city to visit on foot. Found the hotel very nice and good size of room for european standard. Would turn back.

Reviews.Title: “free upgrade and free airport driver”
Reviews.Author: carloseseries
Reviews.Content: Found huge discount l booking on the hotel homepage. We paid our stay in advance and with this offer we got free airport pick up, free internet and upgraded room! Great deal. The room it self was nice and clean. We had breakfast every morning and there was large buffet with good mix of food. We woud reccoment this hotel for good prices and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel and well located”
Reviews.Author: philed
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome and decided to book an airport taxi. It cost E80 return but the train would have cost E56.I can assure you it was well worth it after talking to others who had got the train. The hotel is about 5-10 mins from the Termini and metro. We used this all week and never had any trouble at all. However avoid the rush hour if your claustraphobic. The hotel looks as though it has been upgraded. We had an executive room and although a bit small was perfectly ok, with a clean bathroom but only a shower. The breakfast was excellent with scambled egg and bacon ( or cooked ham not sure). There was a superb choice of meats, pastries etc. If you take any electrical equipment the normal two pin continental plug will not fit. The hotel has a three prong plug with the pins in a line. There are numerous eating establishments in the area with for example tourist menues. Three courses 12- 17E . Most Pizzas are the same price as home 7-10E but beer is expensive. We had a bottle of wine for 8E., but paid 5 for a pint. Being next to the station the area does look a bit run down but dont worry as every one is fine and friendly. If you inrend using the busses and visit museaums then look for a combined ticket as it could save you money. One metro trip is 1e and 4e per day buses and metros. St Peters and the tombs are free. Sistine and Vatican 15E. Watch the collosuem as touts try and get you in but you can get a ticket which combines the colloseum and the ruins opposite. Would certainly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast ever!”
Reviews.Author: martinrionero
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend stay at Morgana. It was simply one of the best hotel experience. What we loved the most was the breakfast in the morning with endless choice! From bread and italian salami to sweet and one of the best cappuccino we had in Rome. Located right on the metro line makes it so easy to go around. Comfort and cleanliness of the room were great as well. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “very friendly reception staff and very convenient for public transport”
Reviews.Author: GloucestershireAlex
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a most enjoyable 3 nights here in March 2011. The breakfast was above average as was the helpful reception team. THey have good recommendations for local trattorias and they are happy to book a table for you. They have over 100 rooms including some in a nearby "annexe" so there must be a wide range of room sizes. Ours was really small so ask the price for an upgrade to a superior room if you can afford it..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Master room”
Reviews.Author: jason997
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel directly through the hotel as suggested from previos views. Booked the master room. Some of them are located in the annex next door and we got one on that rooms and it was amazing. Huge room with sitting area and all seems to be new. We got picked up from the airport that was a nice treat. We took the train back to the airport that was easy but expensive (14 euro per pers.) so if travelling in group of 3 just take taxi. We had good time in Rome and at Morgana hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: johannalyngstrom56
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed here for 3 day in March. We found morgana hotel an ideal place both regardin location and price. We were informed upon arrival that we had free upgrade and the room we had was wonderful. This hotel is clean that is important for us. Breakfast was great. We used our free airport driver on the way back to the airport that was a nice and free.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant from beginning to end”
Reviews.Author: Roma004
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights in Hotel Morgana in march 2011 and enjoyed our stay very much. Spacious and elegant bedroom and bathroom (perfectly clean of course!) abundant and varied breakfast and especially, very nice staff. One minute walk from Termini railway station, a tube station and lots of busses. We would definitely recommend it to our friends and hope to go again. The coin in the Trevi fountain was thown for this purpose...

Reviews.Title: “Pictures were better than the room we stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: liamarmstrong
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel with air miles for my 50th birthday. Room was clean if somewhat small. En suite needed up dating.Staff ever so friendly and helpful and the convenience to Termini was a big help. Some renovation was being done to the room next to us so maybe ours would be next. Looked on the website now and wow bedrooms look wonderful but sadly ours wasn't one of them. Would stay there again because of the convenience of getting around and wonderful breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Free private airport pick up!”
Reviews.Author: aleksandrmikli
Reviews.Content: We could not be more happier about the service we got at Morgana. We booked their special offer from their wwebsite and go discount on our room rate but the best was the driver that came and picked us up from the airport all included in the rate. The hotel was in good location and breakfast room offered nice settings with complete buffet. Nice and welcoming staff at the front desk. We would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with Morgana”
Reviews.Author: nonnimanni
Reviews.Content: This is very good located hotel with nice and clean rooms. Was here for business and booked a single room. Must say that for single room this was just great. The bed was big and i had a working desk in the room. Internet cost extra 10 euro. Book a room with breakfast as it will cost you more to buy it apart. I will book Morgana again.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel”
Reviews.Author: hekla78
Reviews.Content: This hotel had all we really expected. We had big triple room with plenty of space in the room. Breakfast was above avarage and had great selection. The location was good to explore the city and we used the hop on bus alot to get around. We have no complain about the stay and as previos review have said book through their website if you want to get the free airport pick up as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: litlijon33
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good value for money. Rooms are comfortable and clean and the staff is fluently english and spanish speaking. We liked the location with easy reach to all the main places to visit in Rome. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great 4 star hotel in good center location”
Reviews.Author: icetraveler231
Reviews.Content: We had good time at hotel morgana and found it very good hotel. Arriving late in the evening by train this was the best location to arrive to by foot. We had booked a executive room and wow the room was amizing a and you could see it had recenly been updated as everything was new. After a great stay we had incuded for free a private driver that took us to the airport. Book directly throug the hotel website as we talked to another couple that had the same room type but did not have the airport service included as this offer is only valid through their website. All in all very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family hotel”
Reviews.Author: nancyandjack15
Reviews.Content: Traveling in party of 5 is not always easy. We found Morgana one of the best hotel during our trip to italy. We booked family room from their webpage and had two separate large rooms door to door. We found the hotel clean and in good location. Plenty of restaurants close by. Book their breakfast as it kept us going for all the walks during the day in this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 34515Worldtraveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms are better than the pictures. The rooms are small but clean. We had the basic room without the breakfast with a street view. Perfect location in Rome. 2 blocks from the train station. Very ideal if your going from city to city in Italy with luggage. Great restaurants in the area; walking distance to the double decker bus stop. and very reasonable on their rates.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - no complaints whatsoever”
Reviews.Author: sweetchelsea
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Italy and I must say that the hotel made it absolutely wonderful. The room was very nice and very neat. I must commend the front desk staff who were absolutely fantastic and very helpful. All-in-all, a great hotel! i will absolutely recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: jobbye5
Reviews.Content: Came to Rome for a business just for a one night and have to say that I was very surprised how nice this hotel was for what i paid. I booked I business room throug easytobook.com and got free internet that I needed. Good space in the room to work and the internet worked fast in the whole hotel. Great location directly from the station and easy to get a cap everywhere. Full breakfast buffet was the top of everything. No need to search further Morgana is my new hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: gunnarj28
Reviews.Content: We liked our stay at morgana very much. The room was very nice and clean and the location was very good with bus or walk to all main attraction. I founf the staff very friendly and helpfull. Would turn back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: sarabailey123
Reviews.Content: Would certainly recommend this hotel, with very helpful and friendly staff. It is close to the train and bus station and lots of important sites, i.e. Colosseum, are within walking distance. The room was large and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjasi220
Reviews.Content: We had very nice stay at hotel morgana. We found the staff very helpful and the room was much bigger than we expected. The hotel is very clean and the rooms as well. We already booked again for our summer visit as 2 days in this amazing city are not enough.

Reviews.Title: “super service!”
Reviews.Author: elviraz59
Reviews.Content: I decided to spend a weekend in Rome doing some Christmas shopping and visiting a few sites as well.......found this hotel in a guide book and was not disappointed! It is less than 5 minutes walk from the train station so very handy! Had heard that the hotels around the train station were not too good, but this was definitely not true about this hotel! The personnel were all friendly and reception answered all my questions! My room was very spacious and modern with a lovely shower! Enjoyed my stay very much!

Reviews.Title: “Satifying”
Reviews.Author: sanamis
Reviews.Content: We just spent a night in this hotel and found it adequate to the needs of a hotel guest.The hotel is located at Filippo Turati , which is very close to Rome (ROMA FLC) Railway station. This is a great advantage. The hotel is not big , but fulfills normal requirements of a traveller. There are all types of restaurants all around the place. At 83 euros (plus city tax of 6 euros) , this is quite good. We didnot have occasion to try breakfast or any other food in this hotel ; so cannot comment on it. Rooms were well appointed and comfortable .But there was no facility for making tea or coffee in the room. We were satisfied with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: blackeve
Reviews.Content: I travel very oft to Rome and I stayed already 2 times at the Morgana. The location near the Metro station is perfect for my job. The staff is always very friendly and I like very much the buffet breakfast...the croissants are delicious! I will be back in 2 months.

Reviews.Title: “A positive experience at the morgana!”
Reviews.Author: jojo1956
Reviews.Content: We spent four days at the hotel morgana and our experience was positive. Our room was a master double with a balcony and was nice and confortable. Breakfast was good with a wide selection of food different every day. The complimentary pick up service at the airport was a nice touch and made our arrival very easy so we deceided to book the transfert back as well. Taxi drivers in rome are not so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice breakfast, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Loving_Holidays
Reviews.Content: I went to Rome with 2 friends for the weekend- upon arrival at the hotel at 11.00am we were plesantly surprised that we could check in straight away, the receptionist said she had upgraded us; we had booked a triple room and when we saw the room it was lovely, but we could not figure out what aspects made the room an upgraded one - It was a good size, clean with a flat screen tv . There was insufficient wardrobe space - 6 hangers for 3 girls in a triple room ! As alot of these reviews say the bathroom was tiny, but overall the room was very well appointed. The floors are tiled, so at some points we could hear people walking around in the room above us - but overall it was not too bad. The breakfast was great - scrambled eggs & bacon, lots of different breads, cold meats, cheeses, three types of cake (my favourite bit) ,warmed croissants, cereals, yoghurts the list could go on, but you get my gist - the breakfast room got a little busy and we had to wait for a table for a little while (considering it was low season) so it may be a longer wait in high seasons ! The hotel is literally 1 block from Termini station - The area is not as run down as we had expected. You could easily walk to Colesium and Trevi fountain. 40 euros was the taxi fare from the airport- so quite reasonable. Overall for our short weekend break it was a good pick for a hotel - We would return .

Reviews.Title: “If you want to stay in an actual hotel don't stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: stevewalsh1984
Reviews.Content: We were extremely disappointed with the Morgana Hotel, Via Filippo Turati 33/37, 00185 Rome, Italy. We stayed for three nights from 12-15 February 2011. When we arrived we were told our room was not part of the actual hotel building but was situated down the street about 200 metres from the hotel in what the receptionist referred to as the "Annex". When you book into and pay good money for a hotel room you expect to stay in an actual hotel and not in a busy apartment block down the street with tenants staying on the floors above you and noisy shops underneath which stayed open til 1 o clock in the morning. There was no 24 hour security as stated on the hotel website and on numerous times when returning to the room the main entrance was unlocked. The phones in our room were disconnected which meant whenever we wanted to contact reception we had to walk up the street. We stayed in the "hotel" for 3 nights and on 2 of the nights we were unable to gain access to our room because our swipe cards were deactivated. This meant having to walk back down a busy street at night and go to reception to reactivate the cards. There wasn't even an apology from the receptionist for the hassle caused, it was as if it was our fault the cards wouldn't work. There was suppose to be a mini-bar in the room. There was a fridge (which didn't work)in the room which had 2 bottles of water in it. We asked on two occasions to be moved back into the main hotel building but were told there were no rooms available at that time and that the receptionist would contact us if one became available. They never contacted us. I would highly recommend staying clear of this hotel as the staff are extremely unhelpful and ignorant. The fact our room was not even part of the hotel was a major disappointment. Upon checking out we let the receptionist know how we felt about our stay and she couldn't care less.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay at the morgana hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Oldoff
Reviews.Content: Just a few words to share with all of you what a great experience we had at the Morgana hotel. We spent four days and everuythin was perfect. Our room on the 5th floor was just renewed and it was extremely cosy. Another good thinhg was the high speed internet connection that was free of charge. Finally the buffet breakfast, served by Pascal was delicious, serving even some fresh salmon from Iceland! We can highly reccomend it to everyone, whatever their needs.

Reviews.Title: “It's actually not bad at all...”
Reviews.Author: UKTemplar
Reviews.Content: Arriving late in the evening at Termini Station (5 minutes walk away), it was initially slightly daunting to see quite so many 'street characters' in the immediate vicinity. But, no-one caused us any difficulties whatsoever and we were able to stroll the short distance to the hotel. A friendly night concierge (who speaks English) checked us in - provided key - but that is really where service ends there. We carried our cases to our room and found ourselves in one of the yet-to-be-renovated bedrooms on the third floor. For a city-centre (budget end) hotel it wasn't at all bad. Slightly on the small side, bathroom in need of updating (very small shower cubicle, no bath), but quiet and clean. Good value. Breakfast is good - not a particularly exciting spread, but certainly more than adequate to set you up for a day of sightseeing. Don't expect a lot of staff interaction - there isn't any. But, as in all other areas of the hotel's operation, everything seems to be well-organised and to flow without too much fuss. Exploring the city from here is easy. For the fit and able, walking is best - lots of the major sights are within a 30 minute stroll. For those who wish to be delivered to the sights - Termini Station nearby allows access to Metro, buses, trains and taxis - and (during the day) taxis are very reasonably priced (and as good entertainment value as anything that a fairground ride can provide - hold onto your hats). There are a number of small restaurants near to the hotel, but they are cheap and cheerful and don't add to the Roman Experience. Go further afield and look for places where the locals feed.

Reviews.Title: “great service and superb rooms!”
Reviews.Author: candythandi
Reviews.Content: My girl friend and I spent a weekend in Rome and decided to book this hotel!! We were more than satisfied with everything - the rooms were new and fresh and the staff, especially the man on morning concierge was extremely helpful and kind. The breakfast was wonderful with lots of choice! It's right next to all the main transport - train, bus and metro, so is perfect if you have an early flight and need to get the train to the airport! Would highly recommend this hotel to all travellers! We will definitely return - hopefully in summer!!

Reviews.Title: “not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: sophyeh
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 nites in Jan 27-29, 2011. The room was nice but small, breakfast was good, the location is great! But no service at all; the stuffs were nice but not very helpful! I'll say its a 3.5 start hotel; defiantly not a 4 star one at all. Overall, I had a pleasant stay in Morgana for the Priceline price. If you are looking for a comfortable stay and don't want to pay too much; It is a nice choice to be! Just bid it on Priceline!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tinoohio89
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Morgana for our annual visit to Rome. We found a special offer on their web site and the rate was really convenient. The room was nice and the staff has been extremely kind and professional. A good choice indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: diroby
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 nights at the Morgana and it was fantastic. The staff was very friendly and professional. The room was very clean and spacious and the breakfast was excellent. Good value for money. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: markomo
Reviews.Content: We have been 2 nights at the Morgana and it was perfect. The receptionist are very helpful and the staff in the breakfast room very efficent. The room was very clean and spacious. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very central with a good price!”
Reviews.Author: filop
Reviews.Content: Hotel morgana has very central location just out of the main train station and easy to reach by walk no need of taxi or bus . The room rate we got was very good , they call it winter offer and we had an upgrade and internet free included with it . We can sure reccomend it

Reviews.Title: “Elegant rooms, close to Termini station, definately coming back!”
Reviews.Author: hotel_savvy_11
Reviews.Content: Pros: Beautifully decorated rooms. Very quiet too. Spacious and clean marble bathroom. Good selection at breakfast - one of the best we had in Europe (do not expect much from European breakfasts). 5 minute walk to Termini station. Good value for money. Cons: Not many, however if I were to be picky it would be that the "double" bed is actually 2 singles put together and the lift is quite small (one person with a suitcase can fit in) so beware if travelling with large amounts of luggage. Overall, absolutely LOVED this hotel! I am quite picky when it comes to hotels and can say without a doubt that I will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “My new favourite hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: allegradew75
Reviews.Content: I use to spend at least a week end in Rome every year during seasonal sales. I love shopping! The hotel morgana has a perfect location as I could reach by metro, just around the corner, all main shopping district! My room was really nice and Marisa at the front desk has been extremely kind!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic weekend”
Reviews.Author: finss23
Reviews.Content: A very nice weekend in rome spent at the morgana .our stay was just fantastic we have been upgraded upon arriving in a master room that was just amazing.the s The location is perfect 200 meters from central station with no need of use the taxi we will be back n

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: georgetu
Reviews.Content: Good location,nice big room,helpfull staff,very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have been!”
Reviews.Author: lorenawladimir65
Reviews.Content: I spent three days at the Morgana and my experience there has been truly positive. The front desk staff, as well as the girls who served breakfast in the morning, have been extremely nice and helpful with us. Although we only had few days, we have been able to see lots of the most important sites in Rome as the Morgana is in a perfect location, near metro and main bus station.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place,lovely staff and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: albe32
Reviews.Content: Perfect location just two minuites from central station a very convenient room rate ,lovely and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “right next to the station-but not in a bad way! walkable to all major Rome stuff.”
Reviews.Author: johnwl-uk
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is literally 100 yds from the station entrance, though not on the same street. So it's 2 mins away, as long as you walk the right way (which I didn't to start with...) All of Rome's major sights are walkable, as long as you like walking (we do-but it is a good 20-30 mins for example to the main/posh shops by the Spanish Steps)-otherwise, of course you are on the doorstep of the station/metro. If you don't like walking/want to spend some more ££ (I bet they are really expensive/less for more)-pick a hotel nearer the main sights such as by Barberini/Flaminio metros. The hotel itself was clean, breakfast buffet more than expected/more than adequate. Room we were given was fine, although I it seemed to be on the top floor/furthest away (?is that where they send anyone that has booked via the internet)? Hotel Wifi seemed expensive (£20 euro for a couple of days), and as I was near my £40 unlimited roam allowance I didn't bother. (Why do hotels still seem to want to charge)? McDonalds just up the road had free wifi, but my Italian wasn't good enough to navigate the instructions to connect.... We'd stop there again, which is as good a recommendation as anything gets. (There are places we wouldn't..you know who you are, Bird's Nest Inn)!

Reviews.Title: “Great location on budget”
Reviews.Author: MGD54
Reviews.Content: Great location, one block from Termini Station = easy and very affordable access to and from airport. Very convenient to access all major sites through public transportation, especially buses. Very helpful hotel staff, especially Marco and Marisa at the front desk. Breakfast is plentiful. The rooms are quiet, the area safe (not what some used to expect around railroad stations), the bathrooms elegant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room, great value”
Reviews.Author: found98
Reviews.Content: Great location close to train and local transport. Friendly and helpful staff, clean and comfortable room. Great price for what you get.. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we needed”
Reviews.Author: experiencetravelerr
Reviews.Content: Hotel Morgana offered the exact amenities my friends and I needed for our activitiy-packed stay in Rome. FIrstly, the hotel was clean, spacious, and hospitable place. The rooms were big and we were provided with everything we needed (including extras for free when asked for like towels etc.) The staff was extremely efficient and knowledgeable. They really took time to find out what our tastes were and suggest fitting and exciting activities. Secondly the hotel is smack in the middle of all the transportation lines. This means we could get to any major site in 15 minutes, but also to hidden wonders outside the city by just rolling on a bed and hopping on a train. We saw the colosseum, trevi fountain etc but were also directed to fish dining by the sea and sculpture gardens in the beautiful country side. Hotel Morgana would send us on unforgettable adventures during the day, and offer us the perfect place to rest and night.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay. Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: BinGeneva
Reviews.Content: Four-stars in Italy are all over the spectrum -- Morgana is at the higher end of what I've seen for Rome. The staff was quite helpful in providing tips for getting around and what to visit. The hotel is super convenient to Termini Station and hence transport to/from airport and other city public transportation. My room was quiet, clean and the breakfast pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel, ok Location... not a 4 stars but great value... you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: marlonfl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights. It looks like a remodeled hotel. you have 32'' LCDs in the bedroom, but just a few channels. Beds are confortable and shower is good, despite the small size of the bathroom. The location is great in terms of being close to the train station and subway. The neighborhood is not nice... not dangerous, but not nice. Few restaurants options, but just for emergencies... I would go to other areas to have dinner. Staff is friendly, room is clean. The building is old, so elevator fits only 2 person. The price was great, so it is a good deal and you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Average location, poor service, dirty smelly rooms”
Reviews.Author: VBoger
Reviews.Content: Average location, poor service, dirty sewege smelly rooms

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Clean, Comfortable and Good Service”
Reviews.Author: tammb
Reviews.Content: Given some of the earlier postings I was disappointed when I won this hotel on a bid from Price Line. However, once arriving we found the area to be pretty good, very close to the train station, breakfast was excellent, the rooms were nicely decorated and the staff couldn't be more helpful. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was nice and clean. The rooms are European - smaller than US/Canada, and one must be careful of that first step from the bathroom. However, all in all it was a very comfortable, well located, decent place to stay. I would recommend it and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay near Termini”
Reviews.Author: pmars43
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 days. Very close to Termini (one block). Very nice room, decent size, clean, well appointed. Bathroom also very nice. Breakfast buffet was great. Staff very helpful. Only complaint was with the WiFi - very poor signal. Enjoyed our stay and being so close to Termini was real convience.

Reviews.Title: “A 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: spry13
Reviews.Content: We were bumped from another Morgana hotel and put in this one, supposedly in an upgraded room. It was average at best. The hotel is, however, only a few blocks from the train station. The area is not the nicest, but not too bad and we did not feel unsafe. The best thing was the nearby restaurant - the closest one to the hotel with outdoor dining which had the best meals for the price we had during out 2 weeks in Italy. Lighting very poor; beds not in good condition. Breakfast was up 2 flights of stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: goducks413
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Morgana for the first night of our European vacation. It is in a very convenient location to see all of Rome. The room we had was roomy and very consistent with what a "4-star" hotel should be in Europe. This is not consistent with what is considered a 4-star hotel in the US, so set expectations accordingly. Breakfast was good and we received good service across the board. They also had a very good happy hour deal with a sister-hotel across the street. Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “MADE ME FEEL LIKE HOME!!! =)”
Reviews.Author: danettejones
Reviews.Content: We were deciding between hotels after reading reviews on this website from the hotels around that area and we decided to give it a try to the Morgana , IT WAS AWESOME! this people take very serious their clients i must say from the moment we walked in THEY TREAT US REALLY NICE , my room was nice and very clean , the receptionist from the morning was very polite , when we would come back to the hotel in the afternoon the Latin and Philippine girl would asked us what we did , and would give us advices of places where to eat and visit ,some other hotels THEY COULD CARELESS , ALL I HAVE TO SAY THEY MADE US FEEL LIKE AT HOME WHICH GIVE YOU THUMBS UP!!! WILL WE COME BACK ??? YES WE WILL AND WE"LL MAKE SURE WE TELL OUR FRIENDS IN UNITED STATES WHEN THEY BOOK THEIR TRIP TO THE AWESOME ROME TO STAY IN THIS HOTEL , THANK YOU ONCE AGAIN

Reviews.Title: “RUDE STAFF!”
Reviews.Author: cecililagan
Reviews.Content: The only big disappointment was the staff. There's this one particular cleaner who was so rude. If you don't like your job, better find something else and don't take it to the clients who paid and are expecting good service! We are after all on vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, friendly staff, very clean”
Reviews.Author: GreekLesley
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room for a few days in August. While the room was small, the bathroom was gorgeous with glass shower and marble. It was impecably clean. The a/c would only stay on when the key was in the door but it was very strong and cooled the room down in a matter of minutes. The staff was great and very helpful. They pointed out a superb authentic Italian restaurant down the block with great risotto for my 2nd night there! They also held my bags up front after I checked out before my train left late afternoon. It was a simply wonderful location with super easy access to Termini the metro and very walkable to everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Would be great.. if it were rated a 2-star hotel - for students/low budget travellers ONLY”
Reviews.Author: kjm31
Reviews.Content: I am actually still at this hotel right now. First of all, do not believe the hype about the location. YES, it is convenient to Termini station, and YES, that's nice because of the subway, but it is a fairly seedy area with vagrants walking on the street. I am a resident of NYC so it takes a lot for me to say something is a bad area... believe me, once you are off the exact little 1/2 block this street is on, you'll feel uncomfortable at night unless you're a young urban couple totally at ease with being in iffy neighborhoods. Think 40's/8th avenue in NYC about 10 years ago, lots of cheap souvenir shops, recent immigrants peddling on the street, etc. - not crazy dangerous, but certainly not great. I have my parents to worry about, senior citizens, and every time we come back to the hotel I stress out that something will happen to them. Hotel amenities leave much to be desired. My room is about 100sf total, my "double" bed is two twins pushed together. The 100sf piece is fairly common in EU, but still, a 4-star hotel with a room this small? (Comparison: Westin in Paris also has small rooms, but was at least 2x size of this room). My TV is an old 19" that has no reception at all. No mini bar. no closet. Bathroom tends to flood but is fine. (pics enclosed of the room) The overall effect is something like an Econo Lodge or older 3-star hotel (think old holiday inn that wasn't renovated) in the US. Some of the decor is pretty (if rather tacky), and yes, the breakfast is pretty good. But there's no assistance in getting a cab/to attractions (yes, you can walk to Termini, and yes, that's just around the corner, but if I were in a proper 4-star hotel, I wouldn't have to - there'd be a bellman at the front to hail it for me - not that I need that, but sometimes my 70 year-old father does!) Net-net: If I had thought I had booked a 2 or 3-star hotel, I'd probably be totally OK with this place. The location is convenient to public transport which is great on a budget, the breakfast fills you up, the place is relatively clean. The problem is, I was told this was a 4-star hotel (actually I got sucked into this from Priceline by naming my own price - be warned!). And when I booked a "4 star hotel in Central Rome" I was expecting something like a Westin or Sheraton, or a very nice boutique hotel... not a hotel where I think "Wow, I would have loved this when I was 19 and travelling on a budget". I'd definitely recommend this hotel to students or young adults who are on a budget if you can get a good rate. But given the price I paid and the star class given, definitely NOT recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel inItaly so far!”
Reviews.Author: pri34
Reviews.Content: Traveling with my wife on a budget base we have booked the Hotel for its location. We have found it worth for money with a very friendley staff . Our room was confortable and the brekfast was huge.So far it is the best hotel we have stayed in Italy and we can sure reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to the main train station with an amazing breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jodydawn25
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only about 2 blocks from the main train station in Rome which makes getting there with your baggage easy and inexpensive. Additionally, you can hop on the Metro and go all over Rome with just a short walk. This hotel is moderately priced compared to the other hotels of the same class nearby. The staff was great and we were able to get an upgraded room since we arrived early and the room we booked was not ready yet. The front desk personnel were very helpful with all the questions we had. The breakfast is not to be missed, so ensure you reserve it when you book the room. It is well worth the cost and as we traveled through Italy we agreeded the breakfast here was by far the best. Our room had modern decor, but it was quite small. It was the smallest of all the rooms we stayed in during our trip across Italy. No spetacular views from our window, but the location made up for that. Be warned that the elevator for this hotel is only big enough for one person and their bag. Overall a great hotel that met our needs while we were sithseeing all over Rome.

Reviews.Title: “simple courtesy- Unheard of at this place”
Reviews.Author: mistafairy
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights during our visit to Rome. it was advertised as a 4 star but 2.5 stars is being generous. we were informed that we had received a free upgrade and breakfast which we thought was nice, the room was a little rustic- decorated in a Moroccan style. But the upgrade was to a room about five minutes walk away, the front doors were closed between 1 p.m. and 4 p.m. and after 7 p.m. which meant that each time we got back to the hotel at those times ( and even during times they claimed it should be open) we had to go to the main building a five to eight minute walk down the street to ask someone to open the front door and then walk back to our building- not very convenient. the room was not clean, it was dusty, and the maid kept leaving our window open. we asked front desk for a recommendation to a good restaurant with fresh pasta, definitely the worst place we ate in Rome. front desk staff with the exception of Giorgio were rude, and unhelpful. we had read in a travel book about the taxi flat rate of 30 Euros to Ciampino airport we confirmed it with one of the hotel staff then when we asked the front desk staffer the evening before our departure to order the taxi she rudely informed us that she said it was impossible to get a taxi to the Ciampino for less than 40-45 Euros and an added fee for early service she was rude saying you don't know what you are talking about, when we asked her to call and confirm the price she practically screamed that did we want her to call around to check the price, and what company did we expect her to call- overall not the type of service you expect at any star rating let alone a 4 star hotel. The flat rate was 30 Euros we confirmed it ourselves;

Reviews.Title: “Did the job - just about !!”
Reviews.Author: NorthernSound
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in Morgana. I disagree with others who found reception bad, i thought they were helpful and courteous. Rooms are small and lifts poor, breakfast was basic but plenty of it, nice comfortable breakfast room and no rush, staff were pleasant. It is a seedy area and i wouldnt like walking around this area late at night. We had children so it didnt affect us as we were in by about 11pm latest. For touring Rome it is a good location just beside Termini station. Overall it'd say it does the job ok but if going again, id have a look around for something a bit better

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bella072
Reviews.Content: Location is right next to train station, great location. Hotel staff friendly and helpful. I booked a quad room and was very small and dated. Other travelling in our party had rooms that looked to be refurbished and were ok.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded to another building, have to call porter everytime to open the door”
Reviews.Author: nonabidut
Reviews.Content: Upon my arrival to the hotel, I was informed that I was being upgraded to the "master" suite. My excitement lasted until the receptionist told me that the suite was located in another building. The hotel had a portier to took me to this other building which was located around 100 meters from the main hotel. The bulding had a wooden door and a metal gate on which you need a key to go in. The portier explain that security will be inside and open the door if I ring, or that I could go to the hotel and find someone to escort me to the room. What a convenience! Another thing is that nothing in that building that gives away a hotel room. It was kind of creepy. Too much security made me feel so unsafe.. Aside from that, the room was nicely decorated. The bed was a bit hard but it was big. Breakfast buffet was really nice. Perhaps I would stay in this hotel again, only if I was given to stay in the "main building".

Reviews.Title: “Well Networked”
Reviews.Author: AbhishekG_Mumbai
Reviews.Content: the perfect location to get around town easily – near the train station and subway. Room very comfortable, but very slow elevators. poor soundproofing of the rooms, breakfast worthy of a station buffet, no blankets in rooms, leaking shower, no information on services: very far from standard 4 stars

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay at the hotel morgana i will be back.”
Reviews.Author: zorba43
Reviews.Content: Traveling with a very big group of over 60's i spent few days at the hotel Morgana.Our stay was nice and we had no problems at all.The breakfast was good and also our rooms were very big and cool.In Rome was very hot but our hotels rooms were fine. Coming from greece we did not expect a so warm city over 34°c.II will be back once by myself to be able to see more of this beatifull city. Zorba and friends group from larissa.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wiilbackery70
Reviews.Content: I have been at the Hotel Morgana for business for a few days. It is a very good Hotel: centrally located, with internet wireless connection in the rooms and in the lobby. There is no restaurant, but just in front of the Hotel there is another Hotel, the Ariston where the serve a great snack buffet in the evening. Rooms are comfortable and people nice, Buffet breakfast has a good variety. I would definitely recommend the Hotel Morgana,

Reviews.Title: “Our second visit at Morgana, and not the last one”
Reviews.Author: marjoriebell
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Hotel Morgana and this time with my sister. The staff was very helpful and upon arrival they gave us a one double bed but after pointing out that we requested separate beds they changed our rooms immediately to very nice twin bedded room. We had a wonderful stay and were treated with courtesy and kindness during our stay. From the hotel you can walk almost everywhere, alternative you can take buses from the station going to the center of Rome. We suggest that you buy the hop on hop off city bus as its very convenience and stops everywhere you want to visit, including the Vatican. Thanks so much for a great hotel, great service and making it a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “A very good stay”
Reviews.Author: carolineden23
Reviews.Content: I spent few days at hotel morgana with a group of friends and our stay was very good.nice roms,friendley staff,convenient location.we were able to walk almost everywhere .no taxi needed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location - Hearty Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SharonNJ
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed the location of this hotel. It is a very short walk to the Termini Stazione, which is also where the Subway Lines A and B meet. We were able to see all of our sites easily by taking the metro. The hotel breakfast was great - a full, hearty breakfast to start the day of touring. We were never out after 9:30pm, so I can not soeak for the safety of the are at night. We felt very safe during the day and evening.

Reviews.Title: “Delighful stay!”
Reviews.Author: margieronny
Reviews.Content: We found hotel Morgana particularly convenient. We had booked one of their special offers through their website and therefore saved big amount of our total stay. We booked Executive rooms and had free transfer back to the airport included! We liked the fact that the hotel was in short distance from the main station (Termini) where all buses and underground lines depart so it was very easy to go around the city. Our room was well kept, with clean towels everyday and all the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The concierge gave me a map, directions and told me about places in town to visit and gave a good suggestion of restaurants in the area around the hotel. Keep up the fantastic service and we're definitely coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here unless te only thing you care about is being near the Termini train station.”
Reviews.Author: nprgeek
Reviews.Content: I just wish I had read more of the reviews. This hotel is definitely convenient to the main train station in Rome; it's an easy five-minute walk. However, the service personnel are surley and abrupt; the rooms are so tiny there is nowhere to open your suitcase but on the bed (then you have to pack it all up, zip it closed and stow it upright against the wall and hope you remember it's there if you get up at night to use the bathroom); the air goes off when you leave the room (like many hotels in Europe, you have to insert your keycard in a slot to turn the electricity on--but unlike most hotels, the air goes off, too.); the tub is so narrow at the bottom that you cannot stand with both feet on the bottom to take a shower (okay, I know this sounds silly, but unless you're a really tiny kid, you have to balance on the sides of your feet and brace them on the sides of the tub to take a shower); the water runs very hot to fdreezing cold with no warning; although the location is VERY convenient to the train station, it is in one of the worst parts of Rome for walking around at night, shopping or--God forbid, eating. The minute you walk out of the front dorr you are literally assaulted by waiters of the adjoining restaurants who try to stop you and convince you to eat at their restaurant. It's okay for a day or so, but after that, this becomes really annoying. We did not find this to be true in any of the other places we stayed in Italy. For most Americans, I would say this is a 2-star (maybe). So, check out the reviews carefully. You can do MUCH better than this place. We ceratinly did. One redeeming feature--besides the proximity to the train station--is the breakfast, if you have growing children who eat you out of house and home. The breakfast is hearty with a good selection of serve-yourself choices and the teenagers we saw there really took advantage of the wide selection of ham, cheeses, breakfast rolls, eggs, bacon. yogurt, cereal and fruit. Is it gourmet? No--but, it's decent and the kids won't have to eat until dinner time. BIG TIP here: get everyone up and down to breakfast early! Do NOT wait until the last half hour or so of the serving period or you'll find yourself crowding around the doorway and sitting all over the steps waiting with the other sleepy-heads (and their starving children). The tables will all be full, the coffee will be hours old and lukewarm, the wait staff is furiously bussing tables (rather than getting you coffee or finding you a clean napkin) and the food selection is lousy (all the good stuff is gone and won't be replaced). Hope this helps. We couldn't wait to get out of there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: Kobus16
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Marco at reception and the rest of the staff for making our 1 night stay such a pleasant experience. The atmosphere for such old building was good and we enjoy the interior decorations and furniture which give special character to the hotel The room was good and we ended our stay with an excellent breakfast. It was overall good value for money and it is only a slow 5 minute walk to Termini station. The Oosthuizen family from George, South Africa

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: georgegutzav38
Reviews.Content: We booked the Morgana for our three-days holiday in Rome. Location is great and we could walk amost everywhere, or we easily took the metro or the bus. Staff is friendly and our room was just nice! By booking on their web site we found out that there was a promotion going on for facebook fans; it was easy: I went on fb and became a fan of Hotel Morgana, then I made a reservation on their web site and i saved 20% (i prepaid in advance, but it was worth it! Breakfast is rich and i liked croissants there more than in Paris! Very nice indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this one”
Reviews.Author: ebbe1983
Reviews.Content: Read some reviews here and changed to this hotel (was supposed to stay at the Black Hotel, but read that it was far from the city centre). This hotel is very close to Termini (Central Station) which was OK. The location was overall satisfying. The staff was not very friendly, sort of helpful if we asked. They changed our room since our original room had a wall - to - wall carpet (allergic). They didnt really greet you in any way, leaving or arriving the hotel. The room was sort of old. Had a biiiiig mirror behind the bed. Old fashioned bathroom. The floor tended to get very wet when taking a shower. Not really a breathtaking backyard (our view from the room). So - overall, OK, the location was good, not too far from the buses/Colosseum/Capitolo. Maybe the other rooms were more modern, but from the pictures on their homepage I could not see any ressemblence.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Termini”
Reviews.Author: RBMD
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an 11-day trip to Italy, not our first time. We had returned from Venice by train and needed a place to stay near the station for an overnight stay in Rome before flying back home the nect day. This hotel is a block away from the Termini station. The area is so-so. Lots of tourist hotels, but a bit run down and off the beaten track. The hotel is in fine shape -- clean rooms, good service, etc., but if you are planning to stay for more than one day in Rome, there are far better venues, located closer to the major sites, and in better neighborhoods.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this one unless you need to catch a train.”
Reviews.Author: Hors
Reviews.Content: After booking and pre-paying for a Master room (largest rooms some with sitting areas) on arrival given a pokey room and told all rooms were "Master" rooms. After some discussion shown larger rooms in the annex. At all costs stay away from the annex which is down the road and in an undesirable looking building/area. Every time you want to get into your room you have to go to the main building to get someone to let you in. Master room in main hotel finally allocated at front of hotel. It was noisy and hot and no air con as still considered to be winter despite the unusually warm weather and room very stuffy. Drains smelt. Staff courteous and generally helpful once room problem sorted out. This hotel is a bus ride or long walk from main attractions but is only one street from central station. It is not in a very desirable area. Good breakfast included in room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location--very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: sbgtv
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay at the Morgana. My first stay was a nice, clean simple room. This trip, we had 2 rooms booked for our party of 4 people, and checked in very late. I was very surprised at the small, dark and and depressing rooms they assigned us. They were awful -- we complained and were given a nice upgrade with a slightly higher nightly rate. The rooms were adjacent to the hotel in a separate building and they were beautiful. I love the Morgana hotel because the location is a 3min walk to the train station and the staff is very nice. Breakfast buffet nice too. Its not the best neighborhood in Rome, but then again, most of Rome is dirty as well. The price is right, the location is great, and the staff is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Four Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ribbonman
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are so small that you could have either a companion or your luggage in the room at the same time but not both. For women, the mirror in the bedroom was not practical for makeup application and the desk was just that , a desk which kept you further away from the mirror. The area is on the front line between the first and the third world, fine, if you like that sort of thing, but a bit disconterting at midnight. This is a commercial grade railway hotel with excellent staff, a reasonable breakfast, good location, but not a four star hotel, unless the top rating is a ten star.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Kids......”
Reviews.Author: acdc_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and whilst the hotel was clean and rooms were of an acceptable standard (not large but ok), there are a few things that let it down if you are planning to stay here with young children: 1) Lifts, as previously mentioned will literally only hold two people, so you need at least two trips to get your suitcases up and back down again - you can't access the lifts without going up stairs...... You are asked to leave your baby buggy/stroller in the hotel foyer! 2) They have no high-chairs in the breakfast restaurant....... They supply cots in the room as requested but no high chairs in the restaurant, crazy!! 3) Not a major issue but getting to major attractions is a bit of a trek with a baby buggy/stroller. About a 20 minute walk to Trevi Fountain etc.. Admittedly we didn't try the train (station about 2 minute walk away, which is excellent). Summary. Positives were: breakfast comprehensive continental style, staff very polite and helpful if asked, rooms ok. Negatives were: Lifts, Practicality for families with small children - lack of high chairs and location, rooms quite noisy from road.

Reviews.Title: “simple, inexpensive and convenient to Roma Termini station”
Reviews.Author: KiloTango
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnighting from Arezzo with the intention of taking a morning train to the airport (this seemed simpler than getting an airport hotel, just to take the shuttle and back again in the morning) and was not disappointed. Got a great rate of 70 euros for a Monday night. Hotel is only about 2 blocks from Termini. It is on a street lined with similar, similay aged hotels. All a little worn-out looking, but nothing dangerous. The street has a couple of restaurants so you don't have to go far, although I suspect it is near either a college or hostel, given the preponderance of 'energetic' young adults on the street. Once inside the hotel you will find it clean, although a little cramped. The room itself was OK, the toiletry shelf in the bathroom was coming loose, and the bathroom was shower-only and rather compact. The real surprise was the elevators (there are two). One holds 4 persons and the other only 2 (a 2 person elevator!). Not for the claustrophobic. Funny thing is you have to go up about 4 steps to get to the elevators - no ADA here apparently!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: nw1979
Reviews.Content: We arrived to Rome for our honeymoon, and since we wanted the best, we booked a master room for one week. Our room was located in the annex of the hotel, which gave us the possibility to a lot more privacy, we felt just like having our own little apartment in Rome!! This city is marvellous, we thought 1 week would be enough to see everything, but no, so for sure we will be back! The hotel is clean, the staff is very nice and polite, breakfast is excellent. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karl22
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Rome with my daughter and my wife and were at Hotel Morgana, It’s a convenient hotel situated close to the train station at walking distance of everything. The hotel itself was nice, our room was large enough for 3 of us, the breakfast was great and the staff was wonderful. We visit all main sites in Rome and it was very interesting. We even had the chance to see the snow in Rome, people were amazed as it was not snowing in the city since 1985. It was beautiful on the old city. I recommend that hotel which is very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Short Trip”
Reviews.Author: jf6880
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 4 minute or less walk to the Termini metro/bus/train station (one block over and then left). If you fly into Campiano airport. A Terravision bus will drop you off at the Termini; cost is 4 euro each way and takes about 40-45 minutes. The room we stayed in had a king size bed and two single beds. The two older boys used the singles and the 6 year old slept with my wife and I. The TV had a FOX station so everynight after sight seeing we watched the Simpsons and other SITCOMS in english; pretty nice for the kids & me. the hotel breakfast was very good; had eggs & bacon like pork (they dont have american style bacon in europe); bread, cheese, deli meats, yogurt, fruit and cereal--the whole family enjoyed it and it was inlcuded in the price of the room. The bathroom (in the room) had a full tub & shower; very similar to an american style hotel. The decor of the room was very dated but comfortable. We were onthe 5th floor so quite a hike up and down the stairs; there is an elevator but its very small--one person with luggage max. the colloseum is two metro stops from the termini (blue line) and the vatican is 6 stops from the termini in the oppostie direction (red line). Cost of the metro is 1 euro per person per trip or 4 euro for an all day pass (inclues use of buses also). It was Feb so we used the heat in the room--worked well. For pickyeating kids there is a McDonald's in the Termini station and one right outside the station on the way towards the hotel. My kids loved the Pizza in Rome but we still hit the Mcdonalds once (the kids love it (we're americans) and its economical. food is a little pricy in Rome--not to bad for europe. the neighborhood seemed very safe near the train station--the only detracting thing was grafitti but it's all over rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for group travelers and real deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: Churchgroupinrome
Reviews.Content: Traveling with a group of 20 (and a pet!) not one thing is simple any longer. I came to Rome with my church group as we were so excited to foundations and center of our religion. The age range was from 4 years old to about 60 thus everything had to be very veeery organized and Hotel Morgana was precisley what we needed. Right by the station, from the airport we hopped on the train and hopped into the hotel within a cheap heart beat (no need for cabs or reserved mini buses!). Once arrived the friendly staff had us take a seat in their large lounge provided with couches, tabels, menus for snacks and drinks which was all exactly what we needed after our long journey to get figured out for the moment. 15 minutes later they had us all checked in (the front desk staff work at the speed of light), and were bringing up baggages for those who needed to our rooms which were all on the same floor. The breakfast hall was huge which allowed us to enjoy the scrumptious italian breakfasts all together. The hotel helped us organize buses that would come pick us up right at the door (!!) and take us on really grand tours around the vatican and rest of rome. We even got to see the Pope!!!!! The rooms were comfortable and overall this hotel was extremely accomodating and helpful with our tricky situation. I would deffinatly recomend this hotel for anyone who needs informed and compitant guidance in this tricky but wonderful city:)

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place and staff”
Reviews.Content: This place was really nice, the staff were so friendly and helpful. The particualr room We got was small but very comfortable and clean. The view wsnt great but it didnt matter as the rest of the room was really nice. The decor was modern although our friends room wasnt as nice as ours. Made the trip more enjoyable knowing that we would have a comfortable sleep each night.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, close to station, tiny room, clean, nice bathroom”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryGirl06
Reviews.Content: I had a single room which was very small but at the same time it was comfortable, cosy and although the bed was a single and against the wall, it was comfortable to sleep on. The room was very clean, but it doesn't look anything like the rooms on the website!! It is a very old style decor, you can't modify the temperature even though the dial is present, which is annoying if you like it cooler than what they decide on. The bathroom was spacious for a single room, marble, clean and no tub shower (yay!!). I was on an upper floor, which meant you had to get the one person lift up, or the 2 person lift up, which could take ages to become available. There are stairs everywhere, even in the tiny rooms there is a step down to the bed. I had to keep my bag on the floor in front of the door because it wouldn't fit anywhere else. The staff were helpful, polite, friendly and seemed organised. The breakfast was excellent. The best one I had all through Italy at 3-4 star hotels. Plenty of choice of food, and the staff in the breakfast room were really nice even when one silly person put ham and cheese through the toaster and almost caught the place on fire! (The offending young girl and her mother pretended they knew nothing about it). There are two restaurants just outside the hotel, the one right on the corner is one to avoid, the staff are rude, the food is below average and they are quite pushy. The little restuarant right next door doesn't look as flash but the couple who run it were extremely helpful and I was able to get some food takeaway from there, packaged up nicely, really hot and great too! I actually did like this hotel, I would stay here again for the staff, the proximity to the station and the comfortable (though old) room.

Reviews.Title: “Wished we stayed someplace else.”
Reviews.Author: Trevor-yvr
Reviews.Content: This looks like it was a four-star hotel in the 1940s, but hasn't been updated enough for that ranking. I tried to give this hotel credit because it's obvious they're trying to keep the hotel up to good standard, but failing. The the front-desk staff were very helpful and friendly, and that's the best thing I can say about the hotel. The lobby was (deceivingly) classy and check-in was the last time we felt good in the place. A friend stayed in 323 (single), me and my partner in 312 (double). Our flimsy key-cards would only work in every 1 out of 10 tries, and other times not work at all. We went back to the lobby several times to get the keys re-activated, sometimes still didn't work. The maid let my partner into my friend's room when he wasn't there, which was convenient for us, but in retrospect didn't make us feel secure. All of the nonsense trying to get working key-cards was the last thing we needed after a difficult journey. The rooms have a cheap feel, as though someone tried to fix them up but did it as cheaply as possible. The rooms look nice in photos (ours looked nothing close to the photo here on TripAdvisor) but up-close there is a musty, dusty feel to everything. The walls are decorated with this carpet-like fabric that collects dust that would drift around whenever we touched the walls. The in-room safes couldn't be activated in either room. The door to the rickety full-length closet in 323 fell off when I opened it -- a heavy slab of wood that could have hurt or injured one of us if we were in the wrong place. The beds were not terrible, but less comfortable than we expected from a hotel -- mattresses felt old or cheap. Some fixtures were new, but the toilet tank in 312 made industrial-strength groaning noises for a couple of minutes. The fridge was unusually noisy and we had to unplug it. The wi-fi costs 10 euros a day, which is like a month of net access back home. I searched for a signal and my laptop could find none, which makes me think it would have been problematic if I paid for it anyway. We got a card entitling us to complementary breakfast, but when we went down in the morning, our room was on the "pay" list and we were told the complementary-card was a mistake. That's the kind of mistake that would cost them nothing to honour, so being turned away was one more thing that made us feel unwelcome. We dropped into Una Hotel nearby (which is even closer to the train station) and considered splurging there for our second night. Although we didn't, I have to say it looked luxurious -- the only nice-looking hotel in this area, as far as we could see. But if you don't need to be near the train station, just avoid this area completely.

Reviews.Title: “More than a 4 stars Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: paulmaddde
Reviews.Content: The Morgana is more than a 4 stars hotel! The staff is professional and attentive to any client's needs and they are always smiling! I booked a double room for me and my wife. I mentioned in my e-mail of reservation that we were travelling to celebrate my birthday and they were so kind to put a little gift in my room with a message for me. I really appreciated this gesture! Breakfast was nice and food was so good! Expecially their chocolate croissants! Positin is perfect to walk everywhere! Don't miss Galleria Borghese! It's a must in Rome! Will definitely stay there again! Thanks to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “A good experience!”
Reviews.Author: brianmaal_78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Morgana for 5 days last week and we had a positive experience. We booked two twin bedded rooms since we were 4 friends travelling together. On Sunday we decided to go to the stadium for the football match and the front desk staff has been so kind to find 4 tickets for us, last minute deal! Everybody was so nice and helpful! Our room were clean and comfortable with Plasma TV! All main sites were close by and metro stop is just there. The Morgana is located near the main train station so we could easily reach it from the airport. We had a good time and would come back next year. Maybe with our girlfriends..

Reviews.Title: “Don't go near it”
Reviews.Author: Alfred123_9
Reviews.Content: Although in a convenient location the hotel was certainly not 4 star. We booked through Air Miles. The room given to us on arrival was not big enough to swing a mouse, let alone a cat. It also had not been cleaned properly. We complained and were given a much bigger room the following day. This was in a poor state of repair, the television did not receive all the channels and the bathroom was not cleaned properly on any of the 3 days that we werer there. The bed was too hard and very uncomfortable. The breakfast room was not big enough to cope with the demand, and consequently was dirty, and the breakfast was boring with little variety. The staff were generally o.k. There is a bar but I did not see it open. Conclusion: go elsewhere, there are plenty of other hotels in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Location was great, rooms were horrid”
Reviews.Author: hanjan01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days. The hotel is in an excellent location in that it was very close to the train station and all the bus routes. There is also a bar across the street to purchase drinks/water. However, we had to wait 4 hours for our rooms, and when we got in them, there wasn't any room for our luggage. The bed took up the whole room, and we couldn't pass each other without walking over the bed- which was also hard as a rock.. The "air conditioning" was broken, and the room overlooked some aparments and a run down alley.The bathroom was large, but there wasn't a shower curtain or door around the tub, just a partial gate.. the water sprayed everywhere. The tub was broken, so you had to keep the water running while bathing as the drain stop wouldn't work. The staff was nice, but not helpful. The only two good things were the location, and the buffet as the breakfast was good.. However, next time we go to Rome we will definitely not stay here...we had two rooms, and both were horrid. Oh, the hallways are also ackward and I took a nasty fall as there was a step in the middle of a hallway... and forget about the elevators...no room for you AND your luggage...

Reviews.Title: “Close to the train, wierd neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: hereandthere25
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our last night in Italy after traveling for 2 weeks because it was close to the train, no other reason. Had we done more research, we probably would not have stayed here.The neighbourhood was questionable. When we checked in, we were told we were being upgraded to the annex which was a block away. The main hotel building looked liked it had seen better days and we did not see any of the rooms here. The bellhop walked us over to another building which had large locked wooden doors and then an iron work locked inner gate. We were told to check in at the main building when we returned at night for them to let us in. We were surprised by the how nice our room was (although the decor was in a rather dark, boutique style). It was explained to us that the hotel bought the first floor of this residential building and are hoping to acquire more of it. Room service was provided and breakfast was offered at the main building. There was not much to do around the area, lots of cheap import shops. No complaints about the service or staff, just a weird neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: kelly1409
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Morgana in May after staying in Sorrento for a few days we move onto Rome. Its in a good location and was easy to find in such a busy city. We booked in February and got quite a resonable price considering how expensive Rome can be. The room was small but well decorated and clean. Altogether a good base to explore Rome. The only thing i woud say is that staff were not very helpful-at best they seemed stressed and harassed. They did help us with a map etc but this seemed like a chore.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 4 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: leyswick
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel morgane for 2 nights in September 2009. I requested a single room via the hotel website. This stated that single rooms had a queen size bed. The first room I was offered was a tiny tiny room with a single bed against the wall in it and barely 2ft between the side of the bed and the other wall and the same at the foot of the bed and a tiny alcove for a tiny desk and chair. The shower room was nicely tiled and clean, but small. I didn't accept this room and was shown another room with a 6ft bed in it not a lot of floor space, and a nice shower room , and I accepted that. Breakfast was adequate. Location ok near the Termini station, but not a very nice area.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Location, Horrible Value for Money... Horrible & Filthy Room!!!”
Reviews.Author: Adelos
Reviews.Content: To start with, the 'hotel' location was more like a filthy version of China town and sometimes was more like a poor African country with lots of dirt and bad smell in the streets. A very weird mix of people which is defintely not feeling like Italy or Europe...! Secondly, the check-in process took at least 25 - 30 mins, and guess what!?? Every single person or couple who entered this Morgana hotel had to wait in a filthy reception for at least 20 mins because the rooms were always not ready and we, as any other travellers coming to Rome, had just arrived from the airport and looking forward to start our holiday which left us very disappointed given that the hotel knows we're arriving at this time in advance (which is in the normal check-in hours i.e after 2 pm). Third, the most disgusting room we have ever been to...!! We have found WORMS and INSECTS in some parts of the room (near the wardrobe and behind the mini bar) which was unbelievable especially in a 4 star hotel that cost 150 EUR per night (which now I confidently cannot give it more than 2 stars... if I'm generous!) Fourth, we purchased a 3-day internet connection (which normally should come free with the price we paid for the room!!! Yet the connection's signal was constantly low and we barely were able to get a decent signal to check our e-mails..! Despite that we got a refund for the 3 days... BUT what a FRUSTRATION Finally, the staff in general were ok (i.e average, not rude nor friendly). However, there was this one lady working in reception who did not speak English!!??, and you can hear from her tone and body language when she was literally screaming on the phone while we were waiting in the reception that she's a very rude and mean person and until now we cannot figure out how the hell did the hotel hire her...!??? I hope this review helps others to avoid disappointment and waste of time & money in such a crap place...!

Reviews.Title: “location was great, staff were great and would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: anne245
Reviews.Content: Stayed with Mum & 2 sisters so needed a large room. Mum can have difficulty walking at times so priorities were proximity to the station as our train was arriving back into Rome around 6pm and we wanted to stay somewhere clean, comfortable and convenient to station for going sightseeing. Also wanted somewhere that had facility for keeping our luggage after checkout as out flight did not leave Rome again until 10pm. Again, after reading mixed reports we were nervous about booking this hotel, but on arrival we were not disappointed. The guy that checked us in was fantastic (not sure of name but spoke really good English with an American accent). All staff were good but he was exceptional and really deserves praise for his helpfulness. The room was good and comfortable (some fluff under the beds) but the bathroom was really tiny. What appeared as a large King Size bed was actually 2 single beds beside each other which suited us perfectly. Our room overlooked the street but even with the windows open the noise didn’t affect our sleep. Disappointed that the fridge didn’t work and seemed to switch off when the room card was removed from the electric socket which was odd but we didn’t complain. Breakfast was the best we had in Italy and for the first time in a week we saw scrambled eggs and hot bacon instead of just breads and fruit which was great. Only downside was that the lift was very small (only holds 2 people with suitcase) and a lot of steps throughout which could cause problems for the less abled but my Mum coped ok and would be happy to stay there again as would the rest of us. p.s. I am always surprised when people are disappointed that the bedding isn't changed everyday - do they change their bedding at home every day??

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but very small room and questionable service...”
Reviews.Author: ItchyFeetBunny
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Italy yesterday and I can't wait to come up here and write my reviews about this hotel. I don't usually write reviews unless it's extremely good and bad. We booked a room with this hotel after reading many reviews online and I found none of them was really close to what we had encountered, so I thought to share my two cents worth here. The only good thing about this hotel is its distance to the Termini and a decent mattress. The receptionists, especially a lady, was rude and completely unhelpful. Granted that everyone has a bad day or two; but after receiving two days of her rude and unfriendly attitude, I think she really hates her job. The room is very, very , VERY small. The pictures used in this profile is quite misleading. We barely have enough room to walk around after we put down our two roller-back carry-on luggages! The restroom is very small too.
