It does have a shower but if you don't close the door right, you will have a flooded floor when you walk out. Yes, the hotel does have wifi, but it's not free. It's 10 Euro for 24 hours, by clock time, not usage time. If you got your promo deal through Orbitz..Com for 79 Euro a night or less, chances are it does not including free Wifi service and breakfast. I don't know if it's standard, but they don't change bedsheet on daily basis either, you will have to request that.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, bargain, friendly service would recommend”
Reviews.Author: LLandaYorkshire
Reviews.Content: we stayed June 2009 and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. the location was excellent regardless of reviews stating the station is not the place to stay, it is. The best value and top location. Our room was clean as a standard it was ample room and with elegant proportions. The staff on the desk were helpful at all times, there is a luggage room for late departures although we did not have breakfast it smelt wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: TravelluverCoDown
Reviews.Content: We were quite selective choosing this hotel for the 2nd part of our one week Italian holiday as we think a good hotel is important as a haven in a busy city-break. Favourable 1st impressions after walking through the (locked) front door (area seemed slightly dodgy). Reception is quite high class with plenty of comfy seats and nooks and crannies to have relaxing conversation. This would have been nice with a glass of wine but unfortunately they had run out!!! Our room was well appointed but incredibly cramped with the bed taking up most of the space and plenty of hard edges to stub your toe while negotiating around the bed to the bathroom bleary-eyed in the middle of the night. The colour scheme is unusual and to be honest hard to describe -- the opinion of an interior decorator would be interesting, but we would call it 'fussy'. A terrible view out our window of a 10 storey block of kitchens, bedrooms and hanging washing - all no more than 10 meters away. But the location was fine for access to everywhere by metro, bus, train, taxi and in our case mostly foot. The area turned out to be fine (apart from waiters trying to pull you into their restaurant every few steps and at any time of the day). Staff were attentive; breakfast was ok in a very comfortable breakfast room. Our one big gripe was on returning to our room at the end of one full day sightseeing, we found the door lying wide open with access to anyone passing -- to me a major lapse in security and privacy that I have never experienced before. Reception did not initially seem to think this important, but when I told them I was very shocked and angry they said sorry. All in all we unfortunately doubt if we would return to Morgana.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: TheECs
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during a long weekend. We chose it because it seemed easy to find from the train station. And sure enough it was a 5 minute walk from the station. The reception staff were very helpful. We had a room on the 3rd floor on the used the lift when taking our baggage up to the room, they are a little to cosy for my liking, but after that I only used them the day we left to bring the cases back down. The children enjoyed seeing which was the fastest, them in the lift or me on the stairs, I won on a few occassions. We had a quadruple room it was adequate for what we were using it for. The bath room had a good bath with handheld shower, at least the water pressure was good on the shower. I think my major complaint was the firmness of the mattresses, I think the floor had more give in it and certainly I struggled to find a comfortable position to sleep in. The room did say it had air conditioning, Not sure if it did or didn't as the room never cooled down. Also not all the power points worked we had to choose between the TV and the fridge, the fridge winning due to it cooling the water we had bought. Breakfast was typical european cold meats, bread etc etc. I did find some of the chairs and tables used a little strange. They were more like arm chairs than dining chairs as a result you sat on the end of your seat. Due to the proximity to the train station it was easy getting around and there seemed plenty of resturants to choose from. All in all the location of this hotel was key and here it does not let itself down, however slightly more comfortable beds and better electrics would have been nice also

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are very small and noisy”
Reviews.Author: hatchFreeport
Reviews.Content: After reading mostly good reviews about this hotel, we were very disappointed in the room. We were located on the street side of the hotel which was noisy 24-7, leaving us no choice but to close the window. Since the weather had turned warm, we asked that the air conditioner be turned on but was told that it was not available until mid May. The room was small and the breakfast service took forever due to a shortage of waiters.

Reviews.Title: “Once was enough”
Reviews.Author: Bono51
Reviews.Content: Tne good things about the hotel are it 's location to trains and metro and the fact that it was clean. The water pressure from the shower was also fantastic. On the other side, staff attitudes varied from poor to somewhat helpful. Our first room, on the street was very noisy all the time. Our second room on the court yard was fairly quiet at night but got noisy at around 5AM. A/C is not turned on until the end of May, no matter how hot it gets and it was hot during our stay. The breakfast could have been alright but ran out of food quickly. Hotel would be just OK with a room on the courtyard if the A/C was working.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe their advertising”
Reviews.Author: 352pres
Reviews.Content: Advertise parking which is non-existent, advertise wired internet which is non existent, and wireless internet is atrocious both in rooms and lobby. Staff at front desk not very helpful. Too few staff in breakfast room at peak times. Cramped rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: ehyp
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel and would stay there again. I was traveling with my two daughters, I found this hotel to be very clean, safe and well decorated and roomy for a European hotel. The bathrooms were very nice. The staff was friendly the breakfast was good. The location to the train and metro station was one block. The only disadvantage was downtown Rome was a bit of a walk, we took the metro the second day and at night took a taxi back to the hotel for under 20E. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Friendly, helpful staff. Excellent breakfasts.”
Reviews.Author: LuvCHOCOL8
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at the Morgana very much. Comfy beds in nice rooms. Friendly, helpful staff (they patiently answered our many questions about Rome, etc). Fixed our reservation glitches quickly. Excellent breakfasts (eggs, ham/bacon, pastries, croissants, cheeses, yogurt, granola, juice, etc) in a charming room with friendly staff/servers. Secure, safe hotel in a quiet area, very close to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: PipUKBerkshire
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from a very quick stay in Rome. We stayed in Hotel Morgana overnight on 28 February, we had two single rooms. What a lovely hotel and they could not do enough for us! The rooms were really nice, small doubles and having arrived early, they allowed us to check in to one room so we could pop our bags in and not have to carry them around, We also left our bags at the hotel whilst we went sightseeing on the Sunday. Was a lovely stay and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Staff. Let down by the Room”
Reviews.Author: Coachers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Morgana Hotel for 3 nights in February while in the city to watch the Italy v Ireland Rugby match. Even before we arrived at the hotel the staff were helpful and sent directions to the hotel from Termini Station via email, although we misinterpreted their instruction slightly wrong and ended up doing a lap around the station. We soon realised though that you simply go out the ‘GIOLITTI’ exit, cross the road, take the first street of the left and it is then on the street on the next left. Not even a 10-minute walk. The location is probably the hotels greatest selling point as it is close to everything. A 15-20 minute walk will take you to the main tourist hotspots and we never had to take a taxi or tram once during our stay, yet covered most of the sites. Even the walk to the stadium was only about 45-50mins. As for the hotel itself, it is very clean and has a certain character about it. A quick read in the visitors book will show that all nationalities use the hotel and there were very few negative comments. The only major negatives we had were around the size of the room (400). Lets just say it only took the cleaner 30 seconds to hoover the small patch of carpet in the room. We maybe struck it unlucky, but our double room would not even be classed as a single in some hotels. The smallest, most uncomfortable bed, that you could only get into from one side, as it was jammed up against the wall on the other side. There was one tiny wardrobe hid away in a corner that was about 4ft tall, which we didn’t even try to use. Saying all that, I am of the opinion that we don’t go away to spend all our time in the hotel room and we were rarely in it. If we had of wanted to do that and have a larger room, we would have spent our money in a more expensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: 30statesJo
Reviews.Content: Spent a January weekend break with a large group of friennds at the Morgana. We had a range of rooms, and we were all located helpfully on the same floor. Our room overlooked a small courtyard and it was nice to be able to open a window and listen to the sounds of Roman life. Although small, the room had everything you need, including a tv with bbc worldservice for the football results! Bathroom was bright and clean, with a jacuzzi bath (very difficult to turn off - be warned!) Location was excellent - walked from the Termini station to the hotel in a few minutes. Plenty of restaurants in the area and shops, cash points, bars around too. We found it easy to get around and enjoy the sights of Rome. Front desk has an excellent supply of maps - just ask. Breakfast was ample; a small selection of cooked food, cereal and pastries. Order hot drinks from the waitress! We found all the staff to be very friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again, as would our friends, and are looking forward to going back to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sealuvr33
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 17 day stay in Italy with my 3 children and mother. We stayed in Rome at the start of our trip then traveled south to Sicily and worked our way back up to Rome for our last night. The last place we stayed was Hotel Morgana for one night. What a welcome change it was. It is a very clean and beautiful hotel! The beds are comfy and the rooms are warm and quiet. The showers were clean and big with a nice bathtub and hot water that lasted forever. The service is beyond what we had anywhere else in Italy. The price was very good too. We had two adjoining rooms for the 5 of us and only paid 175 euro for the night. We had free wifi from anywhere in the building...including our room. In other hotels we had to pay for the wifi and only use it in the lobby. My teen was thrilled to use her laptop and catch up with friends after being out of touch for the last two weeks. I didn't have to worry about her being down in the lobby alone because she could use it from the room. The breakfast was excellent. It was in a very pretty room with big comfy chairs and great service. It included scrambled eggs and meats and lots of other choices that we had not seen before in more expensive hotels. The staff spoke very good english...which at this point in the trip was a nice relief to us. The hotel is within walking distance (2 blocks) to the termini train station...so no 30 Euro fee for a taxi. Before the trip I was under the impression that it was not a good idea to stay near termini. But it was fine and nice to be so close to the metro, buses, and trains to go anywhere in Rome easily. We had stayed near piazza navona at the start of our trip and it was nice to be on the little cobble stone streets in the quiet area of Rome. But I would not do it again since everything closes and you are away from the action. This hotel was safe and very beautiful inside. I highly recomend Hotel Morgana for anyone staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: travelhappyCanada
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay in Rome at this hotel. Staff very helpful. Breakfast room delightful and great breakfast. Found the breakfast staff to be run off their feet; however, a little patience and appreciation goes a long way. Room was clean and comfortable - we did not experience any of the problems that others had. Close to the metro and buses. Great little restaurant across the street. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Rome and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: joshua08
Reviews.Content: Easy to find just a street from the termini. Good hotel, we booked two rooms and both were of a good standard, clean and comfortable, Hotel recetion staff were so helpfull and spoke really good english. it was not as close to the sights as i thought, but we managed to find our way around. Spent four days seeing the magnificent sights of Rome and came home tired but happy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: FitzyBirmingham
Reviews.Content: The location was great, the staff were friendly & the room was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: ihc49
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Morgana for 4 nights. We had booked a 'deluxe double room' through the hotel's website, and had a confirmed late check in. The room given to us was at best depressing - dingy, old and dirty carpets, shabby bedspreads and was so small (and no I am not complaining by American standards, I am aware of European hotel room sizes), I wonder what a standard room would have been! The bathroom was supposed to be designer marble with a Jacuzzi (as advertised on their website for a deluxe room) but it wasn't anywhere close to the pics we had we seen on the website. Okay, it had a jetted tub, but it wouldn't drain - worse even when you realize it at midnight with soap all over you! So we called front desk, and they sent someone to look at it half an hour later and refused to give us another room. The guy comes in around 12:30 am, and after 15 mins says he cannot fix it and needs a plumber to come in the next morning. He got rid of some of the water using a bucket but by no means we could have taken a shower there. I argued with the front desk, and finally they gave us keys to another room in the 4th floor (we were on the 2nd), to go take a shower in the morning! So much for the first night and if I haven't mentioned yet, the room was also a street facing one, so lots of noise! The next morning after much argument (they said they would fix the tub for us), they agreed to give us another room around 2 pm when they start checking in people. I must say the staff was really rude, never a word of apology, infact they were mad at us for complaining about the tub! The hotel manager even told me why am I complaining about the tub since I got a good internet price (130eu) - can you believe that? Anyhow, they supposedly gave us another deluxe room, which was even dingier, and the Jacuzzi had cracks and molds all over - we showed it to the hotel staff and so they finally agreed to give us an executive room !!! I think their deluxe room is a farce, don't book one, you may be better off with a standard or superior double. The executive rooms are quite good - they have nice clean, contemporary decor, feel bright and airy which was quite a welcome change! The breakfast is fairly good, their cappuccino is quite good (make sure you ask for it), the rest of the staff is Okay - don't expect American hospitality there! They did give me the complimentary ride to the airport (as part of the deluxe package deal for 3 nights), make sure you confirm your date and time at the front desk one day early else your ride may not be available on the day of your departure - I noticed they do not keep a record of it and when you go remind them, they put it down in their dairy! Overall, I would not stay there and if you did, I suggest you take an executive room - they sometimes give decent rates online. The termini area is OK, not as seedy as I had expected but then you have to be careful in Rome. My feeling is most of the hotels in the Termini area would be similar, Morgana is by no means a 3/4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Morgana .. great location but bit pricey!”
Reviews.Author: jcscSydney
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed at Hotel Morgana for 1 night the end of May this year, before flying out to Australia the next morning. We booked this hotel because it was so close to the main railway station (for catching the Da Vinci Express to the International Airport), and we knew we would be hauling heavy luggage on our own. This place is quite literally 2 minutes around the corner from the entrance to the station through a cafe, and of course, the platform for Da Vinci Express is the first platform you come to. It could not have been more perfect for location. However, the lifts would have to have been the smallest we saw in the whole of Italy..the smaller one only having room for my husband and his one suitcase (we are not large people). Lovely quiet room at the back, modern contemporary room and ensuite, just smallish on all scales. What can you expect in Roma, one of the most expensive cities in the world. And we paid euro192.50 for the one night (Room 404).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: s-trella5
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and I recommend it to anyone looking for a convenient budget hotel in Rome. It is very close to the train station (2 min walk)/metro and also walkable to other sites (15 min walk to Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps). Most of all, for the price you cannot beat the quality of the hotel. The rooms are very sleek/trendy and the service is fantastic. We ended up staying here by chance because it was the only hotel available at a decent rate, and we loved it. I have stayed at many budget hotels in Italy, and this by far is the best. We paid 100 Euro per night, and it was well worth it.. The breakfast was standard, the room was fantastic, very clean, and the staff was very helpful. There are many restaurants nearby as well. I would definitely stay here again. If you are looking for a gem at a decent price, this is it! I suggest you book through the hotel's website - that had the best rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to train station, nice rooms, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: LittleIndian
Reviews.Content: As others have said, very close (a block) from the train station and the rooms are very nice. Breakfast was nice with sliced meat in addition to the dry goods. Coffee was great - they even heated the milk. Location to other things was a bit of a walk, but the Metro was in the train station and easy to use also. Our tours took off from a place about 6 blocks away, but a nice walk. Desk staff were helpful, but not overly friendly and elevator was miniature - not sure you could get a wheelchair in. The price seemed steep for the rooms, but we were there over Easter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tanichka
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. Very nice stay. Exellent location..located near Termini station. about 2 minutes walk. very convient if you travel with laggage..I didnt hear any noise in night time.. I had a room for single person. it was kind of small .. most rooms like that in Italy.. But very clean..Shower was great.. Breakfast if OK as well.... Staff was nice and polite.Certantly its kind of pricy.. But check rates of their web.. i think sometimes they have speials for 3 nights. and its much cheaper then to book on other web sites.. I would definetly stay there again .. unless i will look for something cheaper.... Its 3 star hotel... and its good 3 star hotel.. So. just recommend

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tomthecat
Reviews.Content: arrived at the termini station asked directions,and walked literally 3 minutes to the hotel. some girls off our flight didn't know where the hotel was so jumped into a taxi and were charged 14euros!!! it took more time to load the cases into the boot than it did to drive to the hotel! BEWARE!!! were we offered a seat while we waited to check in, then the bellboy took our cases up to our room. the lifts are very small, one only takes 2 people and the other takes 3. our room at the back of the hotel had a view of washing lines and windows to other apartments, so ask for a room at the front. it didn't bother us at all as we were only sleeping there. the usual toiletries were supplied along with the largest bath towels we've ever seen! the handtowels weren't up to much though, like a cloth material. room had tv, phone,fridge, quite a hard bed, wardrobes etc. the walls were covered in a patterened material (strange?) no mini bar but you just had to ring room service for food and drinks required. the breakfast room was clean and large enough not to have to wait for a table and there was a good choice. cereals,fruit,yoghurts,cheese,cold meats,pasteries,various bread buns,tea,coffee,juices...etc. and you weren't rushed to leave. breakfast is from 6.45-10.00am the location is great, we walked to most of the sights. did the tour bus but it was a waste of time really as you can walk to all of the places it goes to. nearby the hotel are bars,restaurants,shops etc. but late at night round by the station there are a lot of beggars,tramps etc which can make you feel uneasy so avoid that area. overall a brilliant 3* hotel. we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “finski”
Reviews.Author: finskiLohja
Reviews.Content: breakfast good,clean,just ok

Reviews.Title: “Good value at £50 aq night”
Reviews.Author: JA/IRBolton
Reviews.Content: Wanted a cheap 3 day break in Rome so used Jet2.com £70 return and the Morgana £150 for 3 nights and we got a good value break. For the room rate we paid the hotel is good value we had the standard room which is a little on the small size, however the room was clean and bed was comfy. The room had sky tv, fridge and safe. We overlooked the inner courtyard and have to say was so quiet considering we were in the centre of Rome. Breakfast was included in our rate a good continental breakfast was offered, tea, coffee, fruit juice, ham , turkey slices, cheese, fruit and danish pastries. A liittle more attention to detail is required table were often not set correctly for example milk jug missing for your tea so you needed to ask. Many people who have reviewed the hotel have not liked the location we feel this is the best advantage. 4 min walk from the Termini station. This made getting from the airport so easy and getting around Rome so easy. You can get the 3 day pass for 11 euros and use the underground and buses and trams. If you got lost 99% of the bus went back to the Termini as we found the underground closed very early at night and had to use the bus. Think it would have been very difficult to use the bus if your hotel is not in a good location. If you plan to visit the Vatican one tip prebook your tour with an authorised guide, you get priority access to the Vatican the queue in November was over 2 hrs long before you got inside (3 hours in the summer) , then you had to queue for a ticket again and then again if you wanted head sets, we were inside within 10 minutes and because there is so much to see the guide brings it alive for you. Enjoy your trip we did!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: sguner
Reviews.Content: Very close to rail station but not much else. Expensive. Breakfast and breakfast room were very nice. Staff helpful in arranging tours.

Reviews.Title: “only good part of Italy”
Reviews.Author: staslynn
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel Morgana was the only good part of our stay in Rome the staff rancked 10/10 they spoke english and went out of there way to help us If you have to go to Rome then stay there. Happy Aussie

Reviews.Title: “Taking chances at the Morgana”
Reviews.Author: Pretavoyage
Reviews.Content: The fact that this hotel is located near the Roma Termini does not compensate for the other inconveniences. You are not within walking distance of anything truly worth seeing or experiencing. Unless you are on an extreme budget, do not stay in the standard room in the summer. Really long story short is that standard rooms have an antiquated standing air conditioning unit in the room that does not work (the same expereince with both rooms we booked). Deluxe rooms have central heat and air, but only the newer ones work properly. If you complain about the temperature, the front desk staff will try to convince you (from the front desk) that everything is fine and it is IMPOSSIBLE that it is not. We had to change one of the rooms we booked 3 times and we only stayed two nights. This was during 2 days of over 37C degree weather. To find a good restaurant you should walk to the other side of the Termini. The ones in close proximity of the hotel are mediocre at best (food and service). The breakfast at the hotel does not look fresh and does not have much of a selection. The majority of the reception desk staff was not informed about their area or did not want to take the time to explain it to you. I do have to commend one staff member who worked the desk during the evening shift and was the only one concerned with our well being and comfort. He was the only one who apologized for our inconvenience. He was also the only one to recommend several options for restaurants and transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Morgana!”
Reviews.Author: transplantnewyorker
Reviews.Content: Staff is very helpful and courteous. As a solo female traveler, I felt very comfortable and safe here. I will definitely stay at the Morgana again. It is in a very convenient location (Termini Station and all the buses).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for getting around”
Reviews.Author: chriskis
Reviews.Content: We had not booked this hotel but the Hotel Kennedy 50 yards down the road. As they were overbooked, we were sent to the Morgana and we were well pleased when we saw it. It is not in the most celubrious area, but being near the Termini, it was to be expected. We chose a hotel near the Termini as we had come by train from the airport and we were travelling to Civitavecchia the next day. We were given a large room, well furnished and very clean. The bathroom was very old, but clean but with very dim lighting. One plus point as far as we were concerned is that the hotel is totally non-smoking. The staff were very helpful and the breakfast is good. The big plus point of the hotel is really the location for getting around Rome on the buses, metro etc. You can pick up all the transportation you might want or need within a couple of minutes walk.. We found a good restaurant, Le Ginestre very close to the hotel and had two really good meals there for a very reasonable price. The staff were really pleasant and happy! This hotel might not suit everybody, but for what we wanted, it suited us down to the ground. We would love to return to Rome and would definitely consider this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Most horrible place I stayed in all Europe”
Reviews.Author: mavey1010
Reviews.Content: I traveled through four countries in Europe last summer and stayed in many hotels and hostels. The final city visited was Rome. We chose to stay in Hotel Morgana and regretted every second spent there. The staff was absolutely terrible. They actually told us (despite spending over $200 per night for the room) that we were "economy guests" and therefore not their priority. It is an understatement to say that the staff was rude and unfriendly to us. There were ceiling tiles missing from the hallway leading to our room. Wiring and pipes were visible. The room was NOT as pictured. It was shabby and the wall paper was peeling off. The hotel messed up our reservations and it was quite a hassle to correct their mistake. I stayed in places that only cost $15 per night, and I was treated kindly. Hotel Morgana was by far the most horrible hotel that I have ever visited. Do NOT book this hotel if you are looking for a comfortable stay in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Very convienient”
Reviews.Author: FLKaman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located about two blocks from Termini train station. From here you can get just about anywhere. There are local metro stops and many busses and even tour bus stops. This area is a little run down, but the convienence and wonderful staff, make a stay here worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TouchRugby
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, close to the main Termini - train station. The hotel rooms are small, but clean and comfortable, with the bathrooms also being clean. The buffet breakfast is the best, plenty of choice, and loads of refills of coffee. The staff are very friendly, and helpful. The hotel is a great place to stay to explore Rome, the bus/metro station is only a few minutes away. Would totally recommend this hotel to anyone going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel and small room”
Reviews.Author: atirona1024
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the small room all the way at the end of the hallway on the second floor. Bathroom is small. Bathtub needs some caulking. Green carpet had stain. Ceiling had water stain and wallpapers were fading. I forgot to mention bring shampoo and contidioner. All in all the hotel needs some renovation. But they have friendly staff who speaks English fluently. We love the restaurant a few doors away from the Hotel. La Ginestra, Mark and Mohammed were both friendly and nice. Good food and inexpensive price. The restaurant is clean and cozy. My husband loved the Calzone and I loved the Rice fish (mussels, prawns, shrimps and clams) yummy! Next time we go to Rome we probably choose hotels by the Spanish step area. Nice shopping area all famous brand name. In Rome people are warm, nice and very historical site. Easy access to Metro and Bus. Enjoy! Scorpio 24, San Francisco, CA USA

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: KayHereford
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at hotel with two teenage sons . Hotel was fine, good location near to termini. Breakfast was great, cereal, rolls with ham and cheese, yoghurts, fruit and pastries. Staff friendly. Small tip - if you have guitar playing teenage boys like me visit the Hard Rock Cafe - they loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money very much so”
Reviews.Author: ROVER64
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel ,good value ,friendly and efficent staff , well stocked breakfast room ,rooms not large but clean and comfortable. Termini area not the most appealing but encountered no trouble. Must recommend the Trattoria Giovanni across the road,wondeful atmosphere and made very welcome by Valentino and his merry band..

Reviews.Title: “Impressive little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: aseal
Reviews.Content: After having looked at the hotel's own website and several review websites we booked into the Hotel Morgana for a week just before Christmas. As always with booking over the internet it's hard to know what to expect, but after arriving we were both very impressed. We had one of their "Superior" double rooms and although not exactly palatial the size of the room was perfectly adequate. The decor both in the room and generally throughout the hotel was very nice, though the fabric covered walls might not be to everyones taste, it was clearly well maintained and clean. The bed was comfortable although one minor gripe was the fact the mattress was two singles pushed together which can be troublesome. The only thing we would have added to the room would have been tea and coffee making facilities... The en-suite bathroom was very well appointed and quite large. Actually had a bath in it, which I was surprised at given how relatively inexpensive the room was, which made getting washed in the evening before going out again more relaxing. Staff were always helpful and courteous. The breakfast buffet was quite nice, with a largish selection. As for food in the evening there were quite a few decent places on the same street as the hotel for when you didn't fancy walking a long way (you really need to go to the place across the street once during your stay for the comedy maitre d'). Before I booked I had been quite apprehensive of the area as I had seen reports that it was a bit grim crime wise etc. but to be honest I found it about par for the course for a European city (no worse or better than London where I live). Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate”
Reviews.Author: MikeBirch
Reviews.Content: Having read the existing reviews on this site, was concerned about personal safety in what appeared to be a "seedy" area. Need not have worried; yes, the area this side of the Termini station IS a bit run down but it is always so very busy with people and traffic that I never felt at risk at all. Beware solo travellers: my single room was right by the lift shaft and the intermittent noise of the mechanism was a slight problem. If booking a single room, ask for one removed from the lift shaft. Breakfast was very difficult to eat seated on an armchair! Having said that, the staff were reasonably friendly, the room was clean and well-appointed, and the convenience of the location near the main transport hub of the station was excellent. Breakfast was good and plentiful. Overall, a pleasant (but not exceptional) stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not safe”
Reviews.Author: dixiedean
Reviews.Content: I could not fault this hotel for the price. The rooms were decent size, clean and well decorated with a good bathroom. The breakfast was adequate although basically rolls and coffee. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Also the hotel is situated near all the transport links which are easy to use. However, it takes 7 minutes to walk from the main station to the hotel and at night you encounter homeless people and groups of men drinking heavily. Rome is great to see at night but taxis are hard to get and it is simply not worth taking the risk of walking in that area. If you stick to the adage of not doing different to what you do at home then I dont believe anyone in the World would walk out at night in these conditions, certainly not in England. Stay safe and give this place a miss.

Reviews.Title: “convenient for train station and bus tours.”
Reviews.Author: croesio
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient for travelling. It is literally 2-3 minutes from the train station and you can also take the bus tours from the same site. There are many places to eat in the vicinity.Although the area is a little seedy, we did not have any problems. The rooms and bathroom were clean although a little small. The hotel lifts were tiny, only allowing 2 /3 people at a time. I preferred to walk. Breakfast was cold buffet and was ample. The staff were friendly enough, although we only saw them on the way in and out. If visiting Rome again I would probably choose another hotel perhaps closer to some of the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: billsman1
Reviews.Content: Having not read the reviews on Hotel Morgana before staying there, I am quite shocked at the generous ratings it was given. For full disclosure I will give both the good and bad. I admit the hotel was generally clean (in the lobby and common areas) and the staff were nice and obliging when we interacted. Now for the bad. The rooms were very small and a bit musty. Everything in the room looked like it was 20 years old, including the wall paper. Generally for the right price I can live with that, but the location of the hotel is not in a very convenient area. It is located two blocks from the train station which at night is a seedy area to be in. There are no restaurants or shops or bars or sites that one would want to go to within almost a half mile. Yes this is a typical area for big cities, but that does not mean one has to stay there. If/when I go back to Rome I would rather stay in the center of town, Piazza Venezia area, which is near all the major sites and restaurants. The worst thing was that it is hard to get cabs in Rome (at least it was in June) so we would have to walk to the hotel at night. This took an inordinate amount of time and was just not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Tashtego
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights in the middle of July. The room we were given was so small we had to unpack at seperate times because there wasn't enough room for both suitcases. The bed (and pillows) seemed quite old. Having said that, the bathroom seemed quite new and was okay, except for the leaking shower which left a puddle of water on the floor. Reception staff weren't very friendly and basically only spoke to us upon our arrival and checkout. There is a good bar/reading area and breakfast room. The hotel is located in quite a seedy area although it is very handy to the Termini and is within easy walking distance to the Colosseum, Piazza del Popolo, Spanish Stairs and Republica. There's also a hop on hop off bus stop located at Piazza Santa Maria Maggiore which is a about two blocks from the hotel. Overall nothing flash but did the job. Would stay somewhere else if we were to go to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: cdmramgirl
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay at Hotel Morgana. Staff was friendly, rooms were clean and pleasant. Our bathroom was of good size, and the room was plenty of room. The staff was friendly and helpful, and recommended a fabulous Trattoria called Nouva Stella. The location couldn't be better, right around the corner from the Termini Station. We used the underground, the buses, the trains, and the 110 Open tour bus, so it couldn't have been any better for us. The rooms were soundproofed, so it was a good night's sleep. The breakfast in the morning was good, and the workers were pleasant and helpful. We also have read reviews about this being a seedy area, but did not find it to be so. We were two women travelers, and we walked at night a few times, and never felt unsafe. We would certainly stay at Hotel Morgana again if ever in Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: StefandMandy
Reviews.Content: Having used this site again to review accomodation, we had a fantastic stay. A family meet up (us from the UK, in-laws from australia and Spain) and no complaints at all. The hotel is clean, the staff were great, and the location puts you in easy walking distance of all the sights bar the vatican which is quite a hike. Some reviews use the word seedy for the location, but it is just typical of a large city. We walked around at night and NEVER felt threatened or intimidated. I cannot recommend a cheap eatery/water hole as Roma is not cheap, but neither is London or Paris. Food however is of a good standard basically anywhere round the hotel. If you do seek cheaper, stay off the main roads and look at the menus and prices before you sit down. The hotel is near the termini which is the base for buses and trains, however the hotel is sound proofed and the windows are covered to the extent to make an air-raid shelter blush so sleeping is a delight. The decor of the hotel is to die for, and so is the breakfast. If you want to see Roma consider the open top tour bus at the termini, you can hop on and off at all the sites, and the price (23 euros) includes headphones so whilst you are going from place to place you have a guided tour! If you want to see Roma you need to be able to walk distances, consider this and your stay will be ace. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: counselme
Reviews.Content: Based on many of the reviews here and several guide books, we decided to try the Morgana. We were not disappointed at all. It was a charming hotel and a great location. Yes, the area is a little seedy, but I never felt unsafe. Lots of great little restaurants - our favorite was a recommendation from Rachelle at the desk, the Nuovo Stella, if I remember correctly. Best eggplant parmagiana I have EVER tasted. The room was small and the tub had a very narrow bottom to it that made standing in it to shower a challenge, but the breakfast was wonderful and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base in Rome”
Reviews.Author: saraflo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Morgana at the end of March 2006. It really is a perfect base to see Rome. Termini is just round the corner and from here you can get the bus to all the important places in Rome. The hotel staff are friendly and the hotel is spotlessly clean. Our room was on the small side but very comfortable and the bathroom was roomy and well laid out. The breakfast is the usual continental fayre but there was plenty of it our favourites were the freshly baked crusty baps and croissants really very good!! Even though the hotel is so close to the station we never felt less than totally safe and relaxed. We would definately use the hotel again and have reccomended it to my niece who is going to Rome in July.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was just O.K.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Morgana was just average. When we arrived we had a 30 min wait to get into our room while they processed paperwork. Our room which was supposed to be a triple was barely enough room for us to get past each other when we were up and moving around, however, we didn't spend much time in the room so we managed. Breakfast was the same every day. One could find better breakfast and coffee in town. Location wasn't the greatest if you were looking to walk to places. We had a stroller we were lugging around, so if you would rather walk to see places, staying around the Spanish Steps or Trevi Fountain area would probably work better to be more centrally located. The first night we were there we asked the reception for a recommendation for somewhere to eat. They sent us across the street to a restaurant that the owner must be a friend. Food was just okay but the prices were very high. The best part about Hotel Morgana was a very nice young lady named Helvire who babysat for us on New Year's Eve. I would recommend her to ANYONE who was looking for someone trustworthy to watch their children if they wanted a night out on the town without their kids! I think if you're a couple without children this would be an okay hotel for you. If you have children, I think somewhere more centrally located would serve your needs better.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near the Termini”
Reviews.Author: dianadln
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Morgana for a total of 4 nights and I was satisfied with the room for the price I paid. The rate I got was 95 Euro/night, which is $104.50/per night and I was satisfied with the room given to me. The best part about this hotel is its location. If you are planning on traveling around Italy, I would look for a room near the Termini Station. Being near a Metro also will save you money traveling around Rome. Massimo, the front desk person, checked us in. He's not the friendliest, but will give you directions if you ask. I would have to say the hotel staff is not the friendliest. The complimentary breakfast is pretty reasonable. Breads, croissants, donuts, cereal, meat, cheese, yogurt, and coffee. There is a pretty good restaurant across the street called Giovanni. You must try the prosciutto and mozzarella. There is a restaurant next to the hotel, i can't remember the name, but try to avoid it. Overall, Hotel Morgana served as a good hotel for the price I paid. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for our first time in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We looked at hotels all over Rome before booking at the Morgana. The first plus was having pick-up service from the airport to the hotel. The driver was very nice and gave us his "interesting" description of some of Rome's ancient architecture as we passed by. We arrived earlier than normal check-in and were lucky to get right into our room. We discovered quickly just how close we were to Termini Train Station (and the Metro - the second plus) and with our daughter studying in Rome we were fortunate to have someone show us how to get around. The staff was helpful, the breakfast more than sufficient and as another writer described, the Ristoranti directly across the street was a delight. Only real minuses were the size of the shower (if you have been on cruise ships you will not be surprised that they can make showers this small) and a bit of difficulty with the fluctuation in room temperature. We felt very safe in the area around the hotel and there was a laundromat the next street over, so we were able to get some laundry done before going to our next destination in Italy. The Morgana was a very nice hotel for our first trip to Rome and we would recommend it highly as a mid-range hotel.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel value for money”
Reviews.Author: debshusband
Reviews.Content: Booked a family room at the morgana for three nights this easter.First of all the bad news,the room was too small,basicly a twin room with extra beds put in, also the lifts were very small.However the staff were friendly and helpful,the hotel was clean,all amenities in the room worked and the continental breakfast was of good standard.There is a nice lounge area and a small bar just by reception.I thought the location was excellant for discovering Rome with the termini being a stones throw away but we walked to the Colluseum (about twenty mins). The hotel area is not the fashionable part of Rome but we never felt threatened,there is a lovely trattori just on the corner.Overall I would definately recommend this hotel for people not wanting to spend too much on accommodation,why stay in a hotel all day when there's so much to see.I paid £140 a night for the room(slept 4)which is good value for a major european city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, nice rooms but not quite what we expected.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel directly via their website. The reservations went without a hitch and the hotel included a free car transfer from the Fiumicini airport which was a wonderful start. The hotel is indeed only a block and a half away from the train station but you never hear any trains. The noise pollution in Rome itself takes care of that. I have lived in Las Vegas, Los Angeles, Manhattan, and Amsterdam and I have never been in such a noisy city before. It's hard to hear yourself think, sometimes. One of the reasons we booked this hotel is because of the photo's on the website and the fact that they are one of the only hotels in central Rome that offer a family room for 2 children. At 200 euro a night I expected more room for the money. We chose a 'superior' room and got a family room for 3 people with an extra bed shoved up as close to the beautiful old large radiator as possible. The entire room can not be more than 3 x 3,5 and that with 4 beds, a large desk, and a nightstand. (see photo) On the third night, due to the lack of space and unspent energy, our youngest son fell and bumped his head on this radiator causing us to spend an hour in the emergency room at Umberto I hospital and resulting in 2 stitches. The photo's lead you to believe that everything has recently been refurbished and it has, I believe, but the carpet and tapestry that is stapled overall only creates a smothering atmosphere, especially if you suffer from allergies, so be warned. The staff is very friendly but not overly and the breakfast is very simple and the same everyday. We are used to only bread and cheese breakfasts but the quality of food here we felt left a lot to be desired. The hotel is very central but be sure to ask for a room at the back of the hotel. Our room was located in the front and the noise stopped at 1-2 a.m. and recommensed around 6 a.m. The area is a bit seedy and maybe it's just me, but I found a lot of Rome to be borderline seedy and very dirty, not just around the station. If we ever go back to Rome (only for the shopping which was fantastic) we'll head for a hotel located around the Barberini area. There it seemed light and open and definitely cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: rmo
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights in a standar double room. Good location as you can go to many places just walking.The room was small but very clean with a bit dark bathroom but providing what you expect in a three stars hotel.Breakfast was average but enough and all the staff were extremely friendly and helpful.Everything went smoothly from check-in to check-out. If you are tired at night you can try a dinner in Giovanni just across the street and experience a funny local with great food.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel near Termini”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For a two night inexpensive stay close to Metro etc and within walking distance of most sights the Morgana was a good choice. We stayed on the 5th floor in a very clean room (but smallish) at the rear, overlooking other hotel/apartment rooms. I think the rooms on lower floors are more recently redecorated (in red/gold) but ours was fine and very clean. We found the staff very helpful, and the typical continental breakfast (sliced meat, cheese, bread etc.) good. As others have said, the area around Termini is not as attractive as other tourist spots, and I am sure there are more glamourous hotel locations in Rome, but the street was comfortable and safe to walk in, and felt more like a city villiage than a tourist hotspot (at least in Oct). Colosseum is about 15 min walk, Forum 20 min, Vatican is furthest and takes about 45 min (but who's rushing? There's plenty of cafes on the way). We ate in Nuova Stella restaurant round corner (right out of hotel, cross road, got to end of block and turn left) which was really quite good. Not much hassle from street vendors or beggars, but it pays to 'blend in' with the Italians (ie. take sunglasses whatever time of day/night, wear jeans and jumper/bodywarmer even when 25 degrees [but don't sweat - that's uncool], don't show fear when crossing the road [it works - not sure how, but it's fun], and don't take big rucksacks, or dangle big camera's round your neck - and try to speak some Italian - it helps a lot and is only polite). Comfortable little Hotel. We would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good room in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Pinotcanoz
Reviews.Content: We re just back from a 3 night stay at the Morgana. The hotel was very nice and a great value. We paid an extra Euro20 per night for a double room upgrade to a larger and better insulated room. The room was above average size by Roma standards and very quite considering how close to the train station the hotel is located. It was decorated with antiques. The marble bathroom was very nice and had a full bathtub and shower. Our room was spotless and housekeeping did a great job keeping it that way. The breakfast was very good with an assortment of rolls, breads, pastries, cheeses, cereals, juices and coffee. The entire staff was very friendly and worked hard to ensure we had a nice stay. The hotel is located near the main train and bus station, which is great for getting around the city. No need to ever take a taxi, all busses and trains are a few short blocks away. However the area can be a little seedy, especially after 9PM. We never felt threatened or unsafe but its just not as pretty as some of the other areas. Also a big plus was that the hotel offered a free one way transfer to the airport if you book direcly with them. This really saved time after a tiring flight. The limo driver was a fountain of knowledge and really halped us get quickly orientated. We found a great family run restaurant directly across the street from the hotel. Sergio was our waiter at the Trattoria GIOVANNI. 4 course dinner with a good bottle of wine ran Euro30 each. The extensive menu meant we returned several tiimes. All things considered the Morgana is great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would consider staying again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Room tidy, quiet against other guests but not the neighbours. The double-glazing was great, but the aircon needs improving. Once the windows were closed - the room became an oven. Bathroom area was too small. Water pooled in the bottom of the shower. Good breakfast and friendly staff. We stayed more than three nights and got a great complementary tour. We heard good reviews from those who were paying more for rooms with a balcony etc. So I guess you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “We must have visited another hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Chicagojill
Reviews.Content: I can't understand it. Our room looked NOTHING like those in the photos on all the hotel sites. Our "air conditioning" consisted of a small humidifier-like rolling unit from the 70's, with a large tube attached to the window. As long as you stood within 2 inches of the unit, you felt a cool breeze. The decor was clearly 1970's....tile floors, an etched glass chandelier with one light bulb, little other lighting, and etched brown tiles in the bath....at least we were able to get a hot shower. Front desk service was adequate, although they skipped our wake-up call on one day when we were scheduled for a tour, and they were hesitant to call a cab for us when requested. The breakfast and breakfast area were nice, and service was excellent. The Termini area is fairly seedy, particularly at night. Given the price, we expected much more, especially for a 6-night reservation, and we would certainly not recommend this hotel, with all of the choices in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just back from a 6 night stay at the Morgana. The hotel was very nice and a great value for the low rate we paid. The room was average size by european standards. It was decorated with antiques. The marble bathroom was very nice and had a full bathtub and shower. Our room was spotless and housekeeping did a great job keeping it that way. The breakfast was very good with an assortment of rolls,breads,pastries,cheeses, cereals, juices and coffee. The entire staff was very friendly and worked hard to ensure we had a nice stay. The only drawback was the location. The hotel is located near the main train and bus station, which is great for getting around the city. No need to ever take a taxi, all busses and trains are a few short blocks away. However the area can be alittle seedy, we never felt threatened or unsafe but its just not as pretty as some of the other areas we saw. Also a big plus was that the hotel offered a free one way transfer to the airport if you book direcly with them. That saved us time and money as we had a very early flight home. All things considered the Morgana is great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Micho123
Reviews.Content: Hotel Morgana is a perfect hotel for those primarily interested in sightseeing in Rome. It is a quick walk from the hotel to the Metro station which will take you anywhere you want to go in Rome. Since there are so many things to see in Rome, this is very important. No one hotel will ever be close to everything you want to see. It is best to get as close to the metro station as you can in Rome. In this case, Hotel Europa is the place to be. The hotel itself is nice and beautifully decorated. The rooms are small, but large enough to do whatever needs to be done before another day of sightseeing. The bathrooms are of average size and the only complaints we had about the bathroom was the tiny shield that was supposed to keep water in the shower. The first night the bathroom was practically flooded because the water pressure shot the water over the small shield (we learned after that night and it wasn't such a problem). The breakfast buffet is good the first two days, but it NEVER changes. By the last day (we where there five days) my husband and I almost cracked ourselves up because we knew exactly what food to expect. I would recommend venturing out for breakfast after the first two days, especially if you don't enjoy eating the same thing every day. Free or not, it eventually is not worth it! Also, the staff at Hotel Europa will not win any prizes for hospitality. Many are gruff and speak limited English, but it is easy to get past this when you realize how close you are to the metro and the fact that the room is clean. Overall, I would recommend Hotel Europa and we would stay there again when visiting Rome. Happy Travels!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Some reviews said the area (Termini) was a bit dodgy. It seemed okay to me, not brilliant, but okay. There were a few undesirables but it didn't seem any different to any other city we've visited. We were never hassled or felt threatened. Anyway, the hotel was great, we were a bit worried when we turned up on the first night (at 01:00AM) and they said we would have to go to their sister hotel for the night..... but... they sorted and paid for a taxi and the other hotel was great (Royal Court). We returned the next moring and checked in. Staff very friendly and helpful, breakfast.. okay - meat, bread, jam cheese - usual continental stuff. The room was good, aircon, nice clean and modern. Not a massive room but perfectly adequate. We would definately return and recommend. Oh...... and with it being close to Termini station, it means you can get the early train to the Vatican, or Colloseum, or Spanish steps or.........

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, but be aware of location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you're going to Rome, then you should be aware that it is easy to arrive to- and depart from a hotel in the Termini area. And it is nice to have the the central bus station and metro close by. But it isn't terrible close to most of Rome's attractions, and thats our major complaint about this hotel (as well as any hotel in the Termini area). A minor complaint is the small rooms. We thought that when the reviewers spoke of small hotel rooms, it had to do with big americans beeing used to the fact that everything is bigger in the U. S. of A. -- but after having spent 7 nights at Morgana, we totally agree that the rooms are small. Other than that, we had a very-very nice stay. Front desk were very nice and sweet, everyone were easy to understand and speak to (not every italian speak fluently english, to say the least). The rooms were clean, the breakfast buffet were great (and we likede the opening times in the breakfast lounge - it closed at 10:30, which is pretty late compared to most hotels - at least in the northern part of europe). The area around the hotel seemed very safe. We felt very secure - both day and night. All in all a very pleasant stay, and we would absolutely recommend the hotel to others.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Morgana
HotelInfo.Address: Via Filippo Turati 33/37, 00185 Rome, Italy
